definition: ἀγλαός [ ᾱγλᾰ-], ή, όν, also ός, όν Thgn. 985, E. Andr. 135:—

children.definition: splendid, shining, bright, epith. of beautiful objects, ἀ. ὕδωρ Il. 2.307, etc.; γυῖα 19.385, cf. B. 16.103; μηρία Hes. Op. 337; ἥβης ἀ. ἄνθος Tyrt. 10.28, cf. Thgn. l.c., B. 5.154; then generally, splendid, beautiful, ἄποινα Il. 1.23; δῶρα ib. 213, etc.; ἔργα Od. 10.223; ἄλσος Il. 2.506, cf. Pi. N. 4.20, Simon. 13, etc.; noble, glorious, ἀγλαόν [ἐστιν] ἀνδρὶ μάχεσθαι γῆς πέρι Callin. 1.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: beautiful or famous, noble, Il. 2.736, 826, Hes. Sc. 37, Pi. O. 14.7, B. 16.2, etc.: c. dat. rei, famous for a thing, κέρᾳ ἀγλαός, sarcastically, Il. 11.385.— Ep. and Lyr. word, twice in Trag. (lyr.) ἀγλαὰς Θήβας S. OT 152; Νηρηίδος ἀγλαὸν ἕδραν E. l.c.; also in later poetry, as Theoc. 28.3. Adv. ἀγλαῶς Ar. Lys. 640. (Perh. containing base γελα- in reduced form.)
splendidly honoured, Orph. H. 12.8, al.
he of the bright trident, epith. of Poseidon, Pi. O. 1.40.
splendidly shining, Max. 189.
of splendid fame, Orph. H. 31.4; Dor. ἀγλαό-φᾱμος, pr. n. of Thracian mystic, Iamb. VP 28.146, etc.
one who ‘walks in beauty’, Max. 403.
proud of oneʼs burden, Nonn. D. 7.253.
with a splendid voice, Procl. 3.2.
peony, = γλυκυσίδη, Dsc. 3.140, Plin. HN 24.160, Ael. NA 14.24.
rejoicing in beauty, IG 12(1).783 ( Rhodes).

definition: ἀγλαρόν μωρόν, Hsch. ἀγλασινόν· καλόν, Id. ἀγλαυκόν· ἁλυκόν, Id.

children.label: II
children.definition: Ἄγλαυρος, ἡ, daughter of Cecrops, worshipped on the Acropolis at Athens, (Hdt.) 8.53, Paus. 1.18.2.
without polish, inelegantly, Hegesand. 22, cf. Eust. 1295.15.
bright-eyed, beaming, πεύκη S. OT 214 (lyr.).

not sweet, sour, X. Hier. 1.21 ( Comp.), cf. Rhinth. 28; opp. γλυκύς, Arist. Pr. 877b25; οἶνος Luc. Lex. 6; heterocl. acc. ἀγλευκήν, θάλασσαν Nic. Al. 171: metaph., of persons, sour, crabbed, Epich. 140; of the style of Thuc., harsh, Hermog. Id. 2.12, cf. [ Longin.] Rh. p.195 H.

data.ref: Epich. 140; of the style of Thuc.,

definition: ἀγλίη, ἡ, f.l. for αἰγίς, Gal. 19.69.
ἀγλιθάριον, τό, Dim. of ἄγλις, Ruf. ap. Orib. 8.39.10.

ἄγλις, gen. ἄγλῑθος ( ἀγλῖθος Choerob. in Theod. p.327H., ἀγλῖθες Nic. Th. 874), ἡ:— clove of garlic, Antyll. ap. Orib. 8.16.3; = ῥάξ, Dsc. 2.152; mostly pl., head of garlic (cf. κεφαλή), made up of separate cloves, Ar. Ach. 763, V. 680, Hp. Mul. 2.133, Call. Fr. 140.

children.definition: not sticky, Hp. Prorrh. 1.117, Thphr. CP 6.11.16.

definition: ἀγλίτης οἰκέτης, EM 11.45, AB 338, cf. ἀγλεῖτις· οἰκέτις, prob. in Hsch.

children.definition: swan, Hsch.
Thphr. CP 6.14.12 and 18.8.
unhewn, Sch. S. OC 101.

definition: ἀγλῶν ἀγλαός, Hsch. ἀγλωσσεῖν· δυσφημεῖν, Id.

children.definition: want of eloquence, E. Fr. 56, Antipho Soph. 97.
without tongue, of the crocodile, Arist. PA 690b23, cf. Eub. 107.1; of a flute, without reed, Poll. 2.108. Adv. -τως Id. 6.145.

children.label: II
children.definition: lacking in eloquence, Pi. N. 8.24, Ar. Fr. 734, D.Chr. 12.55; dumb, AP 7.191 ( Arch.).
fragment, Plu. Phil. 6; fracture, Pall. in Hp. 12.271C.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hsch.

children.label: III
children.definition: nasalized g, Ion ap. Prisc. Inst. 1.39.

definition: ἀγμείονες βουβῶνες, Hsch. ἀγμή· ἑστία, Id. ἀγμηρόν· ἥσυχον, Id. ἀγμικόν· ἄκρατον, Id.

children.definition: fracture of a bone, περὶ ἀγμῶν, title of treatise by Hp., etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: broken cliff, crag, E. IT 263; pl., Id. Ba. 1094, Nic. Al. 391, St.Byz. s.v. Ὀαξός.

definition: ἀγναῖος καθαρός, Hsch. ἀγναιώτης· ἐπὶ πολὺ κεκαυμένος, Id.

children.definition: Nic. Th. 71 (fort. -κοπος).
inflexible in war, Hsch.
unbending, inflexible, inexorable, Ἔρωτες B. 8.73, Orph. L. 27; τὸ πρὸς ἡδονάς ἄ. Plu. Cat.Mi. 11, cf. APl. 16.278 ( Paul.Sil.); cf. ἄκναμπτος.
not fulled or carded, hence, new, χλαῖνα Pl. Com. 18 D., cf. Plu. QConv. 2.691d.

children.label: II
children.definition: not cleansed, unwashed, ib. 169c.

definition: ἄγναφος, ον, ( γνάπτω) = foreg., Ev.Matt. 9.16, Marc. 2.21, PLond. 2.193v22 (ii A.D.).

children.definition: purity, chastity, λόγων ἔργων τε S. OT 864 (lyr.), coupled with καθαρότης Hp. Morb.Sacr. 1, cf. 1 Ep.Tim. 4.12; τῶν θεῶν Antipho 2.1.10; ἁγνείη δʼ ἐστὶ φρονεῖν ὅσια App.Anth. 4.18.

children.label: II
children.definition: strict observance of religious duties, Pl. Lg. 909e (pl.), etc.; in pl., purifications, ceremonies, Isoc. 11.21, J. BJ prooem. 10 [1.26], BGU 1198.12, etc.
chastity, E. Tr. 501.
place of purification, Chaerem.Hist. 4, cf. AB 267; sacristy, POxy. 840.8.
inclined to chastity, opp. ἀφροδισιαστικός, Arist. HA 488b5.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., purificatory, τὸ ἁ. sin-offering, Ph. 2.206; ἁ. ἡμέρα BGU 993 (ii B. C.).
female purifier, Gloss.

consider as part of purity, make it a point of religion, c. inf., ἁγνεύουσι ἔμψυχον μηδὲν κτείνειν Hdt. 1.140: abs., to be pure, ὄρνιθος ὄρνις πῶς ἂν ἁγνεύοι φαγών ; A. Supp. 226, cf. Lys. 6.51, Pl. Lg. 837c, Alex. 15.6: c. acc. rei, χεῖρας ἁ. E. IT 1227; keep oneself pure from, τινός D. 22.78, Phld. Sto.Herc. 339.15, Luc. Am. 5; also in Med., γυναικός GDI 3636.43 ( Cos).

data.quote: ὄρνιθος ὄρνις πῶς ἂν ἁγνεύοι φαγών ;

children.definition: perform religious ceremonies, officiate, BGU 1201.6 (ii B. C.), cf. 149.8 (ii/iii A.D.).
Med., purify, τὸν νοῦν Phld. Sto.Herc. 339.20.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., = ἁγνίζω, purify, πόλιν Antipho 2.3.11:— Pass., SIG 978 ( Cnidus): c.gen., purify from, ὁ παντὸς ἁγνεύων, of Epicurus, Phld. Lib. p.26O.
pf. ἀγνηκώς, GDI 1413 (Aetol.), cf. Hsch.
place of purity, κατʼ ἀντίφρασιν, for a brothel, Clearch. 6.
v.l. in LXX Nu. 8.7.

definition: ἁγνίζω, fut. ῐῶ ( ἀφ-) LXX Nu. 8.6: pf. ἥγνικα 1 Ep.Pet. 1.22: ( ἁγνός): —

children.definition: wash off, cleanse away, esp. by water ( τὸ πῦρ καθαίρει . . τὸ ὕδωρ ἁγνίζει Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.263e), λύμαθʼ ἁγνίσας ἐμά S. Aj. 655; τινὰ πηγαῖς E. IT 1039.

data.quote: τὸ πῦρ καθαίρει . . τὸ ὕδωρ ἁγνίζει

children.definition: cleanse, purify, χέρας σὰς ἁγνίσας μιάσματος E. HF 1324, cf. Diph. 126.1, LXX Ex. 19.10:— Med., purify oneself, ib. Jo. 3.5, Plu. Suav. 2.1105b:— Pass., ἁγνίσθητι Act.Ap. 21.24; ἀπὸ οἴνου LXX Nu. 6.3 ( Pass.).
ἁ. τὸν θανόντα purify the dead by fire, S. Ant. 545:— Pass., σώμαθʼ ἡγνίσθη πυρί E. Supp. 1211.
sacrifice, E. Fr. 314, IT 705 ( Pass.).
hallow, consecrate, Aristonous 1.17 ( Pass.).
burn up, consume, S. Fr. 116; ἐπαστράψας αἰθὴρ ἥγνισε . . ἱστορίαν AP 7.49 (Bianor).
made of ἄγνος, Plu. QConv. 2.693f.
purification, expiation, ματρῷον ἅ. φόνου, of Orestes, A. Eu. 326 (lyr.), cf. LXX Nu. 19.9.
purification, expiation, ἁ. ποιεῖσθαι D.H. 3.22; τοῖς ἁ. τοῖς πρὸ τῶν Θεσμοφορίων SIG 1219.19 ( Gambreion); τῷ ὕδατι τοῦ ἁ. LXX Nu. 6.5.

data.quote: τοῖς ἁ. τοῖς πρὸ τῶν Θεσμοφορίων

children.definition: to be purified, E. IT 1199.
instrument of purification, Hero Spir. 2.32.
purifier, Gloss.
Eust. 43.6.
purifier, θεοὶ ἁ. Poll. 1.24; πάγος Lyc. 135.

children.label: II
children.definition: one who requires purification, Hsch., AB 338, v.l. in Il. 24.480 (Sch. T.).

definition: ἁγνοδικεῖς οἱ θεοί, Phot., AB 338, Hsch. ( -δοχεῖς). ἀγνόδικος· ἀγνοοῦσα τὸ δίκαιον, Hsch. (cod. -μος), Phot., AB 338.

ἀγνοέω, Ep. ἀγνοι-, 3 sg. subj. ἀγνοιῇσι Od. 24.218: impf. ἠγνόουν Isoc. 7.21, etc.: fut. ἀγνοήσω B. Fr. 12, Isoc. 12.251, D. 32.10, 54.31: aor. ἠγνόησα A. Eu. 134, Th. 2.49, etc.; Ep. ἠγνοίησα Il. 2.807, Hes. Th. 551, Ep. contr. 3 sg. ἀγνώσασκε Od. 23.95: pf. ἠγνόηκα Pl. Sph. 221d, Alex. 20.4:— Pass., fut. (of med. form) ἀγνοήσομαι D. 18.249; ἀγνοηθήσομαι v.l. in Luc. JTr. 5: aor. ἠγνοήθην, v. infr.: pf. ἠγνόημαι Isoc. 15.171, Pl. Lg. 797a. (This Verb implies a form ἄγνοος, = ἀγνώς II):—

children.definition: not to perceive or recognize; Hom., almost always in aor., ἄνδρʼ ἀγνοιήσασʼ ὑλάει Od. 20.15, cf. Th. l.c., Pl. Phdr. 228a; mostly with neg., οὐκ ἠγνοίησεν he perceived or knew well, Il. 2.807, etc.; μηδὲν ἀγνόει E. Andr. 899.—Mostly c. acc., to be ignorant of, Hdt. 4.156, S. Tr. 78; πάντα Pl. Smp. 216d; ἑαυτοὺς ἀ. forget their former selves, D. 10.74; τὴν πόλιν ἀ. not to discern the temper of the city, Id. 19.231; τὸν ξένον Philostr. VA 2.26; fail to understand, τὸ ῥῆμα Ev.Marc. 9.32; περί τινος Pl. Phdr. 277d: c. gen. pers. and rel. clause, ἀγνοοῦντες ἀλλήλων ὅ τι λέγομεν Id. Grg. 517c: dependent clauses in part., τίς . . ἀ. τὸν ἐκεῖθεν πόλεμον δεῦρο ἥξοντα; D. 1.15: with Conj., οὐδεὶς ἀ. ὅτι . . Id. 21.156, etc.; ἀγνοῶν εἰ . . X. An. 6.5.12:— Pass., not to be known, recognized, Pl. Euthphr. 4a, Hp.Ma. 294d, etc.; ἀγνοούμενα ὅπῃ . . ἀγαθά ἐστι Id. R. 506a; ἠγνοῆσθαι ξύμπασιν ὅτι . . Id. Lg. 797a; ὑπελάμβανον ἀγνοήσεσθαι D. 18.249; καιρὸν οὐ παρεθέντα οὐδʼ ἀγνοηθέντα ib. 303, cf. Isoc. 15.171; τὰ ἠγνοημένα unknown parts, Arr. An. 7.1.4.

data.quote: τίς . . ἀ. τὸν ἐκεῖθεν πόλεμον δεῦρο ἥξοντα;

children.label: II
children.definition: go wrong, make a false step, first in Hp. Art. 46, Antipho 5.44 (dub.l.), Isoc. 8.39; part. ἀγνοῶν ignorantly, by mistake, X. An. 7.3.38, Arist. EN 1110b27; ἀγνοήσαντες And. 4.5: in moral sense, to be ignorant of what is right, act amiss, Plb. 5.11.5, cf. Ep.Hebr. 5.2:— Med., fail to recognize, Gal. 14.630.
fault of ignorance, oversight, ψυχῆς Gorg. Hel. 19, ἀ. ἕτερον προσαγνοεῖν Thphr. HP 9.4.8, cf. D.S. 1.1, Hipparch. 1.3.11, LXX To. 3.3, Ep.Hebr. 9.7; in pl., opp. ἁμαρτήματα, PTeb. 5.3 (ii B. C.).

children.label: II
children.definition: ignorance, περί τινος Str. 7.2.4.

children.label: III
children.definition: object of ἄγνοια, Dam. Pr. 7.
fail to observe, Aq. Ps. 118(119).10.
ignorance, Phld. D. 1.7.
οὐκ ἀ. one must not fail to remark, Dsc. Praef. 7, Ph. 1.11, al.
mistaken, τὰ ἀ. πράττειν Arist. EE 1246a48.
ignored; τὸ -όν, the object of ignorance, Dam. Pr. 6.

want of perception, ignorance, ἀγνοίᾳ A. Ag. 1596; ἀγνοίας ὕπο Supp. 499; ἣν ὑπʼ ἀγνοίας ὁρᾷς whom seeing you pretend not to know, S. Tr. 419; ἀγνοίᾳ ἐξαμαρτάνειν X. Cyr. 3.1.38, cf. Th. 8.92, Ar. Av. 577, D. 9.64, etc.; opp. ἐπιστήμη, Pl. Tht. 199d, Arist. APr. 66b26; ἄ. κενότης ἐστὶ τῆς περὶ ψυχὴν ἕξεως Pl. R. 585b; διʼ ἄγνοιαν πράττειν, opp. ἀγνοῶν, Arist. EN 1110b25: in Logic, ἡ τοῦ ἐλέγχου ἄ. ignoratio elenchi, ignorance of the conditions of a valid proof, Arist. SE 168a18, al.

data.quote: ἄ. κενότης ἐστὶ τῆς περὶ ψυχὴν ἕξεως

children.label: II
children.definition: mistaken conduct, a mistake, D. 18.133, Ep. 2.19, Plb. 27.2.2. [In Poets sts. ἀγνοίᾱ, S. Tr. 350, Ph. 129; old Att., acc. to Ael.Dion. Fr. 11, cf. Moer. 191; Ion. ἀγνοίη Phot.]
Adv. of ἀγνοέω, ignorantly, Arist. Top. 114b10.
to be purified by sacrifices, Phot.

definition: ἁγνοπόλος, ον, ( qṷel-, cf. τελέω) making pure, Δημήτηρ Orph. H. 18.12, A. 38.

children.definition: pure-flowing, ποταμός A. Pr. 434 (lyr.).
pure, chaste, holy, Hom. (only in Od.), etc.:

children.label: I
children.definition: hallowed, ἑορτή Od. 21.259; of frankincense, ἁγνὴ ὀδμή Xenoph. 1.7; ἄλσος h.Merc. 187; τέμενος Pi. P. 4.204; ὕδωρ Id. I. 6(5).74; πυρὸς ἁγνόταται παγαί Id. P. 1.21; αἰθήρ A. Pr. 282; φάος, λουτρόν, S. El. 86, Ant. 1201; θύματα Id. Tr. 287, cf. Th. 1.126, D.H. 1.38; of food, Jul. Or. 6.192c ( Comp.); χρηστήρια E. Ion 243, etc.; ἐν ἁγνῷ on holy ground, A. Supp. 223, but χῶρον οὐχ ἁ. πατεῖν a spot not lawful to tread on, S. OC 37.

chaste, pure, Hom., mostly of Artemis, χρυσόθρονος Ἄ. ἁ. Od. 5.123, 18.202, etc.; also ἁ. Περσεφόνεια 11.386, cf. h.Cer. 337; of Demeter, h.Cer. 203, 439; Χάριτες Sapph. 65; ἁ. θεαί, Demeter and Persephone, IG 14.204, 4.31; Apollo, Pi. P. 9.64; Zeus, A. Supp. 653, S. Ph. 1289: of the attributes of gods, θεῶν σέβας S. OT 830.

data.ref: S. Ph. 1289: of the attributes of gods,

children.label: II
children.definition: Hom., of persons, undefiled, chaste, of maidens, Alc. 55, Pi. P. 4.103, A. Fr. 242; ἁ. αὐδά, of a maidenʼs voice, Ag. 245; of Hippolytus, E. Hipp. 102; c. gen., λέχους ἁ. δέμας ib. 1003; γάμων ἁ. Pl. Lg. 840d, cf. Men. Epit. 223; ἁ. ἀπʼ ἀνδρὸς συνουσίας Jusj. ap. D. 59.78.

pure from blood, guiltless, ἁγνοὶ τοὐπὶ τήνδε τὴν κόρην S. Ant. 889; ἁ. χεῖρας E. Or. 1604; μητροκτόνος . . τόθʼ ἁ. ὤν Id. El. 975, cf. IA 940; ὅθʼ ἁ. ἦν when he had been purified, S. Tr. 258: c. gen., ἁγνὰς χεῖρας αἵματος E. Hipp. 316; φόνου Pl. Lg. 759c; Δάματρος ἀκτᾶς δέμας ἁ. ἴσχειν pure from food, E. Hipp. 138.
pure, upright, ἀέθλων ἁ. κρίσις Pi. O. 3.21; ψυχῆς φιλία ἁ. X. Smp. 8.15, etc.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. ἁγνῶς καὶ καθαρῶς h.Ap. 121, Hes. Op. 337; ἁ. ἔχειν X. Mem. 3.8.10.

chaste-tree, the branches of which were strewed by matrons on their beds at the Thesmophoria, Vitex Agnus-castus, h.Merc. 410, Chionid. 2, cf. Trag.Adesp. 396, Pl. Phdr. 230b, Hp. Int. 30, Arist. HA 627a9, Nic. Th. 71, Dsc. 1.103. (Associated with the notion of chastity from the likeness of its name to ἁγνός.)

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄγνος, ὁ, name of a fish, = καλλιώνυμος Diph.Siph. ap. Ath. 8.356a (sine acc. cod., ἁγνός Kaib.).

children.label: III
children.definition: bird, Sch. Pl. Phdr. l.c., Suid.
with pure mouth, Tz. H. 6.33.
Eranos 13.87 (loc. incert.), Phld. D. 3 Fr. 76.
worshipped in holy rites, Θέμις Orph. A. 551.
purity, chastity, integrity, IG 4.588.15 ( Argos, ii A.D.), 2 Ep.Cor. 6.5.

definition: ἄγνυμι, 3 dual ἄγνῠτον Hom., v. infr.: fut. ἄξω ( κατ-) Il. 8.403: aor.1 ἔαξα Hom., ( κατ-) Ar. V. 1436, etc., ἦξα Il. 23.392, ( κατ-) Hp. Epid. 5.26; imper. ἆξον Il. 6.306; part. ἄξας 16.371, E. Hel. 1598 ( κατ-εάξαντες Lys. 3.42 codd., perh. to distinguish it from aor. 1 of ἄγω); inf. ἆξαι Il. 21.178:— Pass., pres., v. infr.: aor. 2 ἐάγην ( ᾰ, exc. ἐᾱγη II. 11.559) Hom., etc.; Ep. 3 sing. ἄγη Il. 3.367, 3 pl. ἄγεν 4.214: pf. Act. (in pass. sense) ἔᾱγα Hes. Op. 534, Q.S. 1.204; Ion. ἔηγα ( κατ-) Hdt. 7.224, Hp. Fract. 24: pf. Pass. κατ-έαγμαι Luc. Tim. 10: ( ϝ, cf. καυάξαις; ᾰ by nature, ἆξον ( Hdn.Gr. 2.14), ἆξαι on analogy of contr. forms of κατα-ϝάγνυμι):—

children.definition: break, shiver, εἴσω δʼ ἀσπίδʼ ἔαξε Il. 7.270; ἦξε θεὰ ζυγόν 23.392; ἵπποι ἄξαντʼ ἐν πρώτῳ ῥυμῷ λίπον ἅρματα 16.371; νῆας . . ἔαξαν κύματα Od. 3.298; πρό τε κύματʼ ἔαξεν broke the waves, 5.385; ἄγνυτον ὕλην crashed through it, of wild boars, Il. 12.148; ἄγνυσι κεραυνόν APl. 16.250:— Pass., with pf. ἔᾱγα, to be broken, shivered, ἐν χείρεσσιν ἄγη ξίφος Il. 3.367. cf. 16.801; ἐν καυλῷ ἐάγη δολιχὸν δόρυ 13.162; πάταγος. . ἀγνυμενάων (sc. of the trees) 16.769; νηῶν θʼ ἅμα ἀγνυμενάων Od. 10.123; τοῦ [ὀϊστοῦ] δʼ ἐξελκομένοιο πάλιν ἄγεν ὀξέες ὄγκοι Il. 4.214; ποταμὸς περὶ καμπὰς πολλὰς ἀγνύμενος with a broken, i.e. winding, course, Hdt. 1.185: metaph., ἄγνυτο ἠχώ the sound spread around, Hes. Sc. 279, 348; κέλαδος ἀγνύμενος διὰ στομάτων, of the notes of song, Lyr.Adesp. 93.— Act. never in Prose, Pass. once in Hdt., κατάγνυμι being in general use.

data.quote: ἵπποι ἄξαντʼ ἐν πρώτῳ ῥυμῷ λίπον ἅρματα
τοῦ [ὀϊστοῦ] δʼ ἐξελκομένοιο πάλιν ἄγεν ὀξέες ὄγκοι

children.definition: water-wheel, PLond. 3.1177.149.

definition: ἀγνύς, ῦθος (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr. 2.763), ἡ,

children.definition: loom-weight, in pl., Plu. Symp. 2.156b, cf. Poll. 7.36.

definition: ἀγνώδης, ες, f.l. for ἀκανθώδης, Thphr. HP 3.18.4.
ἀγνωμονεύω, f.l. for -εω, Plu. Frat. 2.484b ( Pass.).

children.definition: to be ἀγνώμων, act without right feeling, X. HG 1.7.33; coupled with ἀδικεῖν, Zeno Stoic. 1.69; ἀ. εἴς τινα to act unfeelingly or unfairly towards one, D. 18.94, Men. Sam. 292; πρός τινα Apollod.Com. 7.6: with a neut. Adj., μή νυν τὰ θνητὰ θνητὸς ὢν ἀγνωμόνει Trag.Adesp. 112: abs., disregard a summons, be contumacious, PStrassb. 41.16 (iii A.D.); ἀ. περί τινα, περί τι, Plu. Alc. 19, Cam. 28: c. acc., treat unfairly, τὴν πόλιν Him. Or. 2.31:— Pass., to be so treated, Plu. Frat. 2.484b; ἀγνωμονηθείς Id. Cam. 18; ὑπὸ τοῦ πατρός POxy. 237v40 (ii A.D.).

data.quote: μή νυν τὰ θνητὰ θνητὸς ὢν ἀγνωμόνει

children.definition: act ill-advisedly, Aq. 1 Ki. 13.13.
want of acquaintance with a thing, Pl. Tht. 199d.
want of sense, folly, Thgn. 896, Democr. 175; senseless pride, arrogance, Hdt. 2.172, E. Ba. 885 (lyr.); πρὸς ἀ. τραπέσθαι Hdt. 4.93; ἀγνωμοσύνῃ χρᾶσθαι Id. 5.83; ὑπʼ ἀγνωμοσύνης Id. 9.3.
want of feeling, unkindness, D. 18.252; θεῶν ἀ. S. Tr. 1266 (dub.); ἀ. τύχης, Lat. iniquitas fortunae, D. 18.207.
misunderstandings, X. An. 2.5.6.

ill-judging, senseless, Thgn. 1260 codd. (s.v.l.), Pi. O. 8.60, Pl. Phdr. 275b; ὥσπερ κυνίδιον τοῖς εἴκουσιν ἀ. Phld. Lib. p.10 O.; opp. μετὰ λογισμοῦ πράττειν, Men. 617; inconsiderate, τὸ ἄ. καὶ θυμοειδές Hp. Aër. 16. Adv. -όνως senselessly, X. HG 6.3.11, etc.; ἀ. ἔχειν D. 2.26.
headstrong, reckless, (in Comp.) Hdt. 9.41: Sup., X. Mem. 1.2.26.

unfeeling, hard-hearted, Φοίβῳ τε κἀμοὶ μὴ γένησθʼ ἀγνώμονες S. OC 86; of judges, X. Mem. 2.8.5; joined with ἀχάριστος, Id. Cyr. 8.3.49, cf. Mem. 2.10.3, D. 21.97; esp. ignoring oneʼs debts, Ulp.ad D. 2.26, Jul. Or. 3.117e ( Comp.); ἀ. περὶ τὰς ἀποδόσεις Luc. Herm. 10.

data.quote: Φοίβῳ τε κἀμοὶ μὴ γένησθʼ ἀγνώμονες

children.definition: unknowing, in ignorance, ἀ. πλανᾶσθαι Hp. Vict. 1.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: senseless, brute, Aeschin. 3.244; also φρονοῦσαν θνητὰ κοὐκ ἀγνώμονα (neut. pl.) S. Tr. 473.
cruel, πρᾶγμα ἄ. πάσχειν Parth. 17.5.

children.label: III
children.definition: without the teeth that tell the age ( γνώμονες) Poll. 1.182. [ ᾰγν- only in Man. 5.338.]
unascertained, unknown, Thphr. HP 1.2.3, cf. Poll. 5.150, Hierocl. Facet. 150; not recognized, Steph. in Hp. 1.61 D.

children.label: I
children.definition: Pass., unknown, mostly of persons, ἀγνῶτες ἀλλήλοις Od. 5.79; ἀγνὼς πρὸς ἀγνῶτʼ εἶπε A. Ch. 677, cf. Supp. 993, S. Ph. 1008; ἀ. πατρί clam patre, E. Ion 14: in Prose, ἀ. τοῖς ἐν τῇ νηΐ Th. 1.137, cf. Pl. R. 375e, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: obscure, unintelligible, ἀ. φωνὴ βάρβαρος A. Ag. 1051, cf. S. Ant. 1001; ἀ. δόκησις dark, vague suspicion, Id. OT 681.
obscure, ignoble, ἀ. ἀκλεής E. IA 18; οὐκ ἀ. νίκαν a victory not unknown to fame, Pi. I. 2.12; ἀ.διὰ νεότητα Jul. Or. 3.116b.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., ignorant, S. OT 1133; ἀ. τί δύναται . . X. Oec. 20.13.

children.label: III
children.definition: Pass. and Act., [χθὼν] οὐκ ἀ. θηρῶν Pi. P. 9.58, cf. I. 2.30; ἀγνῶτες ἀλλήλων Th. 3.53; ὁ ἀ. τῶν λόγων Arist. SE 178a26.

ignorance, Hp. VM 9, Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1055.15; συμφορᾶς ἀ. E. Med. 1204; κέρδος ἐν κακοῖς ἀ. Id. Fr. 205; διὰ τὴν ἀλλήλων ἀ. Th. 8.66; opp. γνῶσις, Pl. Sph. 267b: c. gen., θεοῦ LXX Wi. 13 1, 1 Ep.Cor. 15.34.
lack of acquaintance, Luc. Tim. 42.

children.label: II
children.definition: being unknown, obscurity, Pl. Mx. 238d.
pres. only, mostly poet., Simm. 1.13, Musae. 249, D.P. 173, Coluth. 8, Nonn. D. 1.425, etc.; in late Prose, Luc. Ep.Sat. 25.

data.ref: Nonn. D. 1.425, etc.; in late Prose,

children.definition: secretly, unperceived, Ps.-Callisth. 3.19.
unknown, τινί Od. 2.175; unheard of, forgotten, Mimn. 5.7; ἄ. ἐς γῆν E. IT 94; unfamiliar, Arist. Top. 149a5 ( Comp.).
not to be known, ἄγνωστόν τινα τεύχειν Od. 13.191; πάντεσσι ib. 397; ἀγνωστστατοι γλῶσσαν most unintelligible in tongue, Th. 3.94.
not an object of knowledge, unknowable, ἄλογα καὶ ἄ. Pl. Tht. 202b; ἡ ὕλη ἄ. καθʼ αὑτήν Arist. Metaph. 1036a9; in Comp., harder to know, ib. 995a2. Adv. -τως Procl. in Alc. p.52C.
νὴ τὸν Ἄγνωστον Ps.-Luc. Philopatr. 9, cf. Act.Ap. 17.23; in pl., θεῶν . . ὀνομαζομένων ἀ. Paus. 1.1.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not knowing, ignorant of, ψευδέων Pi. O. 6.67 (v.l. ἄγνωτον), cf. Luc. Halc. 3. Adv. -τως inconsiderately, Phld. Lib. p.29 O.
Dorio ap. Ath. 3.118d.
S. OT 58; ἄγνωτα τοῖς θεωμένοις Ar. Ra. 926.
throttling, EM 194.50, Gloss.
not murmuring, in Adv. -τως, Sor. 1.88.
not to be bewitched or beguiled, Plot. 4.4.44.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., without guile. Adv. -τως Cic. Att. 12.3.1.
without grinders, ἀ. αἰών toothless age, Diocl.Com. 14.
without a knee, Arist. IA 709a3.

children.label: II
children.definition: without knots or joints, Id. Fr. 195, Thphr. HP 4.8.7.
to be unfruitful, Thphr. HP 9.18.3, Ph. 2.402: metaph., ψυχὴ ἀ. τινῶν ib. 435.
sterility, Arist. GA 746b20, Dsc. 2.179, Plu. Rom. 24 (pl.); opp. εὐγονία, Iamb. Comm. Math. 15.

children.label: I
children.definition: Pass., unborn, Il. 3.40 (which Augustus translated childless, Suet. Oct. 65), E. Ph. 1598, Eub. 107.11.
γόνος ἄ. no longer a son, of a horse that mounts his dam, Opp. C. 1.260.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., unfruitful, sterile, of animals both male and female, Hp. Aph. 5.59, Art. 41 ( Comp.), Arist. GA 726a3 ( Comp.), etc.; γαστήρ Ael. NA 15.9; τόκοισι ἀ. travail without issue, bringing no children to the birth, S. OT 27: metaph., ἄ. ποιητής Plu. Glor.Ath. 2.348b.

children.label: b
children.definition: sterile, or seeds, infertile, Thphr. HP 1.13.4, 1.11.1; ὁμίχλη νεφέλη ἄ., i. e. not producing water, Arist. Mete. 346b35, cf. Ar.Did. p. 451.33D.

children.label: c
children.definition: ἄ. ἡμέρα, ἔτος a day or year unlucky for begetting children, Hp. Epid. 2.6.8 and 10 (of odd days and years); τὸ ἄ. τῆς ὕλης Plot. 3.6.19, cf. 6.3.8.

children.label: d
children.definition: impeding generation, ζῴδιον Vett.Val. 10.11.
not productive of, σοφίας Pl. Tht. 150c, cf. 157c; γῆ θηρίων ἄ. Mx. 237d.

children.label: III
children.definition: childless, γένος E. HF 888, Hld. 4.12.

children.label: IV
children.definition: ἄγονον, τό, = μυρσίνη ἀγρία, Ps.- Dsc. 4.144; ἄγονος, = ἄγνος, Id. 1.103, Sch. Nic. Th. 71.
unmourned, A. Th. 1068 (lyr.).

definition: ἀγορά [ᾰγ], ᾶς, Ion. ἀγορή, ῆς, ἡ, ( ἀγείρω):—

children.definition: assembly, esp. of the People, opp. the Council of Chiefs, Il. 2.93, Od. 2.69, etc.; τοῖσιν δʼ οὔτʼ ἀγοραὶ βουληφόροι (sc. Κυκλώπεσσι) Od. 9.112; ὀρθῶν ἑσταότων ἀ. γένετʼ οὐδέ τις ἔτλη ἕζεσθαι Il. 18.246; ἀ. Πυλάτιδες, of the Amphictyonic Council at Pylae, S. Tr. 638, cf. Ion Eleg. 1.3 [26.3?]; μακάρων ἀ. Pi. I. 8(7).29, cf. AB 210; ἀγορήνδε καλέσσασθαι, κηρύσσειν, Il. 1.54, 2.51; ἀγορὴν ποιήσασθαι, θέσθαι, Il. 8.489, Od. 9.171; εἰς ἀ. ἰέναι, ἀγέρεσθαι, 8.12, Il. 18.245; ἀγορήνδε καθέζεσθαι Od. 1.372.—Not common in Prose, ἀγορὰν συνάγειν, συλλέγειν X. An. 5.7.3; ποιῆσαι Aeschin. 3.27; ἀγορὰς ποιεῖσθαι Hyp. Fr. 150: of the assembly in Attic demes, D. 44.36, IG 2.585, al.; ἀ. συνέδριον φυλετῶν καὶ δημοτῶν AB 327: in late Prose, ἀ. δικῶν προθεῖναι, καταστήσασθαι, = Lat. conventus agere, Luc. Bis Acc. 4, 12: meeting for games, Pi. N. 3.14: metaph., μυρμήκων ἀ. Luc. Icar. 19: prov., θεῶν ἀ. ‘Babel’, Suid., etc.

data.quote: ὀρθῶν ἑσταότων ἀ. γένετʼ οὐδέ τις ἔτλη ἕζεσθαι

children.label: II
children.definition: place of assembly, τοὺς δʼ εὗρʼ εἰν ἀγορῇ Il. 7.382; ἵνα σφʼ ἀ. τε θέμις τε 11.807, cf. Od. 6.266; pl., Od. 8.16; οὔτε . . εἰς ἀ. ἔρχεται οὔτε δίκας Thgn. 268.

data.quote: ἵνα σφʼ ἀ. τε θέμις τε
οὔτε . . εἰς ἀ. ἔρχεται οὔτε δίκας

children.definition: market-place, perh. not earlier than Hom.Epigr. 14.5 πολλὰ μὲν εἰν ἀγορῇ πωλεύμενα, πολλὰ δʼ ἀγυιαῖς; freq. in later authors, πρυμνοῖς ἀγορᾶς ἔπι Pi. P. 5.93; θεοὶ . . ἀγορᾶς ἐπίσκοποι A. Th. 272; μέση Τραχινίων ἀ. S. Tr. 424; ἀγορᾷ οὐδὲ ἄστει δέχεσθαι Th. 6.44; ὀλιγάκις . . ἀγορᾶς χραίνων κύκλον E. Or. 919; οἱ ἐκ τῆς ἀ. market people, X. An. 1.2.18; ἐξ ἀγορᾶς εἶ Ar. Eq. 181, etc.; εἰς ἀ. ἐμβάλλειν to go into the forum, i. e. be a citizen, Lycurg. 5; ἐν τῇ ἀ. ἐργάζεσθαι to trade in the market, D. 57.31; εἰς τὴν ἀ. χειροτονεῖν (opp. ἐπὶ τὸν πόλεμον) ‘for the market’, Id. 4.26; the Roman Forum, D.H. 5.48.

children.label: III
children.definition: business of the ἀγορά:
public speaking, gift of speaking, mostly in pl., ἔσχʼ ἀγοράων withheld him from speaking, Il. 2.275; οἱ δʼ ἀγορὰς ἀγόρευον ib. 788, cf. Od. 4.818; ᾠδὴν ἀντʼ ἀγορῆς θέμενος Sol. 1.

market, ἀγορὰν παρασκευάζειν Th. 7.40, X. HG 3.4.11; ἀ. παρέχειν Th. 6.44, etc.; ἄγειν X. An. 5.7.33, etc.; opp. ἀγορᾷ χρῆσθαι to have supplies, ib. 7.6.24; τῆς ἀ. εἴργεσθαι Th. 1.67, Plu. Per. 29; ἀ. ἐλευθέρα, i. e. καθαρὰ τῶν ὠνίων πάντων, Arist. Pol. 1331a31, cf. X. Cyr. 1.2.3; opp. ἀ. ἀναγκαία Arist. Pol. 1331b11; generally, provisions, supplies, PPetr. 3p.131 (iii B. C.), PS 14.354 (iii B. C.), al.; in pl., Nic.Dam.p.6.17 D.; ἀγορὰς περικόπτειν cut off supplies, D.H. 10.43.

children.label: b
children.definition: market, sale, ἀ. τῶν βιβλίων, τῶν παρθένων, Luc. Ind. 19, Ael. VH 4.1, cf. Nicoch. 7.

children.label: IV
children.definition: ἀ. πλήθουσα the forenoon, when the market-place was full, ἀγορῆς πληθυούσης Hdt. 4.181; πληθούσης ἀγορᾶς X. Mem. 1.1.10, cf. SIG 695.38 ( Magn. Mae.); περὶ or ἀμφὶ ἀ. πλήθουσαν X. An. 2.1.7, 1.8.1; ἐν ἀ. πληθούσῃ Pl. Grg. 469d, cf. Th. 8.92; also ἀγορῆς πληθώρη Hdt. 2.173, 7.223; poet., ἐν ἀ. πλήθοντος ὄχλου Pi. P. 4.85; πρὶν ἀ. πεπληθέναι Pherecr. 29: ἀγορῆς διάλυσις the time just after mid-day, when they went home from market, Hdt. 3.104, cf. X. Oec. 12.1.

children.label: V
children.definition: market-day, = Lat. nundinae, D.H. 7.58.

definition: ἀγοράζω [ᾰγ], fut. άσω Ar. Lys. 633, ἀγορῶ LXX Ne. 10.31: aor. ἠγόρασα X. HG 7.2.18, D. 21.149, etc.: pf. ἠγόρακα Arist. Oec. 1352b7, Plb. 6.17.4:— Med., aor. ἠγορασάμην D. 50.55: pf. ἠγόρασμαι (v. infr.):— Pass., aor. ἠγοράσθην Id. 59.46: pf. ἠγόρασμαι Is. 8.23, Men. 828:—

children.definition: frequent the ἀγορά, αἱ γυναῖκες ἀ. καὶ καπηλεύουσι Hdt. 2.35, 4.164, cf. Arist. Ph. 196a5, Com.Adesp. 710; occupy the market-place, Th. 6.51.

buy in the market, πωλεῖν ἀ. Ar. Ach. 625; ἐπιτήδεια ἀ. X. An. 1.5.10; generally, buy, Ar. Pl. 984, etc.; farm taxes or state-contracts, ὠνὴν ἀ. PRev.Laws 41.22, al.; τὸν Σαίτην ἀγοράσας ib. 60.23:— Med., buy for oneself, X. An. 1.3.14:— Pass., διά τινος ἀ. D. 50.25 : pf. Pass. in med. sense, ἀντὶ τοῦ ἠγοράσθαι αὐτοῖς τὸν οἶνον Id. 35.19.

data.quote: ἀντὶ τοῦ ἠγοράσθαι αὐτοῖς τὸν οἶνον

children.definition: haunt the ἀγορά, Corinn. 34, Pi. Fr. 103; οὐδʼ ἀγοράσει γʼ ἀγένειος οὐδεὶς ἐν ἀγορᾷ nor shall any boy lounge in the ἀγορά, Ar. Eq. 1373. [ -ᾱζω (i. e. -ᾴζω) in sense 1, Hdn.Gr. 2.14.]

definition: ἀγοραῖος [ᾰγ], ον, (fem. -αία epith. of Artemis and Athena, v. infr.):—

children.definition: in, of, or belonging to the ἀγορά, Ζεὺς Ἀ. as guardian of popular assemblies, Hdt. 5.46, A. Eu. 973 (lyr.), E. Heracl. 70; Ἑρμῆς Ἀ. as patron of traffic, Ar. Eq. 297, cf. IPE 12.128 ( Olbia), IG 12(8).67 ( Thasos), Paus. 1.15.1; Ἄρτεμις Ἀ. at Olympia, Id. 5.15.4; Ἀθηνᾶ Ἀ. at Sparta, Id. 3.11.9; generally, θεοὶ ἀ. A. Ag. 90.
τὰ ἀ. details of market-business, Pl. R. 425c.

children.label: II
children.definition: frequenting the market, ὁ ἀ. ὄχλος X. HG 6.2.23; δήμου εἶδος Arist. Pol. 1291b19, etc.; τὸ ἀ. πλῆθος . . τὸ περὶ τὰς πράσεις καὶ τὰς ὠνὰς καὶ τὰς ἐμπορίας καὶ καπηλείας διατρῖβον ib. 1291a4:— ἀγοραῖοι (with or without ἄνθρωποι), οἱ, those who frequented the ἀγορά, Hdt. 1.93, 2.141; opp. ἔμποροι, X. Vect. 3.13, but = traders ( i.e. sutlers), Ael. Tact. 2.2:—hence, the common sort, low fellows, Ar. Ra. 1015, Pl. Prt. 347c, Thphr. Char. 6.2; of agitators, Act.Ap. 17.5, Plu. Aem. 38: Comp., the baser sort, Ptol.Euerg. 1. Adv. -αίως, λέγειν D.H. Rh. 10.11.
vulgar, σκώμματα Ar. Pax 750; τοὺς νοῦς ἀ. ἧττον . . ποιῶ Id. Fr. 471; ἀ. φιλία (opp. ἐλευθέριος) Arist. EN 1162b26; common, ἄρτοι Lync. ap. Ath. 3.109d.

children.label: III
children.definition: proper to the ἀγορά, skilled in, suited for forensic speaking, Plu. Per. 11, al.:— ἀγοραῖος (sc. ἡμέρα) court-day, assize, τὰς ἀ. ποιεῖσθαι Str. 13.4.12; ἄγειν τὴν ἀ. Epist. Galb. ap. J. AJ 14.10.21, cf. Act.Ap. 19.38, IGRom. 4.790. Adv. -ως in forensic style, Plu. CG 4, Ant. 24.
ἀγοραῖος, ὁ, = tabellio, notary, Aristid. Or. 50(26).94, Edict.Diocl. 7.41, Gloss.; also, pleader, advocate, in pl., Philostr. VA 6.36.

children.label: b
children.definition: ἀγοραῖος, ἡ, market-day, IGRom. 4.1381 ( Lydia). (The distn. ἀγόραιος vulgar, ἀγοραῖος public speaker, drawn by Ammon., etc., is prob. fictitious.)
to be ἀγορανόμος, Alex. 247, IG 12(3).170 ( Astypalaea); τῆς πόλεως FOxy. 910.2 (ii A.D.); at Rome, to be aedile, D.H. 10.48, Plu. Caes. 5, App. BC 2.1, etc.: pf. -ηκα D.C. 52.32.
office of ἀγορανόμος, Arist. Pol. 1331b9, IG 4.203 ( Corinth), PGrenf. 1.10.7 (ii B. C.), etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: = Lat. aedilitas, Plb. 10.4.1, D.H. 5.18, App. Pun. 112.
of or for the ἀγορανόμος or his office, ἀ. ἄττα Pl. R. 425d; νόμιμα Arist. Pol. 1264a31; νόμος Milet. 3.145 (200 B.C.); τιμαί CIG 1716 (Delph.); στέφανος POxy. 1252v17 (iii A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: = Lat. aedilicius, ἀρχαιρέσια Plu. Pomp. 53; ἐξουσία D.H. 6.95.
court or office of the ἀγορανόμος, Pl. Lg. 917e, IG 2.192c11, 12(3).170, PHib. 29.3 (iii B. C.), AP 11.17 ( Nicarch.).
of or in the forum, περίπατος IGRom. 4.504 (Perg.).
clerk of the market, who regulated buying and selling, Hp. Epid. 4.24, Ar. Ach. 723, al., Lys. 22.16, Arist. Pol. 1299b17, IG 2.192c12, etc.
public notary, PGrenf. 2.23aii 2 (ii B. C.), POxy. 99.2 (i A.D.), etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: = Lat. aedilis, D.H. 7.14, IG 14.719, etc.

definition: ἀγοράομαι, almost always in Ep. forms, pres. ἀγοράασθε, impf. ἠγοράασθε, ἠγορόωντο (cf. Hdt. 6.11), aor. 1 only 3 sing. ἀγορήσατο (v. infr.): 2 sg. impf. ἠγορῶ S. Tr. 601; inf. ἀγορᾶσθαι Thgn. 159:—

children.definition: meet in assembly, sit in debate, οἱ δὲ θεοὶ πὰρ Ζηνὶ καθήμενοι ἠγορόωντο Il. 4.1.

data.quote: οἱ δὲ θεοὶ πὰρ Ζηνὶ καθήμενοι ἠγορόωντο

children.label: II
children.definition: speak in the assembly, harangue, ὅ σφιν ἐϋφρονέων ἀγορήσατο Il. 1.73, 9.95, cf. Od. 7.185, Hdt. l.c.; παισὶν ἐοικότες ἀγοράασθε Il. 2.337.

speak, utter, εὐχωλαί . . ἃς . . κενεαυχέες ἠγοράασθε 8.230, μήποτε . . ἀγορᾶσθαι ἔπος μέγα Thgn. l.c.: c. dat., speak, talk with, ἕως σὺ . . ἠγορῶ ξέναις S. l.c. [ ᾱγ- only in Il. 2.337, metri grat.; otherwise ᾰγ-.]
ἀγοράζω, wish to buy, Sch. Ar. Ra. 1068.
purchase, Telecl. 51, Hyp. Fr. 70, Inscr.Magn. 116.20 (ii A.D.), D.L. 2.78 (pl.), etc.

definition: ἀγόρασις, εως, ἡ, = foreg., Pl. Sph. 219d (pl.), cf. Leg.Sacr. 2.69 ( -ασσις, Tanagra), PRyl. 2.45.5 (iii A.D.).

children.definition: that which is bought or sold: mostly in pl., wares, merchandise, Aeschin. 3.223, D. 34.9, etc., cf. Alex. 168.
purchasing, Phint. ap. Stob. 4.23.61a, Vett.Val. 180.11, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: purchase, LXX Ge. 42.19, al., OGI 660.20 ( Egypt, i A.D.) (pl.); freq. of auctions, ποιεῖσθαί τινος τὸν ἀ. BGU 1128.9 (14 B.C.).
the slave who had to buy provisions for the house, purveyor, X. Mem. 1.5.2:—generally, purchaser, μέτριος ἀ. Men. 500, cf. Arist. Oec. 1352b6, Dinon 12, Ael. VH 12.1, POxy. 298.48 (i A.D.).
of or for traffic, commercial, Pl. Cra. 408a; ἡ -κή (sc. τέχνη) traffic, commerce, Id. Sph. 223c; τὸ ἀ. δίκαιον right of purchase, POxy. 1268.16 (iii A.D.), 1475.14 (iii A. D.).
bought, paid for, PPetr. 3p.243 (iii B. C.), BGU 802 iv 8 (i A.D.); δούλη POxy. 95.14 (i A.D.), cf. Porph. Hist. 20.

definition: ἀγοράστρια, ἡ, fem. of ἀγοραστής, BGU 907.11 (ii A.D.), PThead. 1.11 (iv A.D.).
ἀγορᾶχος, ἡ, female official at Sparta, IG 5(1).589.

children.definition: speech, oration, EM 13.51.
place for speaking, IG 14.742 ( Naples, i/ii A.D.).
speaker, POxy. 1590.1 (iv A.D.).

definition: ἀγορεύω ( ἀγορά), impf. ἠγόρευον, Ep. ἀγόρευον Il. 1.385: fut. -εύσω Hom., Alciphr. 3.52, Philostr. VA 4.45: aor. -ευσα Hom., D.H. 1.65, Luc. Pisc. 15: pf. -ευκα Lib. Or. 37.4: 1 aor. Pass. -εύθην ( προσ-) Str. 3.3.5: in compds. these tenses and pf. Pass. -ευμαι are found in early Prose and Att. Inscrr., the simple vb. only in pres. and impf.:—

children.definition: speak in the assembly, harangue, freq. in Ep., ἀγορὰς ἀ. Il. 2.788; ἐν Ἀργείοις ἔπεα πτερόεντʼ ἀ. 23.535; ὣς Ἕκτωρ ἀγόρευε 8.542; τοῖσιν ἀ. address them, 1.571, al.; πρὸς ἀλλήλους ἔπεα 24.142; ὀνειδίζων ἀ. Od. 18.380: in Att., of the crierʼs proclamation in the Ecclesia, τίς ἀγορεύειν βούλεται; who wishes to address the house? Ar. Ach. 45, D. 18.170, etc.; ἀ. ὡς . . Il. 1.109: c. inf., μή τι φόβονδʼ ἀγόρευε counsel me not to flight, Il. 5.252; ἀ. μὴ στρατεύεσθαι Hdt. 7.10.αʹ

speak, say, τοιαῦτα πρὸς ἀλλήλους ἀγόρευον Il. 5.274; κακόν τι ἀ. τινά Od. 18.15; κακῶς ἀ. τινά Arist. Fr. 417; ἀ. ὡς . . , ὅτι . . , Hdt. 3.156, Ar. Pl. 102; οὐκ ἠγόρευον; did I not say so? Id. Ach. 41, cf. S. OC 838; tell of, mention, τι Od. 2.318, 16.263, al.; ὑπὲρ τοῦ Διὸς ἀγορεύων speaking of Zeus, Pl. Lg. 776e: metaph., δέρμα θηρὸς ἀ. χειρῶν ἔργον tells a tale of . . Theoc. 25.175.

proclaim, Il. 1.385; πέμπων κήρυκα ἠγόρευέ σφι τάδε Hdt. 6.97:— Pass., ὁ πολίτης . . κακὸς ἀγορευέσθω Pl. Lg. 917d:— aor. Med., ἀγορεύσασθαι ὡς . . to have it proclaimed that . . , Hdt. 9.26:— ὁ νόμος ἀ. the law declares, Antipho 3.3.7, Lys. 9.9, Arist. Rh. 1354a22; ἀ. μὴ ποιεῖν Ar. Ra. 628; οὔνομα . . ἥδʼ ἀ. στήλη IG 2.2753.
Pass., to be delivered, λόγον καλὸν ἐπὶ τοῖς . . θαπτομένοις -εσθαι Th. 2.35.

eloquence, Od. 8.168.— Ep. word.

any matter of religious awe:

pollution, guilt, ἐν τῷ ἄγεϊ ἐνέχεσθαι Hdt. 6.56; ἄ. ἐκθύσασθαι 6.91; ἄ . . . κεκτήσεται θεῶν A. Th. 1022; ἄ. αἱμάτων ἀρέσθαι Id. Eu. 168, cf. AP 7.268 ( Plato); ἄ. φυλάσσεσθαι A. Supp. 375; φεύγειν S. Ant. 256; ὅθεν τὸ ἄ. συνέβη τοῖς Συβαρίταις Arist. Pol. 1303a30; ἄ. ἀφοσιώσασθαι Plu. Cam. 18: in concrete sense, the person or thing accursed, S. OT 1426; ἄ. ἐλαύνειν, = ἀγηλατεῖν, Th. 1.126.

Dor. Adv. in Theognost. Can. 163.33.

βοὸς ἀγραύλοιο Il. 10.155, Od. 12.253; θήρ S. Ant. 349 (lyr.), E. Ba. 1188 (lyr.), etc.

unwritten, μνήμη Th. 2.43; ἄ. διαθῆκαι nuncupatory wills, Plu. Cor. 9; ἄ. κληρονόμος Luc. Tox. 23; ἄγραφα λέγειν to speak without book, Plu. Dem. 8. Adv. -φως, κατὰ μνήμης σῴζεσθαι Procl. in Prm. p.553 S.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄ. δίκαιον, moral or equitable justice, Arist. EN 1162b22; ἄ. νόμοι or νόμιμα unwritten laws:
laws of nature, τοῖς ἀ. νομίμοις καὶ τοῖς ἀνθρωπίνοις ἤθεσι D. 18.275, cf. Arist. EN 1180b1.

religious traditions, as of the Eumolpidae, Lys. 6.10.

C.), al.

Sphaer.Stoic. 1.142; ἀγρευθεὶς ἤγρευσε AP 9.94 ( Isid.), 12.113 ( Mel.).

take, seize, freq. in Aeolic Inscrr. as IG 12(2).6.33 ( Pass., Lesbos); ἄγρει δʼ οἶνον ἐρυθρόν Archil. 4.3; τρόμος παῖσαν ἄγρει Sapph. 2.14, cf. Thgn. 294; ἀγρεῖ πόλιν captures, A. Ag. 126 (lyr.); of fishing, AP 6.304 ( Phanias); in prescriptions, ἄγρει, take! Nic. Th. 534, al.

from the chase, A.R. 2.938. ἀγρήθετο· ἠθέλησεν, Hsch.
net, Hsch.:—also, net-like woollen robe worn by Bacchanals and soothsayers, Id., Poll. 4.116.

Ant. 58: fut. ἀγριανθήσομαι LXX Da. 11.11: aor. ἠγριάνθην D.S. 24.1.—In Att. the Pass. was supplied by ἀγριόω (q. v.), which was rare in Act.; but the compd. Pass. ἐξαγριαίνομαι occurs in Pl. R. 336d, and the Act. ἐξαγριόω in Hdt. 6.123, E. Ph. 876, Pl. Lg. 935a.

HA 608b31; of rivers and the like, chafe, πρὸς τὴν πλήμμυραν . . ἀγριαίνων ὁ ποταμός Plu. Caes. 38:— Pass., D.S. l.c.; of sores, to be angry or inflamed, Aret. SD 2.11, cf. Antyll. ap. Orib. 10.13.2.

wasp, Gloss.

children.label: I
children.definition: τιθασός ἥμερος, wild, βάλλειν ἄγρια πάντα Il. 5.52; αἶξ, σῦς, 3.24, 9.539; even of flies, ἄ. φῦλα, μυίας 19.30; ἵπποι, ὄνοι, etc., Hdt. 7.86, etc.; ἄ. τέρας, of a bull, E. Hipp. 1214; ἄ. θηρία X. An. 1.2.7; of men, living in a wild state, Hdt. 4.191.
ἥμερος, wild, Pi. Fr. 46, Hdt. 4.21, etc.; μητρὸς ἀγρίας ἄπο ποτόν of the wild vine, A. Pers. 614, cf. Arist. Pr. 896a8; ἄ. ἔλαιον S. Tr. 1197; ὕλη Id. OT 476, etc.; μέλι Ev.Matt. 3.4.
wild, uncultivated, Pl. Phd. 113b, Lg. 905b.

savage, fierce, Il. 8.96, Od. 1.199, etc., cf. Ar. Nu. 567; δεσπότης Pl. R. 329c; ἄ. καὶ ἀπαίδευτος Id. Grg. 510b; ἄγριε παῖ καὶ στυγνέ Theoc. 23.19, cf. 2.54; ἄ. κυβευτής a passionate gambler, Men. 965; esp. of παιδερασταί, Ar. Nu. 349 (cf. Sch. ad loc.), Aeschin. 1.52, Aen.Gaz. Thphr. p.14B.

wild, fierce, θυμός, χόλος, Il. 9.629, 4.23; λέων δʼ ὥς, ἄγρια οἶδεν 24.41; ἄ. πτόλεμος, μῶλος, 17.737, 398; ἄγριος ἄτη 19.88; ἄ. ὁδοί cruel ways or counsels, S. Ant. 1274; ὀργή OT 344 ( Sup.); ἀγριώτατα ἤθεα Hdt. 4.106; ἔρωτες Pl. Phd. 81a; φιλία Id. Lg. 837b, cf. R. 572b, etc.; τὸ ἄ. savageness, Id. Cra. 394e; ἐς τὸ -ώτερον to harsher measures, Th. l.c.
cruel, harsh, δεσμά A. Pr. 177; νὺξ -ωτέρη wild, stormy, Hdt. 8.13; δουλεία Pl. R. 564a; σύντασις ἀ. a violent strain, Id. Phlb. 46d; ἄ. βάρος, of strong, hot wine, Ar. Fr. 351.

Ra. 897:— grow wild; in pf. to be wild, properly of plants, countries, etc., νῆσος ἠγριωμένη τῇ ὕλῃ Thphr. HP 5.8.2, cf. CP 5.3.6; of men, to be unkempt, ὡς ἠγρίωσαι διὰ μακρᾶς ἀλουσίας E. Or. 226, cf. 387.

worshippers of Agrippa, guild at Sparta, IG 5(1).374.8.

harrow, rake, Hdn.Gr. 1.345, Hsch.; cf. ἀγρεῖφνα.

dwelling in the fields, ζῷα, opp. ὄρεια, Arist. HA 488b2; esp. of men, countryman, rustic, Ar. Nu. 47; in Attica, οἱ ἄ., = γεωμόροι (q. v.), Arist. Ath. 13.2, D.H. 2.8: mostly with the collat. sense of boorish, rude, Ar. Nu. 628, 646, etc., cf. Thphr. Char. 4; μέλος -ότερον Ar. Ach. 674; ἄ. σοφία Pl. Phdr. 229e, cf. Isoc. 5.82 ( Comp.), Arist. EN 1128a9; of fortune, Apollod.Car. 5.14; ἄ. Δημοσθένης, of Dinarchus, D.H. Din. 8. Adv. -κως Ar. V. 1320: Comp. -οτέρως Pl. R. 361e, X. Mem. 3.13.1; -ότερον Pl. Phdr. 260d.

children.label: II

field, mostly in pl., fields, lands, Il. 23.832, Od. 4.757, Pi. P. 4.149, etc.; opp. κῆποι, Theopomp. Hist. 89; sg., farm, Od. 24.205; also in pl., X. HG 2.4.1:— tilled land, opp. fallow, ἀγρὸς καὶ ἀργός, Ἀθηνᾶ 20.167 ( Erythrae).

country, opp. town, Od. 17.182, E. Supp. 884, etc.; ἀγρὸν τὰν πόλιν ποιεῖς Epich. 169; ἀγρῷ in the country, Od. 11.188; ἐπʼ ἀγροῦ in the country, 1.190, 22.47; ἐπʼ ἀγρὸῦ νόσφι πόληος 1.185; in pl., κατὰ πτόλιν ἠὲ κατʼ ἀγρούς 17.18; ἐν οἴκοις ἢ ʼν ἀγροῖς S. OT 112; ἐπʼ ἀγρῶν ib. 1049; ἀγροῖσι Id. El. 313; τὸν ἐξ ἀγρῶν Id. OT 1051; τὰ ἐξ ἀγρῶν Th. 2.13, cf. 14; κατʼ ἀγρούς Cratin. 318, Pl. Lg. 881c; οἰκεῖν ἐν ἀγρῷ Ar. Fr. 387.2; τὰ ἐν ἀγρῷ γιγνόμενα fruits, X. Mem. 2.9.4, cf. An. 5.3.9:—prov., οὐδὲν ἐξ ἀγροῦ λέγεις, ἀγροῦ πλέως, i.e. boorish, Suid., Hsch.—Rare in later Greek, Ev.Marc. 15.21, PAmh. 2.134.5, POxy. 967. [ ᾰ by nature, so always in Com., exc. Ar. Av. 579, Philem. 116; ᾱγρόθεν in Alc.Com. 19 is paratrag.] (Cf. Skt. ájras ‘plain’, prob. fr. aj ‘drive’ (cf. ἄγω), i.e. pasture.)

definition: ἀγρότερος, α, ον, ( ἀγρός; properly opp. ὀρέσ-τερος)

countrymen, AP 9.244 ( Apollonid.), APl. 16.235 ( Id.).

to be watchful, LXX Wi. 6.15, Ev.Marc. 13.33, Ep.Eph. 6.18; ὑπὲρ τῶν ψυχῶν Ep.Hebr. 13.17; ἐπὶ τὰ κακά LXX Da. 9.14: c. inf., μηθέν σε ἐνοχλήσειν PGrenf. 2.14a3.

watcher, Man. 1.81.

wakeful, D.S. 33.21, Plu. Cam. 27.

sleeplessness, wakefulness, Hp. Aph. 2.3, al., Pl. Cri. 43b, etc.; in pl., Hp. Acut. 42; ἀγρυπνίησιν εἴχετο Hdt. 3.129, cf. IG 4.952.50 (Epid.), Ar. Lys. 27, Pl. R. 460d.

unharassed, S. Tr. 1083; οὐδʼ ἀγύμναστον πλάνοις E. Hel. 533; πόνοις οὐκ ἀγύμναστος φρένας Id. Fr. 344.

Aeol. for ἀγορά, gathering, crowd, ἀνδρῶν ἄγυριν Od. 3.31 ; ἐν νεκύων ἀγύρει Il. 16.661 ; ἐν νηῶν ἀ. 24.141; also in E. IA 753 (lyr.); παμπληθὴς ἄ. Orac. ap. Phleg. Macr. 4.
gathering of herbs, Orph. L. 416.

collector, esp. begging priest of Cybele, Μητρὸς ἀ. AP 6.218 (Al.); Γάλλοις ἀ. Babr. 141.1:— then,

got by begging, Hsch.

near the morning, νύξ A.R. 4.111.

passing near, always near, κόλακες AP 10.64 ( Agath.); simply, neighbouring, Nonn. D. 5.38, al.
near with the foot, near, Lyc. 318.
flowing near, A.R. 2.367.
near of kin, οἱ θεῶν ἀγχίσποροι, οἱ Ζηνὸς ἐγγύς A. Fr. 162; φύσιν αἰθέρος οὖσαν ἀ. Ph. 2.374.

data.quote: οἱ θεῶν ἀγχίσποροι, οἱ Ζηνὸς ἐγγύς

children.definition: close kinship, ἡ τοῦ γένους ἀ. Pl. Lg. 924d; ἀ. ὑπάρχει τινὶ πρός τινα Arist. Rh. 1385a3.

rights of kin, right of inheritance, Ar. Av. 1661; προτέροις τοῖς ἄρρεσι τῶν θηλειῶν τὴν ἀ. πεποίηκε Is. 7.20; νόθῳ μηδὲ νόθῃ εἶναι ἀ. Id. 6.47, Lex ap. D. 43.51; ταῖς ἀ. πρότεροι ὄντες τινός Is. 7.44, cf. D. 44.2.

data.quote: προτέροις τοῖς ἄρρεσι τῶν θηλειῶν τὴν ἀ. πεποίηκε

children.definition: exclusion by descent, LXX Ne. 13.29.
= foreg., γένους κατʼ ἀ. S. Ant. 174.

definition: ἀγχιστεύς, έως, ὁ, mostly in pl. ἀγχιστεῖς,

children.definition: next of kin, of nations, Hdt. 5.80:— heir-at-law, LXX Ru. 3.9 (with v.l. ἀγχιστ-ευτής, ib. 4.1), Hierocl. in CA 5p.428M.; συγγενὴς ἀ. Luc. Tim. 51.
of the ἀγχιστεύς, Asp. in EN 77.14.
to be next or near, γῆ ἀγχιστεύουσα . . πόντῳ E. Tr. 224 (lyr.).

children.label: II
children.definition: to be next of kin, heir-at-law, τινί Is. 11.11: metaph., ἀ. ἀγοραίης ἐργασίης Hp. Praec. 8.
ἀ. τινά do a kinsmanʼs office to a woman, i.e. marry her, LXX Ru. 3.13, 4.4; also κληρονομίαν ἀ. enter upon . . , Nu. 36.8.
Pass., to be excluded by descent, ἀπὸ τῆς ἱερατείας 2 Es. 2.62, Ne. 7.64.
one who brings near, πάθους S. Tr. 256.
belonging to the ἀγχιστεία, Ammon. Diff. 5.
within the near kin, γαμεῖν Poll. 6.175, Lex ap. Hsch.
close, crowded, in heaps, αἱ μέν τʼ ἀ. ἐπʼ ἀλλήλῃσι κέχυνται Il. 5.141; τοὶ δʼ ἀ. ἔπιπτον νεκροί 17.361, cf. Od. 22.118.

data.quote: αἱ μέν τʼ ἀ. ἐπʼ ἀλλήλῃσι κέχυνται

definition: ἄγχιστος, ον, Arc. ἄσιστος (v. sub fin.),

children.definition: Sup. of ἄγχι, nearest: as Adj. not in Ep.; nearest in place, A. Ag. 256 (lyr.), S. OT 919; γένει ἄ. πατρός E. Tr. 48; τὸν ἄ. S. El. 1105; ever nigh, Pi. P. 9.64.

children.label: II
children.definition: Hom. has only neut. as Adv., ἄγχιστον nearest, Od. 5.280; more commonly pl., ἄγχιστα ἐῴκει was most nearly like, Il. 2.58, 14.474; ἄ. ἐοικώς Od. 13.80; ἄ. ἐΐσκω 6.152, cf. Pi. I. 2.10: freq. c. gen., Διὸς ἄ. next to Zeus, A. Supp. 1035 (lyr.); ἄ. τοῦ βωμοῦ Hdt. 9.81; ἄ. οἰκεῖν τινος Id. 1.134, al., cf. Hp. Mul. 2.181:— οἱ ἄ. those next of kin, Hdt. 5.79; ἄ. ἦν αὐτῷ γένους Luc. Cat. 17; also τοὶ ʼς ἄσιστα πόθικες IG 5(2).159.17 ( Tegea), cf. Jahresh. 1.197 ( Elis).
nearest to what is right, ‘for choice’, Hp. Art. 14, cf. Acut. 57.

children.label: III
children.definition: most lately, but now, ἄ . . . πόλεμος δέδηεν Il. 20.18; ὁ ἄ. ἀποθανών he who died last, Hdt. 2.143; τὰ ἄ. most recently, Antipho 2.1.6.
turning closely, quick-swooping, ἰκτῖνος Thgn. 1261.

quick-changing, changeable, ἀγχίστροφα βουλεύεσθαι Hdt. 7.13; ἀ. μεταβολή sudden change, Th. 2.53; ἀστάθμητον πρᾶγμα εὐτυχία καὶ ἀ. D.H. 4.23:—Rhet., τὸ ἀ. rapidity of transition, Longin. 27.3; ἁρμονία ἀ. περὶ τὰς πτώσεις a style flexible in the use of the cases, D.H. Comp. 22. Adv. -φως Longin. 22.1.
near its wane, σελήνη Nonn. D. 40.314.
near the border, neighbouring, S. Fr. 384, E. Rh. 426; τινός Theodect. 17, Lyc. 1130.—Poet. (Dithyrambic acc. to Poll. 6.113) and in X. Hier. 10.7.
near the birth, ὠδῖνες pangs of child-birth, Pi. Fr. 88.2, Nonn. D. 24.197; of a woman, AP 7.462 ( Dionys.); νύμφαι Nonn. D. 8.12.
appearing close at hand, Nonn. D. 2.97, al.
Ptol. Tetr. 160.
growing hard by, Nonn. D. 3.152, 12.279.
Comp. of ἄγχι, nearer, EM 14.47.
from near at hand, Hdt. 4.31, Luc. Syr.D. 28.
near, δειρῆς Il. 14.412, cf. Od. 13.103, A.R. 1.37, etc.: abs., Theoc. 22.40, IG 9(2).645 (Thessal.).
neighbouring, c. gen., dub. in Theoc. 25.203.
strangle, Man. 1.317, Suid.

strangling, hanging, ἀγχόνης . . τέρματα A. Eu. 746; ἔργα κρείσσονʼ ἀγχόνης deeds too bad for hanging, S. OT 1374; τάδʼ ἀγχόνης πέλας ʼtis nigh as bad as hanging, E. Heracl. 246; ταῦτʼ οὐχὶ . . ἀγχόνης ἔστʼ ἄξια ; Id. Ba. 246; ταῦτα . . οὐκ ἀ. ; Ar. Ach. 125; οἱ δʼ ἀγχόνην ἥψαντο Semon. 1.18: rare in Prose, ἀ. καὶ λύπη Aeschin. 2.38:— in pl., ἐν ἀγχόναις θάνατον λαβεῖν E. Hel. 200, cf. ib. 299, HF 154; αἱ ἀ. μάλιστα τοῖς νέοις Arist. Pr. 954b35.
strangle, Sch. E. Hipp. 780 ( Pass.).
fit for strangling, βρόχος E. Hel. 686; δεσμός Nonn. D. 21.31, 34.229.
hangman, Gloss.
coming near, A.D. Adv. 194.17.
nearest, next, c. gen., h.Ap. 18, Hdt. 2.169, E. Fr. 620; ἀ. τινός, of likeness, Hdt. 7.64 (v.l. -ότατα), 80, al.; τινί ib. 91; οἱ ἀ. προσήκοντες the nearest of kin, 4.73.

definition: ἀγχότερος, α, ον, Comp. of ἀγχοῦ,

children.definition: nearer, c. gen., Hdt. 7.175. Adv. -οτέρω App. BC 1.57.

near, freq. in Hom., usu. in phrase ἀγχοῦ δʼ ἱσταμένη (or -ος) Il. 2.172, al.; στεῦται δʼ Ὀδυσῆος ἀκοῦσαι ἀ. Od. 17.526, cf. 19.271; ἀ. καθῆσθαι Archil. Supp. 3.3, cf. S. Tr. 962: twice c. gen., Il. 24.709, Od. 6.5: c. dat., Pi. N. 9.40, Hdt. 3.85: in late Prose, λόγοι ἀ. τούτων Philostr. VA 6.16.

definition: ἄγχουρος (A), ον, ( ἄγχι, οὖρος Ion. for ὅρος)

children.definition: neighbouring, AP 9.235 ( Crin.); bordering on, τινί Orph. A. 124; τινός Lyc. 418.
gold, from the name of the son of Midas, AP 15.25.7 codd. ( Besant.), cf. Plu. Par.min. 2.306f.
dawn, Call. Hec. 1.4.10 [Fr. 260.64 Pf. (reading ἄγχαυρος)]; Cypr. acc. to Hsch.

data.ref: Call. Hec. 1.4.10 [Fr. 260.64 Pf. (reading ἄγχαυρος)]; Cypr. acc. to

children.definition: alkanet, Anchusa tinctoria, Thphr. HP 7.8.3, Dsc. 4.23; cf. ἔγχουσα.
rouge, Hsch.

definition: ἄγχραν μύωπα ( Locr.), Hsch. ἀγχράνασθαι (for ἀναχρ-),

children.definition: anoint or wash oneself, Id.

definition: ἄγχω, fut. ἄγξω Ar. Ec. 638, Luc. DMort. 2[22].1: aor. 1 inf. ἄγξαι v.l. for ἄξαι LXX 4 Ma. 9.17, ( ἀπ-) Ar. Pax 796:— Med. and Pass. (v. infr.) only in pres.:—

children.definition: squeeze, esp. the throat, ἄγχε μιν ἱμὰς ὑπὸ δειρήν Il. 3.371; embrace, μὴ θέλουσαν Anacreont. 57.22, cf. Herod. 1.18; hug, in wrestling, Id. 2.12, Luc. Anach. 1, Paus. 8.40.2, Philostr. Im. 1.6 ( Pass.); strangle, throttle, τοὺς πατέρας ἦγχον νύκτωρ Ar. V. 1039, cf. Ec. 638, 640; τὸν Κέρβερον ἀπῇζας ἄγχων Id. Ra. 468, cf. Av. 1575; κἂν ταῦρον ἄγχοις Id. Lys. 81, cf. Crates Com. 29, D. 54.20, Theoc. 5.106, APl. 16.90; ἐν χαλινῷ τὰς σιαγόνας ἄ. LXX Ps. 31 ( 32). 9: metaph., of pressing creditors, Ar. Eq. 775, Luc. Symp. 32; ψυχὴ ὑπὸ τοῦ σώματος ἀγχομένη Corp.Herm. 10.24, cf. 7.3; of a guilty conscience, τοῦτο . . ἄγχει, σιωπᾶν ποιεῖ D. 19.208:— Med., strangle oneself, Hp. Morb. 2.68:— Pass., Pi. N. 1.46, D. 47.59, Theoc. 7.125; to be drowned, Hp. Virg. 1.—Not in Trag.

nearly equal, ἀγχώμαλοι ἐν χειροτονίᾳ Th. 3.49; ἀ. μάχη a doubtful battle, Id. 4.134; τὴν νίκην ἐν ἀγχωμάλῳ καταλιπόντες J. BJ 6.2.6; τὸ πλῆθος οὐκ ἀ. Plu. Caes. 42, cf. D.H. 5.14:—neut. pl. as Adv., ἀγχώμαλα ναυμαχεῖν, Lat. aequo Marte pugnare, Th. 7.71; ἀ. σφισι ἐγένετο Luc. Herm. 12. Adv. -άλως Id. VH 2.37, App. Praef. 11.

definition: ἄγω [ᾰ], impf. ἦγον, Ep. and Ion. ἄγεσκον Hdt. 1.148, A.R. 1.849: fut. ἄξω Il. 1.139, etc.: thematic aor. imper. ἄξετε Il. 3.105, inf. ἀξέμεναι, -έμεν, Il. 23.50, 111: aor. 2 ἤγαγον Il. 6.291, etc., opt. ἀγαγοίην Sapph. 159: aor. 1 ἦξα rare, ἦξε Tim. Pers. 165, part. ἄξας Batr. 119, inf. ἄξαι Antipho 5.46: pf. ἦχα SIG 1 (Abu Simbel, vii/ vi B. C.), Plb. 3.111.3, ( προ-) D. 19.18, ( συν-) X. Mem. 4.2.8; ἀγήγοχα OGI 219.15 ( Sigeum, iii B.C.), etc., Dor. συν-αγάγοχα Test.Epict. 3.12; ἀγήοχα LXX To. 12.3, J. BJ 1.30.1, Alex. Fig. 1.11, etc. (also in compds., ( εἰσ-) Ps.-Philipp. ap. D. 18.39, ( κατ-) Decr. ib. 73); ἀγείοχα PTeb. 5.193 (ii B. C.), etc.; ἀγέωχα ( δι-) CIG 4897d ( Philae, i B. C.), PTeb. 5.198 (ii B. C.), etc.: plpf. ἀγηόχει Plb. 30.4.17:— Med., fut. ἄξομαι Hom., Hdt., Trag.: them. aor. 1 ἄξοντο Il. 8.545, imper. ἄζεσθε ib. 505: also ἀξάμην ( ἐσ-) Hdt. 5.34, ( προεσ-) 1.190, 8.20: aor.2 ἠγαγόμην Hom., etc., 2 sg. ἀγάγαο GDI 5088.8 (Cret.):— Pass., fut. ἀχθήσομαι Pl. Hp.Ma. 292a, ( προσ-) Th. 4.87, etc.; ἄξομαι in pass. sense, A. Ag. 1632, Pl. R. 458d, ( προσ-) Th. 4.115, etc.: aor. 1 ἤχθην X. An. 6.3.10, Ion. ἄχθην Hdt. 6.30, part. ἀχθείς Hippon. 9: pf. ἦγμαι Hdt. 2.158, D. 13.15; also in med. sense, v. infr. B.2.

children.label: I
children.definition: lead, carry, fetch, bring, of living creatures, φέρω being used of things, δῶκε δʼ ἄγειν ἑτάροισι . . γυναῖκα, καὶ τρίποδα . . φέρειν Il. 23.512; βοῦν δʼ ἀγέτην κεράων by the horns, Od. 3.439; ἄ. εἰς or πρὸς τόπον, poet. also c. acc. loci, νόστοι δʼ ἐκ πολέμων ἀπόνους (sc. ἄνδρας) . . ἆγον οἴκους A. Pers. 863 (lyr.); Ἅιδας . . ἄγει τὰν Ἀχέροντος ἀκτάν S. Ant. 811 (lyr.); ἄ. τινά τινι Od. 14.386; ἵππους ὑφʼ ἅρματʼ ἄ. 3.476, cf. A. Pr. 465.

data.quote: δῶκε δʼ ἄγειν ἑτάροισι . . γυναῖκα, καὶ τρίποδα . . φέρειν

children.label: b
children.definition: part. ἄγων taking, στῆσε δʼ ἄγων Il. 2.558, cf. Od. 1.130, S. OC 1342, etc.
take with one, ἑταίρους Od. 10.405, cf. S. OC 832, etc.; τι Il. 15.531, Hdt. 1.70; of a wife, A. Pr. 559 (lyr.) (more usu. Med., q.v.).

carry off as captives or booty, Il. 1.367, 9.594, A. Th. 340, etc.; ἄχθη ἀγόμενος παρὰ βασιλέα Hdt. 6.30; ἀγόμενος, i.e. δοῦλος, Archil. 155, cf. E. Tr. 140, Pl. Lg. 914e; Δίκην ἄγειν to lead Justice forcibly away, Hes. Op. 220; ἡ ἐπιθυμία ἄγει Arist. EN 1147a34; of a fowler, φῦλον ὀρνίθων ἀμφιβαλὼν ἄγει S. Ant. 343: esp. in phrase ἄ. καὶ φέρειν harry, ravage a country, first in Il. 5.484 οἷόν κʼ ἠὲ φέροιεν Ἀχαιοὶ ἤ κεν ἄγοιεν, cf. 23.512 sq.; freq. in Hdt. and Att. Prose:—in Pass., ἀγόμεθα, φερόμεθα E. Tr. 1310, cf. Ar. Nu. 241: more rarely reversed, φέρουσί τε καὶ ἄγουσι Hdt. 1.88; ἔφερε καὶ ἦγε πάντας Id. 3.39: c. acc. loci, φέρων καὶ ἄγων τὴν Βιθυνίδα X. HG 3.2.2; ἦγον καὶ ἔκαον τὴν B. ib. 5; ἄ. alone, ravage, IG 9(1).333 ( Locr., v B. C.): —but φέρειν καὶ ἄγειν sts. means simply bear and carry, bring together, Pl. Phdr. 279c; τὴν ποίησιν φέρειν τε καὶ ἄγειν, i.e. bring it into the state, Id. Lg. 817a, cf. X. Cyr. 3.3.2.

ἄ. εἰς δίκην or δικαστήριον, ἐπὶ τοὺς δικαστάς to carry one before a court of justice, freq. in Att., πρὸς τὴν δίκην ἄ. E. Fr. 1049; ὑπʼ ἐπίγνωσιν ἀχθῆναι PTeb. 28.11 (ii B. C.); simply ἄγειν Pl. Grg. 527a, etc.; ἐπὶ θανάτῳ ἄ. X. An. 1.6.10, etc.:— Pass., ἐπὶ βασιλεῖς ἀχθήσεσθε Ev.Matt. 10.18, cf. PTeb. 331.16 (ii A.D.); φόνου ἄγεσθαι Plu. Par.min. 2.309e.

children.label: b
children.definition: Pass., to be confiscated, τὰ κτήνη ἀχθήσεται πρὸς τὰ ἐκφόρια (to meet the rent) PTeb. 27.75 (ii B. C.).
carry as cargo, import, [ οἶνον] νῆες ἄγουσι Il. 9.72, etc.; ἵνα οἱ σὺν φόρτον ἄγοιμι (i.e. σύν οἱ) Od. 14.296.
draw on, bring on, πῆμα τόδʼ ἤγαγον Οὐρανίωνες Il. 24.547; Ἰλίω φθοράν A. Ag. 406 (lyr.); τερμίαν ἁμέραν S. Ant. 1330 (lyr.); ὕπνον Id. Ph. 638; χαράν E. Fr. 174; δάκρυ Id. Alc. 1081.
bear up, φελλοὶ δʼ ὥς. ἄγουσι δίκτυον A. Ch. 506.
carry far and wide, spread abroad, κλέος Od. 5.311.
remove, φλέγμα Hp. Nat.Hom. 6, cf. Aph. 4.2; ἕλμινθα Dsc. 1.16.

children.label: II
children.definition: lead towards a point, lead on, τὸν δʼ ἄγε μοῖρα κακὴ θανάτοιο τέλοσδε Il. 13.602; κῆρες ἄγον θανάτοιο 2.834; οἷ μʼ ἀτιμίας ἄγεις S. El. 1035: also c. inf., ἄγει θανεῖν leads to death, E. Hec. 43: c. acc. cogn., ἄγομαι τάνδʼ ἑτοίμαν ὁδόν S. Ant. 877 (lyr.); ὁδὸς ἄγει the road leads, Heraclit. 71, S. OT 734, Tab.Heracl. 1.16, etc.: metaph., tend, ἐπὶ τὸ ἄκρον Pl. Lg. 701e.

data.quote: τὸν δʼ ἄγε μοῖρα κακὴ θανάτοιο τέλοσδε

children.definition: lead, guide, esp. in war, λαόν Il. 10.79; ἄ. στρατιάν, ναῦς, etc., Th. 7.12, 8.59, etc., cf. X. An. 4.8.12; hence abs., march, θᾶσσον ὁ Νικίας ἦγε Th. 7.81, cf. X. HG 4.2.19, etc.: simply, go, ἄγωμεν Ev.Marc. 1.38; of the gods, etc., guide, Pi., Hdt., etc.; ἐπʼ ἀρετήν E. Fr. 672; διὰ πόνων ἄγειν τινά Id. IT 988.

manage, νόῳ πλοῦτον Pi. P. 6.47; πολιτείαν Th. 1.127; τὴν σοφίαν conduct philosophical inquiry, Pl. Tht. 172b; of reasoning, ἀγαγεῖν τοὺς λόγους Arist. APr. 47a21; εἰς τὸ ἀδύνατον ἄ. ib. 27a15 (v.l. ἀπάγοντας):— Pass., to be led, guided, λογισμῷ Pl. R. 431c; ἡγούμενος τῶν ἡδονῶν ἀλλʼ οὐκ ἀγόμενος ὑπʼ αὐτῶν Isoc. 9.45.

data.quote: ἡγούμενος τῶν ἡδονῶν ἀλλʼ οὐκ ἀγόμενος ὑπʼ αὐτῶν

children.definition: refer, attribute, τι εἰς ἐθελοκάκησιν Plb. 27.15.13; τι ἐς Διόνυσον Luc. Syr.D. 33.
bring up, train, educate, ἀγόμενοις ὀρθῶς Pl. Lg. 782d; ἤχθη τὴν λεγομένην ἀγωγήν Plu. Ages. 1; of animals, train, X. Mem. 4.1.3.
reduce, ἐς βραχὺ τὴν ἀρχήν Hp. VM 1; ἐς τὸ ἥμισυ Id. Mul. 1.78; of propositions, εἰς ῥᾳδιξστέραν κατασκευήν Papp. 1076.6.

children.label: III
children.definition: draw out in length, τεῖχος ἄ. to draw a line of wall, Th. 6.99; μέλαθρον εἰς ὀρόφους AP 9.649 ( Maced.); ὄγμον ἄ. Theoc. 10.2; ἄ. γραμμάς to draw lines, Arist. Top. 101a16; ἤχθωσαν κάθετοι let perpendiculars be drawn, Mete. 373a11; ἄ. ἐπίπεδον describe a plane, Archim. Sph.Cyl. 1.7, etc.:— Pass., ἦκται ἡ διῶρυξ Hdt. 2.158, cf. Th. 6.100; κόλπου ἀγομένου τῆς γῆς, i.e. when the land forms a bight, Hdt. 4.99.

children.label: IV
children.definition: hold, celebrate, Ἀπατούρια, ὁρτήν, Hdt. 1.147, 183 (more usu. ἀνάγειν); freq. in Att., ἄ. ἀγῶνα IG 1.53.33; θυσίαν, θεωρίαν Isoc. 19.10; κρεουργὸν ἦμαρ εὐθύμως ἄγειν A. Ag. 1592; γάμους Men. Sam. 336, cf. LXX To. 11.19 ( Pass.); ἐκκλησίαν Plu. Aem. 30:— Pass., ἀγοραῖοι ἄγονται Act.Ap. 19.38.
keep, observe a date, ἄ. τὴν ἡμέραν ταύτην πάντα τὸν χρόνον Th. 5.54, cf. Men. 521; κατὰ σελήνην τὰς ἡμέρας Ar. Nu. 626; reckon, τοὺς ἐνιαυτοὺς καθʼ ἥλιον Gem. 8.6.

data.quote: ἄ. τὴν ἡμέραν ταύτην πάντα τὸν χρόνον

children.definition: keep, observe, ὀρθὰν ἄγεις ἐφημοσύναν Pi. P. 6.20; σπονδὰς ἄ. πρός τινας Th. 6.7; εἰρήνην Pl. R. 465b, etc.: c. acc., as periphr. for a neut. Verb, σχολὴν ἄγειν, = σχολάζειν, E. Med. 1238, Pl. R. 376d; ἡσυχίαν ἄ., = ἡσυχάζειν, X. An. 3.1.14; ἄ. ἀπαστίαν Ar. Nu. 621; κρύψιν ἄ., of stars betw. setting and rising, Autol. 2.9; keep up, sustain, maintain, νεῖκος Pi. P. 9.31; γέλωτʼ ἄγειν to keep laughing, S. Aj. 382; ἄ. κτύπον E. Or. 182 (lyr.); with predicate, maintain, ἐλευθέραν ἦγε τὴν Ἑλλάδα D. 9.36.

pass, ἀπήμαντον ἄγων βίοτον Pi. O. 8.87; ποίας ἡμέρας δοκεῖς μʼ ἄγειν; S. El. 266; ὁ βίος οὑμὸς ἑσπέραν ἄγει Alex. 228, cf. ὥραν ἄγειν to be ripe, τῆς γαστρὸς ὥραν ἀγούσης Philostr. VA 2.14; ὥραν ἦγε θανάτου Chor. p.38B [7.1.2].; τῆς ἡλικίας ἄγον τὸ ἄνθος Id. p.53B [26.2.6]. ; τέταρτον ἔτος ἄγων καὶ τριακοστόν Gal. Lib.Propr. 1.
hold, αἵρεσιν Plb. 27.15.14.

children.label: V
children.definition: hold account, treat, ἄ. ἀρετὰν οὐκ αἴσχιον φυᾶς Pi. I. 7(6).22; ἐν τιμῇ ἄγειν or ἄγεσθαι, ἐν οὐδεμιῇ μοίρῃ ἄ., περὶ πλείστου ἄ., Hdt. 1.134, 2.172, 9.7, etc.; θεοὺς ἄ. to believe in, A. Supp. 924; διὰ τιμῆς ἄ. τινά, etc., Luc. Prom.Es 4, etc.; τὸ πρᾶγμʼ ἄ . . . ὡς παρʼ οὐδέν S. Ant. 34; τὴν Ἀφροδίτην πρόσθʼ ἄ. τοῦ Βακχίου E. Ba. 225; τιμιώτερον ἄ. τινά Th. 8.81; εὐεργεσίας εἰς ἀχαριστίαν καὶ προπηλακισμὸν ἄ. D. 18.316:—with Adverbs, δυσφόρως τοὔνειδος ἦγον S. OT 784; ἐντίμως ἄ. Pl. R. 528c, etc.:— Pass., ἠγόμην δʼ ἀνὴρ ἀστῶν μέγιστος S. OT 775.

data.quote: τὸ πρᾶγμʼ ἄ . . . ὡς παρʼ οὐδέν
τὴν Ἀφροδίτην πρόσθʼ ἄ. τοῦ Βακχίου
εὐεργεσίας εἰς ἀχαριστίαν καὶ προπηλακισμὸν ἄ.

children.label: VI
children.definition: draw down in the scale, hence, weigh, ἄ. μνᾶν, τριακοσίους δαρεικούς, etc., weigh a mina, 300 darics, etc., D. 22.76, 24.129, cf. Philippid. 9.4, etc.; ἄ. πλέον Arist. Pr. 931b15; ἄ. σταθμόν Plu. Mult. 2.96b.

children.label: VII
children.definition: ἄγε, ἄγετε, v. s.vocc.

children.label: B
children.definition: Med. ἄγομαι, carry away for oneself, χρυσόν τε καὶ ἄργυρον οἴκαδʼ ἄγεσθαι Od. 10.35; take with one, 6.58, E. Heracl. 808, etc.; of a shipʼs cargo, D. 35.20; take to oneself, δῶρον Theoc. 1.9, cf. II; take upon oneself, ἄγεσθαι ἐς χεῖρας Hdt. 1.126, 4.79.

data.quote: χρυσόν τε καὶ ἄργυρον οἴκαδʼ ἄγεσθαι

data.ref: E. Heracl. 808, etc.; of a shipʼs cargo,

children.definition: ἄγεσθαι γυναῖκα take to oneself a wife, Od. 14.211; γυναῖκα ἄ. ἐς τὰ οἰκία Hdt. 1.59, etc.; ἄγεσθαί τινα ἐς δῶμα Hes. Th. 410; simply ἄ. marry, Hdt. 2.47, etc.: pf. Pass. ἦγμαι is used in this med. sense, J. AJ 14.12.1; of the father, bring home a wife for his son, Od. 4.10, Hdt. 1.34; of a brother, Od. 15.238; of friends of the bridegroom and bride, Od. 6.28, Hes. Sc. 274: later in Pass. of the wife, PGnom. 138 (ii A.D.).

data.ref: Od. 15.238; of friends of the bridegroom and bride,

children.definition: Act., bring; διὰ στόμα ἄγεσθαι μῦθον bring through the mouth, i.e. utter, Il. 14.91.
fit for leading by, of a dogʼs collar or leash, AP 6.35 ( Leon.).
panderʼs house, Poll. 9.48 (perh. f.l. for ἀσωτεῖον).
haulier, Hdt. 2.175.
escort, guide, Milet. 3.152.16 ( Methymna, ii B. C.).
prosecutor (cf. ἄγω 1.4), Suid.

children.label: II
children.definition: leading-rein, leash, S. Fr. 974, Stratt. 52, X. Eq. 6.5.

children.label: III
children.definition: guide, director, Anecd.Stud. 1.265.
carrying away, Hdt. 6.85, etc.; freight, carriage, πρὸς τὰς ἀγωγὰς . . χρῆσθαι ὑποζυγίοις Pl. R. 370e, cf. X. Lac. 7.5, PLond. 3.948.2 (iii A.D.).

children.label: b
children.definition: τὴν ἀ. διὰ τάχους ἐποιεῖτο pursued his voyage, Th. 4.29 (v.l.); movement, Pl. R. 604b; ἀ. ἐπί τι tendency towards . . , Hp. Epid. 1.1.
bringing to or in, ὑμῶν ἡ ἐς τοὺς ὀλίγους ἀ. your bringing us before the council, Th. 5.85.
forcible seizure, carrying off, abduction, A. Ag. 1263, S. OC 662; ἀγωγὴν ποιήσασθαι PTeb. 39.22 (ii B. C.), cf. 48.22.
ὕδατος ἀγωγαί aqueducts, IG 12(5).872 ( Tenos), cf. D.H. 3.67.
load, Ostr. 1168; weight, AB 333.
winding up of engine, Ph. Bel. 57.13 (pl.).
drawing of lines, Procl. in Euc. pp. 284,376F.
evoking, πνευμάτων Iamb. Myst. 3.6 (pl.).

children.label: b
children.definition: spell for bringing a person, usu. love-charm, PMag.Par. 1.1390.

children.label: II
children.definition: leading, guidance, ἵππου X. Eq. 6.4; ἡ τοῦ νόμου, τοῦ λογισμοῦ ἀ. Pl. Lg. 645a, cf. Plt. 274b.

data.quote: ἡ τοῦ νόμου, τοῦ λογισμοῦ ἀ.

children.definition: leading of an army, Id. Lg. 746e (pl.); ἀ. στραταρχίας conduct of an expedition, Vett.Val. 339.29; ἡ ἀ. τῶν πραγμάτων Plb. 3.8.5.

direction, training, παιδεία μέν ἐσθʼ ἡ παίδων ὁλκή τε καὶ ἀ. πρὸς τὸν ὑπὸ τοῦ νόμου λόγον ὀρθὸν εἰρημένον Pl. Lg. 659d, cf. 819a; ἀ. ὀρθῆς τυχεῖν πρὸς ἀρετήν Arist. EN 1179b31; διὰ τὸ ἦθος καὶ τὴν ἀ. Id. Pol. 1292b14, cf. Cleanth.Stoic. 1.107: in pl., systems of education, Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.173; esp. of the public education of the Spartan youth, Λακωνικὴ ἀ. Plb. 1.32.1; Ἀγησίλαος ἤχθη τὴν λεγομένην ἀγωγὴν ἐν Λακεδαίμονι Plu. Ages. 1; ἀ. στοιχειώδης elementary course, Apollon.Perg. Con. 1 Praef.:—also of plants, culture, Thphr. HP 1.3.2; of diseases, treatment, Gal. 12.414, 15.436.

data.quote: παιδεία μέν ἐσθʼ ἡ παίδων ὁλκή τε καὶ ἀ. πρὸς τὸν ὑπὸ τοῦ νόμου λόγον ὀρθὸν εἰρημένον
διὰ τὸ ἦθος καὶ τὴν ἀ.

data.ref: Chrysipp.Stoic. 3.173; esp. of the public education of the Spartan youth,

data.quote: Ἀγησίλαος ἤχθη τὴν λεγομένην ἀγωγὴν ἐν Λακεδαίμονι

children.definition: way of life, conduct, Archyt. ap. Stob. 2.31.120 (pl.), PTeb. 24.57 (ii B. C.), OGI 223.15 ( Erythrae, iii B. C.), LXX 2 Ma. 6.8, 2 Ep.Tim. 3.10, M.Ant. 1.6.
keeping, observance, ἡμερῶν Aristox. Rhyth. 2.37; μηνῶν Gem. 8.48.
method, construction (of a law), Arist. Rh. 1375b12; style, D.H. Isoc. 20, al.; ἡ ἀ. τῶν διαλέκτων Str. 14.1.41.
method of proof, esp. of syllogistic reasoning, λόγοι τὰς ἀγωγὰς ὑγιεῖς ἔχοντες Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.84, cf. Simp. in Ph. 759.14; line of argument, Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.106b.
school of philosophers, Phld. Sto.Herc. 339.12, Acad.Ind. p.68 M., S.E. P. 1.145, etc.
manoeuvre, movement, Ascl. Tact. 12.7 and 10; order of march, ib. 11.8, cf. Ael. Tact. 39.1.
= Lat. actio, Cod.Just. 4.24.1, al.

children.label: III
children.definition: tempo, in music, Pl. R. 400c (pl.), Aristox. Harm. p.34 M., Aristid.Quint. 1.19; sequence, of a melody, Aristox. Harm. p.29 M.; musical style, Str. 14.1.41, Plu. Mus. 2.1141c.
expenses of transport, Cod.Just. 10.30.4.
capable of being carried, τρισσῶν ἁμαξῶν . . ἀ. βάρος enough to load, E. Cyc. 385; τὰ ἀ. things portable, wares, Pl. Prt. 313c, X. An. 5.1.16, etc.; ἄλλο δὲ μηδὲν ἀ. ἄγεσθαι ἐν τῷ πλοίῳ D. 35.20.

data.quote: ἄλλο δὲ μηδὲν ἀ. ἄγεσθαι ἐν τῷ πλοίῳ

children.label: II
children.definition: liable to seizure, X. HG 7.3.11, cf. D. 23.11, Plu. Sol. 13, BGU 1116.27 (13 B.C.):—also of things, D.H. 5.69.
easily led, pliable, Plu. Alc. 6.

children.label: III
children.definition: Act., ἀγώγιμον, τό, love-charm, philtre, Plu. Suav. 2.1093d, cf. PMag.Lond. 121.295: pl., PMag.Par. 1.2231.
load of a wagon, X. Cyr. 6.1.54, PPetr. 3p.101 (iii B. C.), PLond. 3.1166.13 (i A.D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: carriage of such a load, PPetr. l.c.

leading, guiding, and as Subst., guide, Hdt. 3.26; escort, Th. 2.12, cf. 4.78; ἀ. ὕδατος aqueduct, Mon.Anc.Gr. 19.5 (pl.); without ὕδατος, Just. Nov. 128.16 (pl.): c. gen., δύναμις ἀνθρώπων ἀ. power of leading men, Plu. Lyc. 5.

children.label: II
children.definition: leading towards, ἐπί τι Pl. R. 525a, Phld. D. 3.12; εἰς . . Plu. Per. 1.

children.label: III
children.definition: drawing, attracting, δύναμις ἀ. τινος, of the magnet, Dsc. 5.130.
drawing forth, eliciting, χοαὶ νεκρῶν ἀγωγοί E. Hec. 536; δακρύων ἀ. Id. Tr. 1131; γυναικείων Hp. Aph. 5.28; ἐμμήνων Dsc. 1.16.
attractive, Plu. Crass. 7; τὸ ἀ. attractiveness, Id. Aud.poet. 2.25b.
PSI 4.423.6, al. (iii B. C.).

definition: ἀγών [ ᾰ], ῶνος, ὁ, Aeol. ἄγωνος, ου, ὁ, Alc. 121 (also E. ap. Sch.Il. Oxy. 1087.60); Elean dat. pl. ἀγώνοιρ GDI 1172.26: ( ἄγω):—

children.definition: gathering, assembly, ἵζανεν εὐρὺν ἀ. Il. 23.258; λῦτο δʼ ἀ. 24.1, cf. Od. 8.200; νεῶν ἐν ἀγῶνι Il. 15.428, cf. Eust. 1335.57: esp. assembly met to see games, freq. in Il. 23; Ὑπερβορέων ἀ. Pi. P. 10.30; κοινοὺς ἀ. θέντες A. Ag. 845.

place of contest, lists, course, βήτην ἐς μέσσον ἀ. Il. 23.685, cf. 531, Od. 8.260, Hes. Sc. 312, Pi. P. 9.114, and esp. Th. 5.50: prov., ἔξω ἀγῶνος out of the lists or course, i.e. beside the mark, Pi. P. 1.44, Luc. Anach. 21: pl., κατʼ ἀγῶνας Od. 8.259.

children.label: II
children.definition: assembly of the Greeks at the national games, ὁ ἐν Ὀλυμπίῃ ἀ. Hdt. 6.127; ὁ Ὀλυμπικὸς ἀ. Ar. Pl. 583; Ἑλλάδος πρόσχημʼ ἀ. S. El. 682, cf. 699:— hence, contest for a prize at the games, ἀ. γυμνικός, ἱππικός, μουσικός, Hdt. 2.91, Pl. Lg. 658a, Ar. Pl. 1163, cf. Th. 3.104; οἱ τῶν λαμπάδων ἀ. Arist. Ath. 57.1; ἀ. τῶν ἀνδρῶν contest in which the chorus was composed of men, opp. to παίδων or ἀγενείων (q.v.), D. 21.18, etc.; ἀ. στεφανηφόρος or στεφανίτης contest where the prize is a crown, Hdt. 5.102, Arist. Rh. 1357a19; ἀ. χάλκεος, where it is a shield of brass, Pi. N. 10.22; ἀ. θεματικός IG 14.739 ( Naples); ἀργυρίτης δωρίτης Plu. Praec. 2.820d:—hence many phrases, ἀγῶνα καταστῆσαι establish a contest, Isoc. 4.1; τιθέναι Hdt. 5.8; ποιεῖν Th. 3.104; οὐ λόγων τοὺς ἀ. προθήσοντες Id. 3.67; προηγόρευέ τε ἀγῶνας καὶ ἆθλα προυτίθει X. Cyr. 8.2.26; προκαλούμενος ἑαυτὸν εἰς ἀ. Id. Mem. 2.3.17; τοὺς ἀ. νικᾶν ib. 3.7.1; ἐν τοῖς ἀγῶσι Isoc. 15.301; of contests in general, εἰς ἀ. λόγων ἀφικέσθαι τινί Pl. Prt. 335a; πρὸς τίνʼ ἀγῶνας τιθέμεσθʼ ἀρετῆς; E. Ion 863 (lyr.); ἀ. σοφίας Ar. Ra. 883.

data.quote: προηγόρευέ τε ἀγῶνας καὶ ἆθλα προυτίθει

children.label: III
children.definition: struggle, πολλοὺς ἀ. ἐξιών, of Hercules, S. Tr. 159; ξιφηφόρος ἀ. A. Ch. 584; εἰς ἀ. τῷδε συμπεσὼν μάχης S. Tr. 20, etc; ὁ Φίλιππος, πρὸς ὀν ἦν ἡμῖν ὁ ἀ. D. 18.67; ποιέειν ἢ παθεῖν πρόκειται ἀ. Hdt. 7.11; ἀληθείην ἀσκέειν ἀ. μέγιστος ib. 209: pl., πραγμάτων ἀγῶνας κεκτημένων Epicur. Sent. 21; ἄπορος ἀ. Lys. 7.2; ὅπλων ἔκειτʼ ἀ. πέρι S. Aj. 936; and without περί, τῶν Ἀχιλλείων ὅπλων ἀ. ib. 1240; ψυχῆς ἀ. τὸν προκείμενον πέρι struggle for life and death, E. Or. 847, cf. Ph. 1330; πολλοὺς ἀ. δραμέονται περὶ σφέων αὐτῶν Hdt. 8.102; λόγων γὰρ οὐ . . ἁγών, ἀλλὰ σῆς ψυχῆς πέρι S. El. 1492, cf. infr. 5.

data.quote: ὁ Φίλιππος, πρὸς ὀν ἦν ἡμῖν ὁ ἀ.
πολλοὺς ἀ. δραμέονται περὶ σφέων αὐτῶν
λόγων γὰρ οὐ . . ἁγών, ἀλλὰ σῆς ψυχῆς πέρι

children.definition: battle, action, Th. 2.89, etc.
action at law, trial, Antipho 6.21, etc., cf. A. Eu. 677, 744; εἰς ἀγῶνα καθιστάναι ἀνθρώπους Pl. Ap. 24c, R. 494e; περὶ τῆς ψυχῆς εἰς ἀγῶνα καταστῆσαί τινα X. Lac. 8.4.

data.quote: περὶ τῆς ψυχῆς εἰς ἀγῶνα καταστῆσαί τινα

children.definition: speech delivered in court or before an assembly or ruler, πρεσβευτικοὶ ἀ. Plb. 9.32.4; τοὺς ἐπιφανεστάτους εἰρηκότος ἀ. τούς τε δικανικοὺς καὶ τοὺς δημηγορικούς D.H. Amm. 1.3, cf. OGI 567 ( Attalia, ii A.D.); ἀ. ἐσχηματισμένοι D.H. Rh. 8.1, al.

data.quote: τοὺς ἐπιφανεστάτους εἰρηκότος ἀ. τούς τε δικανικοὺς καὶ τοὺς δημηγορικούς

children.label: b
children.definition: main argument of a speech (opp. προοίμιον, ἐπίλογος), in pl., Syr. in Hermog. 2.111, 170R., cf. Proll. Hermog. ap. Rh. 4.12 W.

οὐ λόγων ἔθʼ ἁγών now is not the time for words, E. Ph. 588; οὐχ ἕδρας ἀ. ʼtis no time for sitting still, Id. Or. 1291; ἀ. πρόφασιν οὐ δέχεται the crisis admits no dallying, Ar. Fr. 331, cf. Pl. Cra. 421d, Lg. 751d; μέγας ὁ ἀ. . . τὸ χρηστὸν ἢ κακὸν γενέσθαι the issue is great . . , Id. R. 608b, cf. E. Med. 235; οὐ περί τινος ὁ ἀ. the question is not about . . , Th. 3.44.
mental struggle, anxiety, Th. 7.71, Plb. 4.56.4, Ep.Col. 2.1: in pl., τρόμοι καὶ ἀ. Plu. Sol. 7.

children.label: b
children.definition: vehemence, power, Longin. 15.1, cf. 26.3.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Ἀγών, divinity of the contest, Paus. 5.26.3.
judge of a contest, S. Aj. 572.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀγών = assembly) Boeotian magistrate, IG 7.1817 ( Thespiae), cf. Sch. Il. 24.1.

contest, struggle for victory, ἀγὼν διὰ πάσης ἀγωνίης ἔχων Hdt. 2.91; πολεμίων ἀ. E. Hec. 314, cf. Tr. 1003; esp. in games, Pi. O. 2.52, P. 5.113:—also in Prose, ἐν δημοτικῇ ἀ. X. Cyr. 2.3.15; ἅπασαν ἀ. ἐκτεῖναι [D.] 60.30, etc.
gymnastic exercise, Hp. Art. 11, Pl. Men. 94b, Lg. 765c, etc.: generally, exercise, Id. Grg. 456d sq., R. 618b.

agony, anguish, ἐν φόβῳ καὶ πολλῇ ἀ. D. 18.33, cf. Men. 534.12 (pl.), Arist. Pr. 869b6; ἐν τοῖς τῆς ψυχῆς φόβοις, ἐλπίσιν, ἀγωνίαις Id. Spir. 483a5; cf. Chrysipp.Stoic. 2.248, al., Phld. Ir. p. 56 W. (pl.), Nic.Dam. Vit.Caes. 9.

data.quote: ἐν τοῖς τῆς ψυχῆς φόβοις, ἐλπίσιν, ἀγωνίαις

children.definition: nervous person, D.L. 2.131.

definition: ἀγωνιάω, inf. -ιᾶν Pl. Prt. 333e, part. -ιῶν Id. Chrm. 162c, Isoc. 4.91: impf. ἠγωνίων Plb. 1.10.6, etc.: fut. -άσω [ᾱ] Porph. Abst. 1.54: aor. ἠγωνίᾱσα Timocl. 22.5, Phld. Oec. p.41 J., D.S. 14.60: pf. ἠγωνίᾱκα ( ὑπερ-) [D.] 61.28:—

children.definition: contend eagerly, struggle, D. 21.61; πρὸς ἀλλήλους Isoc. l.c.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be distressed or anxious, be in an agony, τετραχύνθαι τε καὶ ἀ. Pl. Prt. 333e; ἀγωνιῶντα καὶ τεθορυβημένον Id. Ly. 210e, cf. Arist. Pr. 869b8, Men. Her. 2, PPetr. 3p.151; περί τινος Arist. Rh. 1367a15: c.acc., Plb. 1.20.6, al.; ἐπί τινι Plu. Caes. 46; ἀ. μή . . Plb. 3.9.2, etc.; ἀ. εἴ τι πείσεται Nic.Dam. Vit.Caes. 9.

definition: ἀγωνίζομαι, fut. -ῐοῦμαι E. Heracl. 992, etc. (in pass. sense, v. infr. B); -ίσομαι only in late writers, as Porph. Abst. 1.31; -ισθήσομαι Aristid. 1.504J.: aor. ἠγωνισάμην E. Supp. 427, etc.: pf. ἠγώνισμαι (in act. sense) Id. Ion 939, Ar. V. 993, Isoc. 18.31 ( Pass., v. infr. B): aor. ἠγωνίσθην in pass. sense, infr. B: act. form ἀγωνίσας IG 4.429 ( Sicyon):—

children.label: A
children.definition: contend for a prize, esp. in the public games, Hdt. 2.160, al.; πρός τινα Pl. R. 579c, al.; περί τινος about a thing, Hdt. 8.26; Ὀλυμπίασιν Pl. Hp.Mi. 364a; περὶ πρωτείων D. 18.66; ὑπὲρ τῆς ἐλευθερίας Id. 18.177: freq. c. acc. cogn., ἀ. στάδιον Hdt. 5.22; τῶν ἀγώνων, οὓς περὶ τῆς ψυχῆς ἠγωνίζεσθε D. 18.262; ἀγῶνα . . τόνδʼ ἠγωνίσω thou didst provoke this contest, E. Supp. 427, cf. Ion 939; ἠγωνίζου τι ἡμῖν ; Pl. Ion 530a: metaph., τὰ τῆς ψυχῆς Ὀλύμπια Porph. Abst. l.c.

data.quote: τῶν ἀγώνων, οὓς περὶ τῆς ψυχῆς ἠγωνίζεσθε

children.definition: fight, Hdt. 1.76, 82, al.; περὶ τῶν ἁπάντων Th. 6.16; πρός τινα Id. 1.36, cf. 8.27: c. acc. cogn., μῶν τι κεδνὸν-ίζετο; E. Heracl. 795; [ μάχην] -ίσαντο E. Supp. 637.

contend for the prize on the stage, of the rhapsode, Hdt. 5.67; of the playwright, Ar. Ach. 140, 419; of the actor, D. 19.246, cf. 250, Arist. Po. 1451a8; of the choragus, D. 21.66: c. acc., δράματα IG 12(7).226 ( Amorgos): generally, contend for victory, καλῶς . . ἠγώνισαι Pl. Smp. 194a, cf. Mx. 235d; argue, ὅλῳ τῷ πράγματι about the question as a whole, Hp.Mi. 369c; esp. argue sophistically, opp. διαλέγομαι, Tht. 167e.
X. Mem. 3.7.4; ἀ. πρὸς ἀπόδειξιν Arist. Fr. 133 ( Theodect. ap. Rh. 6.19 W.).

children.label: II
children.definition: contend in court, as law term, Antipho 5.7: c. acc. cogn., ἀ. δίκην, γραφήν fight a cause to the last, Lys. 3.20, D. 23.100; ἀ. ψευδομαρτυριῶν (sc. γραφήν) Id. 24.131; ἀ. ἀγῶνα And. 1.20, Lys. 7,39; ἀ, φόνον fight against a charge of murder, E. Andr. 336; αὐτοῖς ἀ. τοῖς πράγμασιν grapple with the facts of the case, Arist. Rh. 1404a5.

children.label: III
children.definition: struggle, exert oneself, c. inf., Th. 4.87; εὖ ἀ. Lys. 20.22, cf. Plu. Phoc. 37.

children.label: B
children.definition: Pass., to be decided by contest, brought to issue, mostly in pf., πολλοὶ ἀγῶνες ἀγωνίδαται Hdt. 9.26; τὰ ἠγωνισμένα points at issue, E. Supp. 465, D. 24.145: rarely in pres., ὁ ἀγωνιζόμενος νόμος the law on trial, D. 24.28; or aor., δεινὸς . . κίνδυνος ὑπὲρ τῆς . . ἐλευθερίας ἠγωνίσθη Lys. 2.34; ἠγωνίσθη λαμπρῶς (impers.) Plu. Sert. 21: fut. Med. in pass. sense, ἀγωνιεῖται καὶ κριθήσεται τὸ πρᾶγμα shall be brought to issue and determined, D. 21.7.

data.quote: δεινὸς . . κίνδυνος ὑπὲρ τῆς . . ἐλευθερίας ἠγωνίσθη

children.definition: of or belonging to the contest, ἄεθλος ἀ. its prize, Pi. I. 5(4).7; εὖχος Id. O. 10(11).63; πούς Simon. 29:— epith. of Hermes as president of games, Pi. I. 1.60, cf. IG 5(1).658; of Zeus as decider of the contest, S. Tr. 26:— ἀ. θεοί, in A. Ag. 513, Supp. 189, 242, Pl. Lg. 783a, either gods in assembly, or the gods who presided over the great games (Zeus, Poseidon, Apollo, and Hermes), = ἀγοραῖοι θ., Eust. 1335.58.
ἀγωνίῳ σχολᾷ S. Aj. 104, either pause from battle, or strenuous rest (oxymoron, cf. Sch.).
without angle, ἀ. σχῆμα ὁ κύκλος Arist. Metaph. 1020a35, cf. Thphr. HP 3.14.2.
a contending for a prize, Th. 5.50.
contest, conflict: in pl., deeds done in battle, brave deeds, Hdt. 8.76; feats of horsemanship, X. Eq.Mag. 3.5; ἀ. κατὰ τὰ ἆθλα CIG 2741.
feat, achievement, ἀ. τινος a feather in his cap, Th. 8.12, cf. 17: c. inf., Id. 7.59, 86; ξυνέσεως ἀ. prize of sagacity, Id. 3.82; ἀρᾶς ἀ. issue of the curse, E. Ph. 1355.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀ. ποιεῖσθαί τι make it an object to strive for, Hdt. 1.140; οὐ μικρὸν τὸ ἀ. προστάττεις Luc. Im. 12.

children.label: III
children.definition: that with which one contends, declamation, ἀ. ἐς τὸ παραχρῆμα Th. 1.22; of plays, Arist. Po. 1451b37.

children.label: IV
children.definition: plea, Antipho 5.36, Lys. 13.77.
rivalry, Th. 7.70.
one must contend, X. Cyr. 1.6.9, D. 9.70.

definition: ἀγωνιστήριος, α, ον, also ος, ον ( Poll. 4.89),

children.definition: Anaxipp. 6.6.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀγωνιστήριον, τό, place of assembly, Aristid. 1.108 J.
combatant, ἀ. πικροί E. Ion 1257 :—esp. competitor in the games, Hdt. 2.160, 5.22; generally, opp. κριτής, Isoc. 2.13, Th. 3.37, etc.:—as Adj., ἀ. ἵπποι race-horses, Plu. Them. 25.
pleader, debater, Pl. Phdr. 269d, Tht. 164c.
actor, Arist. Pr. 918b28; θεωροῖς εἴτʼ ἀγωνισταῖς Achae. 3; ἀ. τραγικῶν παθῶν Timae. 119.

children.label: II
children.definition: master in any art or science, Isoc. 15.201,204; ἄκρος ἀ. [τῆς γεωμετρίας] [D.] 61.44.

children.label: III
children.definition: one who struggles for a thing, champion, ἀ. τῆς ἀρετῆς, ἀληθείας, Aeschin. 3.180 (pl.), Plu. Aud.poet. 2.16c.
fit for contest, esp. in the games, δύναμις ἀ. Arist. Rh. 1360b22; ἀ. σώματος ἀρετή ib. 1361b21; ἡ -κή the art of combat or contest, Pl. Sph. 225a sq.; τὸ ἀ. ib. 219c, 219e.
fit for contest in speaking, ἀ. λέξις debating style, Arist. Rh. 1413b9; contentions, λόγοι Id. SE 165b11, al.; ἀ. διατριβαί Id. Top. 157a23: Comp. -ώτεραι, προτάσεις Alex.Aphr. in Top. 522.27.
masterly, striking, ἀ. προρρήματα Hp. Art. 58; ἀ. τι ἔχουσα having in it something glorious, ib. 70; πράξεις Men.Rh. p.384S.

children.label: b
children.definition: striking, impressive, Longin. 23.1; -κόν, τό, Id. 22.3: Sup. -ώτατος ἑαυτοῦ, of Plato, Them. Or. 34p.448D.
‘heroic’, i.e. copious, πόσεις Philagr. ap. Orib. 5.19. Adv. -κῶς Herod. ib. 5.30.31, Gal. 15.499; and so of ‘heroic’ measures generally, -κῶς θεραπεύειν 18(1).61.

children.label: II
children.definition: contentious, eager for applause, Pl. Men. 75c, Phld. Oec. p.65J.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -κῶς contentiously, Arist. Top. 164b15; ἀ. ἔχειν to be disposed to fight, Plu. Sull. 16: Comp., ἐπιστολὰς -ώτερον τοῦ δέοντος ἐπέστελλε Philostr. VS 2.33.3.
dramatically, ᾄδειν Arist. Pr. 918b21; opp. καταστατικῶς, Aps. p.266 H.
judge of the contest, Hsch.
office of ἀγωνοθέτης, direction or exhibition of games, IG 2.379 (iii B. C.), Nic.Dam. Vit.Caes. 9, Plu. Ages. 21, etc.: pl., prob. in Phld. Rh. 2.27 S.

children.definition: exhibit games, GDI 1842 (Delph.), etc.; ἀ. Πύθια, Ὀλύμπια AP 12.255 ( Strat.); μίμοις ἀ. Plu. QConv. 2.621c: metaph., Th. 3.38.
ἀ. τινάς embroil them, Plb. 9.343; ἀ. στάσιν, πόλεμον, etc., stir up faction, war, etc., Plu. Cat.Mi. 45, J. AJ 17.3.1.

children.label: II
children.definition: preside at the games, D. 9.32, cf. Pl. Smp. 184a.

definition: ἀγωνοθετήρ, ῆρος, ὁ, = sq., IG 14.502 ( Catana).

children.definition: judge of the contests, president of the games, or (later) exhibitor of games, Hdt. 6.127, And. 4.26, Decr. ap. D. 18.84, IG 2.314 (iii B. C.), etc.
judge, X. An. 3.1.21; πολιτικῆς ἀρετῆς Aeschin. 3.180.
of or for the direction of the games, χρήματα CIG 2742 ( Aphrodisias), IG 5(1).550 ( Sparta):—of a person, CIG 6824 ( Constantinople).

definition: ἀγωνοθέτις, ιδος, fem. of ἀγωνοθέτης, IGRom. 4.1225 ( Thyatira), 1238.

children.definition: S. Fr. 975, criticized as irreg. by Poll. 3.141.

children.definition: laborious discussion, Gal. 1.79.
without angle, Thphr. HP 7.6.2 ( Comp.).

definition: ἄγωνος, ὁ, Aeol. and Elean for ἀγών, q.v.

children.definition: frequenting declamations, Phld. Rh. 2.85 S.

definition: ἀδαγμός, ὁ, v. sub ὀδαγμός; cf. ἀδακτῶ.

children.definition: without resin, Thphr. HP 5.1.5.
not lighted by torches: of marriage, clandestine, Apion ap. Eust. 622.42.
ignorance, unskilfulness in doing, c. inf., Od. 24.244 ( v.l. ἀδαημοσύνη).
unknowing, ignorant, c. gen., μάχης ἀδαήμονι φωτί Il. 5.634; κακῶν ἀδαήμονες Od. 12.208; ἀ. τῶνἱρῶν τῶν ἐν Ἐλευσῖνι Hdt. 8.65, cf. Matro Parod.Fr. 6, Hierocl. in CA 4p.425M.: abs., Ps.-Phoc. 86.

= foreg., c. gen. pers., Hdt. 9.46: c.gen.rei, τῆς θυσίης, τῶν χρησμῶν, Id. 2.49, 5.90, cf. X. Cyr. 1.6.43; βουνομίας -έστερος Pi. Pae. 4 27; ὕπνʼ ὀδύνας ἀ. S. Ph. 827 (lyr.): c. inf., unknowing how to . . , ἀ. δʼ ἔχειν μυρίον ἄχθος (sc. κήρ) ib. 1167 (lyr.); οὐκ ἀ. APl. 16.84: abs., ἀ. κόρη, of a virgin, Paus.Dam. p. 160 D.

children.label: II
children.definition: dark, Parm. 8.59.
unknown, Hes. Th. 655, Hymn.Is. 157.
not carved, plain, Orph. A. 403.
undivided, A.R. 3.1033.
undestroyed, Q.S. 1.196, 11.165.

definition: ἀδάϊος, ον, Dor. for ἀδήϊος, Hsch.

children.definition: producing surfeit, Sophr. 137.
of which none might eat, θυσία A. Ag. 151.
for which nothing has been slain, δεῖπνον Nonn. D. 17.51, 40.419.
undivided, Hsch.
tearless, αἰών Pi. O. 2.66, E. Alc. 1047, Clearch. 8; ὑπὸ τροφῷ ἄ., of a healthy child, Theoc. 24.31.

children.label: II
children.definition: E. Med. 861 (lyr.): costing no tears, πόλεμος D.S. 15.72; μάχη Plu. Ages. 33.
tearlessly, without tears, Isoc. 14.47, Ph. 2.67, Plu. Caes. 7, etc.
without tears:

children.label: I
children.definition: Act., tearless, ἀ. καὶ ἀπήμων Il. 1.415, cf. Od. 24.61; ἀδακρύτω ἔχεν ὄσσε 4.186; ἀστένακτος κἀ. S. Tr. 1200; εὐνάζειν ἀ. βλεφάρων πόθον so that they weep not, ib. 106 (lyr.):—Medic., ἀ. ὀφθαλμός abnormally dry, Aet. 7.91.
not weeping for, τινός Epigr.Gr. 241a13.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., unwept, S. Ant. 881 (lyr.).
costing no tears, τρόπαια Plu. Tim. 37.

definition: ἀδαλές ὑγιές,, Hsch. [ ᾱ, if from δαλέομαι, Dor. for δηλ-.]

children.definition: adamantine, of steel, Pi. P. 4.224, A. Pr. 6, 64, Aeschin. 3.84; ἀ. κερκίδες, of the Μοῖραι, Lyr.Adesp. ap. Stob. 1.5.11; αἱμασιή Eus.Mynd. Fr. 63.
hard as adamant, οὐδεὶς ἂν γένοιτο . . οὕτως ἀ., ὃς ἂν . . Pl. R. 360b; σιδηροῖς καὶ ἀ. λόγοις Id. Grg. 509a; δεσμοί Metrod. Herc. 831.12; οὐκ ἀ. ἐστίν, of a girl, Theoc. 3.39. Adv. -νως Pl. R. 618e.

data.quote: οὐδεὶς ἂν γένοιτο . . οὕτως ἀ., ὃς ἂν . .

children.definition: iron-bound, λῦμαι A. Pr. 148, 426 (lyr.).
on a base of adamant, κίονες Pi. Fr. 88.5.

definition: ἀδάμας, αντος, ὁ, ( δαμάω):—first in Hes. (in Hom. only as pr. n.), properly,

children.definition: unconquerable:

children.label: I
children.definition: Subst., adamant, i. e. the hardest metal, prob. steel, χλωρός, πολιός, Hes. Sc. 231, Th. 161: metaph., ἀδάμαντος ἔχον κρατερόφρονα θυμόν Op. 147; of anything fixed, unalterable, ἔπος ἐρέω ἀδάμαντι πελάσσας Orac. ap. Hdt. 7.141; ἀδάμαντος δῆσεν ἅλοις fixed them with nails of adamant, i. e. inevitably, Pi. P. 4.71, cf. APl. 16.167 (Antip. Sid.); τὸν ἐν Ἅιδα κινήσαις ἀδάμαντα Theoc. 2.34.
diamond, Thphr. Lap. 19, Paus. 8.18.6, Peripl.M.Rubr. 56; prob. so meant in Pl. Ti. 59b, Plt. 303e, cf. Plin. HN 37.55.
ὁ πόνος ἀδάμαντος, of love, Alex. 245.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: Adj., unbreakable, ἀνακτίτης Orph. L. 192.
unconquerably, Suid.
unsubdued, inflexible, of Hades, Il. 9.158, cf. Phld. D. 1.18: later in the proper sense, untamed, unbroken, πῶλος X. Eq. 1.1, cf. Corn. ND 20; ἀ. πᾶσιν Timo 9.1.

unconquered, A. Ch. 54, Th. 233, S. OT 205, etc.: of females, unwedded, S. Aj. 450; untamed, μόσχος ἀ. πέσημα δίκε E. Ph. 640.—Trag. word, always in lyr. (exc. S. Aj. l.c.); restored by Elmsl. for ἀδάμαντος or -αστος of codd.
Hsch.
Ion Lyr. 9.
not pledged as security, ἄλλου δανείου BGU 741 (ii A.D.).

definition: ἀδαξάω, or ἀδαξ-έω, ἀδαξῆσαι, ἀδάξομαι, v. sub ὀδάξω.

children.definition: without expense, costing nothing, γλυκέα κἀδάπανα Ar. Pax 593, cf. Teles p. 7.8 H., D.S. 10 Fr. 12. Adv. ἀδαπάνως, τέρψαι φρένα E. Or. 1176, cf. Phld. Rh. 2.133 S. (prob.).

children.label: II
children.definition: not spending, ἀ. χρημάτων εἰς τὸ δέον Arist. VV 1251b7; ἀ. καταστῆσαι τὸ κοινόν Michel 1007.33 ( Teos), cf. Inscr.Prien. 111.133 (i B. C.).
salt efflorescence on the herbage of marshes, Dsc. 5.119, Damocr. ap. Gal. 13.105: ἄδαρκος, ὁ, Gal. 12.370; Dim. ἀδάρκιον, τό, ibid.
unflayed: not cudgelled, Hsch., Gloss.
tribute-free, A. Fr. 63.
undivided, S. Aj. 54; also ἄδατος, Hsch.
scratch, Ar. Fr. 410.
measure of four χοίνικες, Ar. Fr. 709.
erase, deface, στάλαν Michel 1334 ( Elis).

definition: ἀδεής (A), Ep. ἀδειής, ές: voc. ἀδεές [ ᾱ, i.e. ἀδϝεές]:—

children.definition: fearless, εἴ περ ἀδειής τʼ ἐστί, of Hector, Il. 7.117; κύον ἀδεές 8.423, Od. 19.91: c. gen., ἀ. θανάτου Pl. R. 386b, cf. Arist. EN 1115a33; ἐν θαλάττῃ καὶ ἐν νόσοις ἀ. ὁ ἀνδρεῖος 1115b1.

data.quote: ἐν θαλάττῃ καὶ ἐν νόσοις ἀ. ὁ ἀνδρεῖος

children.definition: without anxiety, secure, τὸ ἀ. security, Th. 3.37; ἀ. δέος δεδιέναι to fear where no fear is, Pl. Smp. 198a.

children.label: II
children.definition: causing no fear, not formidable, πρὸς ἐχθρούς Th. 1.36 ( Comp.); οὐ γὰρ ἀδεὲς τοῦτʼ ὑπολαμβάνω D. 16.22.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. ἀδεῶς without fear or scruple, confidently, Hdt. 3.65, 9.109; ἀ. τινὰ ὠφελοῦμεν Th. 2.40; ἀ. περί τινος ἀποφαίνεσθαι Pl. La. 186d; ἀ. πολιτεύεσθαι Lys. 24.25; ἀ. bibit Cic. Att. 13.52: Comp. -έστερον Th. 4.92.
with impunity, μηνύειν Id. 6.27.
not in want, τινός Max Tyr. 5.1, al.
not wanting a thing, Antipho Soph. 10.

children.label: II
children.definition: inexorable, Ptol. Tetr. 159; cf. ἀδεύητος.

freedom from fear, Th. 7.20; esp. safe conduct, amnesty, indemnity, ἀδείην διδόναι Hdt. 2.121.ζʹ; τοῖς ἄλλοις ἄ. ἐδώκατε οἰκεῖν τὴν σφετέραν Antipho 5.77; ἐν ἀ. εἶναι Hdt. 8.120; ἐν ἀ. οὐ ποιεῖσθαι τὸ λέγειν to hold it not safe, Id. 9.42; τὸ σῶμά τινος εἰς ἄ. καθιστάναι Lys. 2.15; τῶν σωμάτων ἄ. ποιεῖν Th. 3.58; πολλὴν ἄ. αὐτοῖς ἐψηφισμένοι ἔσεσθε ποιεῖν ὅτι ἂν βούλωνται Lys. 22.19; ἄ. τινι παρασκευάσαι Id. 16.13, cf. D. 13.17; παρέχειν Id. 21.210; opp. ἄ. εὑρίσκεσθαι And. 1.34, D. 24.47; λαμβάνειν Id. 18.286; ἀδείας τυγχάνειν 5.6; τοῦ μὴ πάσχειν ἄδειαν ἤγετε 19.149; μετὰ πάσης ἀδείας 18.305; μετʼ ἀ. 22.25:—also γῆς ἄ. a secure dwelling-place, S. OC 447:— licence to bring forward proposals or make charges, D. 24.45, Plu. Per. 31, etc.
