πολλὴν ἄ. αὐτοῖς ἐψηφισμένοι ἔσεσθε ποιεῖν ὅτι ἂν βούλωνται

children.definition: licence, ἄ. ποιητική A.D. Pron. 38.3, al., Him. Or. 1.1; κωμική A.D. Pron. 69.19.
abundance, plenty, Teles p. 44.1 H.; κρεῶν Sch. Ar. Nu. 386.
name of certain Seleucian magistrates in Plb. 5.54.10; prob. an Eastern word.
without a sample, or perh. without an official stamp, PHib. 98.17 (iii β. ξ.), PSI 4.358.5 (iii β. ξ.).
not shown, invisible, of God, Ph. 1.197, 618.
fearless, Ps. -Callisth. 1.6.
fearless, dauntless, Pi. N. 10.17, etc.; ἦλθʼ ἀ. ποδί E. Rh. 697: c. gen., ἐμαυτῆς ἀ. without fear for myself, A. Pers. 162. Adv. -τως Id. Ch. 771.
where no fear is, οἰκία Luc. Philops. 31.
fearless, Hsch., Suid.

definition: ἁδεῖν, Aeol. ἀδ-, v. sub ἁνδάνω.

children.definition: without the evening meal, supperless, Hp. Aph. 5.41, X. An. 4.5.21, etc.
not fearing the battle-cry, B. 5.155, 10.61.
freedom from superstition, Hp. Decent. 5.
without superstition, Adv. -μόνως D.S. 38.7: Comp. -έστερον Sor. 1.80.
impious, λογισμοί Orac. ap. Jul. Ep. 88; ἄνδρος Procl. H. 3.12.

unbribed, impartial, Arist. EN 1109b8, Plu. Cim. 10, Ael. NA 17.16; διάνοια D.H. Th. 34, etc. Adv. -τως, ἔχουσα φιλοσοφία Philostr. VA 8.7.3, cf. Gal. 11.417, Max.Tyr. 6.6: Comp. -ότερον Luc. Hist.Conscr. 47.
tithe-free, Ar. Eq. 301, OGI 229.101 ( Smyrna, iii B. C.).

not receptive, Thphr. Metaph. 9: c. gen., not capable of, τῆς εὐδαιμονίας Hippod.ap Stob. 4.39.26; τοῦ μοιχεύειν Phld. D. 3 Fr. 78; μεταβολῆς Plu. An.procr. 2.1025c, cf. Plot. 3.6.13, Herm. ap. Stob. 3.11.31, Procl. in Prm. p.842 S., etc.

unacceptable, δῶρα Zos. 1.58.

definition: ἀδελφεά, ἀδελφ-εή, ἀδελφεός, ἀδελφ-ειός, v. sub ἀδελφή, ἀδελφός.

children.definition: sister, Trag., E. Fr. 866, etc.; ὁμοπατρία ἀ. Men. Georg. 12, cf. PTeb. 320.5 (ii A.D.): Ion. ἀδελφ-εή, Hdt. 2.56, al.; Ep. ἀδελφ-ειή, Q.S. 1.30; Dor. ἀδελφ-εά, Pi. N. 7.4, and in lyr, passages of Trag., S. OT 160, OC 535.

data.ref: Pi. N. 7.4, and in lyr, passages of Trag.,

children.definition: kinswoman, LXX Jb. 42.11.
Ca. 4.9, To. 5.21; applied to a wife, POxy. 744.1 (i B. C.), etc.:—as a title, Βερενίκη ἡ ἀ. καὶ γυνὴ αὐτοῦ (of a cousin) OGI 60.3 (iii B. C.):— sister (as a fellow Christian), Ep.Rom. 16.1, etc.
nephew, Alcm. 56A, etc.; usu. brotherʼs son, Hdt. 1.65, 6.94, al., Th. 2.101, etc.; also, sisterʼs son, Hdt. 4.147, Str. 10.5.6, etc.:—also ἀδελφ-ιδός, beloved one, LXX Ca. 2.3, al.

definition: ἀδελφιδῆ, ἡ, Att. contr. for ἀδελφιδέη,

children.definition: a brotherʼs or sisterʼs daughter, a niece, Ar. Nu. 47, Lys. 3.6. Hp. Epid. 6.2.19, etc.

definition: ἀδελφιδῆς, ὁ, and ἀδελφ-ίδισα (sic), ἡ, = foreg., IGRom. 4.621 ( Temenothyrae).
ἀδελφίδιον, τό, Dim. of ἀδελφός, Ar. Ra. 60, PPar. 39.6 (ii B. C.).

children.definition: adopt as a brother, call brother, Hecat. 8J., Apolloph. 4, Isoc. 19.30:— Pass., to be very like, Hp. Acut. 9, etc.; τινί Id. Fract. 31, Art. 45.
brotherly or sisterly, φιλία Arist. EN 1161a6; ἔρις Just. Nov. 18.7; ἡ ὑμετέρα ἀ. παίδευσις POxy. 1165.2 (vi A.D.). Adv. -κῶς LXX 4 Ma. 13.9, Ps. -Callisth. 3.20.
brotherhood, close connexion, Hp. Art. 57.
Dim. of ἀδελφός, Keil-Premerstein Zweiter Bericht 215 ( Lydia, ii A.D.), POxy. 1300.4 (V A.D.).
date, Plin. HN 13.45, Gloss.
bestowing brothers, ἀστήρ Vett.Val. 123.21.
germanitus, Gloss.
murdering a brother or sister, Hdt. 3.65 (in Ion. form ἀδελφεοκτ-), Nic.Dam. p.142 D., Plu. Mul.virt. 2.256f, Ph. 1.148.
to be murderer of a brother or sister, J. BJ 2.11.4, Vett.Val. 74.28.
murder of a brother or sister, J. BJ 1.31.2, Ph. 1.210, al.
marriage of brother and sister, Tz. H. 1.590.
brotherʼs or sisterʼs child, D.H. 4.64 (Cod. Vat.), cf. Just. Nov. 127.1.
adopting as a brother, EM 255.1.
as befits a brother, LXX 4 Ma. 10.12.

definition: ἀδελφός [ᾰ], ( ἀ- copul., δελφύς, Arist. HA 510b13; cf. ἀγάστωρ) properly,

children.label: I
children.definition: Subst., ἀδελφός, ὁ, voc. ἄδελφε; Ep., Ion., and Lyr. ἀδελφεός (gen. -ειοῦ in Hom. is for -εόο), Cret. ἀδελφιός, ἀδευφιός, Leg.Gort. 2.21, Mon.Ant. 18.319:— brother, Hom., etc.; ἀδελφοί brother and sister, E. El. 536; so of the Ptolemies, θεοὶ ἀδελφοί Herod. 1.30, OGI 50.2 (iii B. C.), etc.; ἀπʼ ἀμφοτέρων ἀδελφεός Hdt. 7.97: prov., χαλεποὶ πόλεμοι ἀδελφῶν E. Fr. 975: metaph., ἀ. γέγονα σειρήνων LXX Jb. 30.29.

colleague, associate, PTeb. 1.12, IG 12 (9).906.19 ( Chalcis); member of a college, ib. 14.956.

OGI 138.3 ( Philae), J. AJ 13.2.2, etc.; generally, LXX Ju. 7.30; esp. in letters, PPar. 48 (ii B. C.), etc.:—as a term of affection, applicable by wife to husband, LXX To. 10.12, PLond. 1.42.1 (ii B. C.), etc.
brother (as a fellow Christian), Ev.Matt. 12.50, Act.Ap. 9.30, al.; of other religious communities, e.g. Serapeum, PPar. 42.1 (ii B. C.), cf. PTaur. 1.1.20.

twin, in pairs, X. Mem. 2.3.19:—also, akin, cognate, μαθήματα Archyt. 1; ἀ. νόμοις Pl. Lg. 683a: mostly c. gen., ἀδελφὰ τῶνδε S. Ant. 192; ἡ δὲ μωρία μάλιστʼ ἀ. τῆς πονηρίας ἔφυ Id. Fr. 925; freq. in Pl., Phd. 108b, Cra. 418e, al., cf. Hyp. Epit. 35: c. dat., ἀδελφὰ τούτοισι S. OC 1262, cf. Pl. Smp. 210b.

unwedded to any one, τινός Opp. C. 3.358.

without master or owner, ἀρετὴ ἀ. Pl. R. 617e; τὸ παρʼ ἡμᾶς ἀ. Epicur. Ep. 3p.65U.: of property, POxy. 1188.15 (13 A.D.), cf. Str. 17.1.12: of freedmen, Myro Hist. 2; οἰκήσεις Arist. EN 1161a7, cf. E. Hyps.Fr. 1.11; ἀ. καὶ αὐτοκρατεῖς, of the gods, Plu. Def.orac. 2.426c; ἀ. βίος Sallust. 21.

children.label: II
children.definition: anonymous, Cic. Fam. 15.17.3, D.H. 11.50, Plu. Cic. 15, etc. Adv. -τως J. Ap. 1.16, Sch. Ar. Ra. 1400.

children.label: III
children.definition: ungovernable, λύπη Democr. 290.
unbound, loose, Hp. Art. 44; not clamped together, λίθοι IG 7.3074 (Lebad.).
free, D. 24.169, Aristaenet. 1.20.
unshod, Philostr. Ep. 37.

definition: ἀδεύητος, ον, Ep. form of ἀδέητος, Hsch.: ἀδεύητον· χαλεπόν, ἢ οὗ οὐκ ἄν τις ἔτι δεηθείη, EM 17.4.
ἀδευκής, ές, Hom. only in Od., ὀλέθρῳ ἀδευκέϊ 4.489; ἀδευκέα πότμον 10.245; φῆμιν ἀδευκέα 6.273, cf. A.R. 2.267, etc.

children.definition: δεῦκος, q.v.) not sweet, i.e. bitter, cruel, or (cf. δεύκει) unexpected, cf. Apollon. Lex., Hsch.:— ἀ.φωνή expl. as not imitative, opp. πολυδευκής, Ael. NA 5.38.)
untanned, βοέη Od. 20.2, 142, cf. A.R. 3.206, AP 6.298 ( Leon.).

to be sated with, c. dat., only in aor. and pf., μὴ ξεῖνος . . δείπνῳ ἁδήσειε lest he should be sated with the repast, feel loathing at it, Od. 1.134 (v.l. ἀηδήσειε) καμάτῳ ἁδηκότες ἠδὲ καὶ ὕπνῳ sated with toil and sleep, Il. 10.98, cf. 312, 399, 471, Od. 12.281; cf. ἅδην.

definition: ἀδήϊος, contr. ἀδῆος, Dor. ἀδάϊος, ον,

children.definition: unmolested, unravaged, ἀδῇον . . σπαρτῶν ἀπʼ ἀνδρῶν S. OC 1533: of persons, not harmed, A.R. 4.647.
not gnawed or worm-eaten, Hes. Op. 420 ( Sup.); not bitten, Dsc. 2.60, al.
unmolested, Phld. D. 3 Fr. 81, Plu. Herod. 2.864c. Adv. -τως Virt.mor. 448a.
unaffected, untouched, by love, anger, etc., in Adv. -τως, Phld. Mort. 34, Plu. Pomp. 2, M.Ant. 11.18, Eun. VS p.495B.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not biting or pungent, Hp. Mul. 1.11, Dsc. 1.30: Comp. -ότερος less stimulating, Aret. CA 1.10.

to be in the dark about a thing, understand not, σκοπὸς προσήκεις ὧν ἀδηλοῦμεν φράσαι S. OC 35: — Pass., to be obscure, Ph. 2.42, al., S.E. M. 11.233, cf. 7.393; fail to appear, ἐπιμήνια-εύμενα Hp. Mul. 1.2.
unhurt, A.R. 2.709; invulnerable, Nonn. D. 47.617.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not hurting, δεσμός ib. 41.199.
A.D. Pron. 25.18, v.l. in Corn. ND 13; ἀ. τοῦ μέλλοντος Iamb. Myst. 10.4, cf. AP 10.96 ( Pall.).
make unseen, Sm. Jb. 9.5, Ps.- Alex.Aphr. in SE 124.3.
making unseen, Sch. Il. 2.455; φάρμακα Sch. E. Med. 1201.

unseen, invisible, of a fish, ποιεῖν ἑαυτὸν ἄ. Arist. HA 620b31; ἄ. χιτών, of the hyaloid membrane of the eye, [ Gal.]14.712; unknown, obscure, Hes. Op. 6; τὸν ἄ. ἄνδρα . . ἰχνεύειν S. OT 475; ἐὰν δὲ . . ἄ. ὁ κτείνας ᾖ Pl. Lg. 874a; of troops, ἄ. τοῖς πολεμίοις X. Cyr. 6.3.13; εἰς τὸ ἄ. ἀποκρύπτειν Id. Eq.Mag. 5.7.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἄ. θάνατοι death by an unknown hand, S. OT 496; ἄ. ἔχθρα secret enmity, Th. 8.108; ῥεῖ πᾶν ἄδηλον melts all to nothing, S. Tr. 698; inscrutable, E. Or. 1318.

children.label: b
children.definition: ἄδηλόν [ἐστι] εἰ . . it is uncertain whether . ., Pl. Phdr. 232e, al.; ἄ. μή . . Id. Phd. 91d: abs., ἄ. ὄν Th. 1.2; ἐν ἀδήλῳ εἶναι Antipho 5.6; ἐν ἀδηλοτέρῳ εἶναι X. HG 7.5.8; ἐξ ἀδήλου ἔρχεται [σελήνη] S. Fr. 871.5; also ἄ. agreeing with the subject (like δίκαιός εἰμι) , παῖδες ἄ. ὁποτέρων, = ἄδηλον ὁποτέρων παῖδές εἰσιν, Lys. 1.33; ἀδήλοις . . πῶς ἀποβήσεται, = ἃ ἄ. ἐστι πῶς ἀ., Arist. EN 1112b9, cf. X. Mem. 1.1.6.
not evident to sense, ὄψις τῶν ἀ. τὰ φαινόμενα Anaxag. 21a, cf. Epicur. Ep. 1p.6U.; opp. φανερόν, Phld. Sign. 6, al.; opp. ἐναργές, ib. 14, cf. Diog.Oen. 8.
unintelligible, φωνή 1 Ep.Cor. 14.8.
unproved, Stoic. 2.89.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -λως secretly, Th. 1.92, etc.: Sup. -ότατα Id. 7.50.
uncertainty, Protag. 4, Plb. 5.2.3, Ph. 1.277, Corn. ND 13, etc.
with inconspicuous veins, Arist. GA 727a24, PA 667a31.
render invisible:— Pass., to be obliterated, Tab.Heracl. 1.57.
Hsch. (cod. ἀδήμας).
not fashioned, ἀ. πρὸς ἀνάστασιν not made for getting up again, of a fallen elephant, D.S. 3.27.
not democratic, D.C. 43.45.

to be sorely troubled or dismayed, be in anguish, Hp. Virg. 1; ἀδημονῶν τε καὶ ἀπορῶν Pl. Tht. 175d, cf. D. 19.197; ἀδημονῆσαι τὰς ψυχάς X. HG 4.4.3: c. dat. rei, ἀδημονεῖ τᾗ ἀτοπίᾳ τοῦ πάθους Pl. Phdr. 251d; ὑπό τινος to be puzzled by . ., Epicur. Nat. 11.8; ἐπί τινι D.H. 3.70; χάριν τινός POxy. 298.45 (i A.D.). ( Eust., 833.15, derives it from ἀδήμων, which is found only as v.l. in Hp. Epid. 1.18 (cf. Gal. 17 (1).177), and is itself of doubtful derivation.) [ ᾰδ- Nic. Fr. 16.]
trouble, distress, Epicur. Fr. 483, AP 12.226 ( Strat.), Plu. Num. 4: pl., Ph. 2.541.

definition: ἀδημοσύνη, ἡ, rarer form for ἀδημονία, Democr. 212, X. ap. AB 80.

children.definition: sore-troubled, v. sub ἀδημονέω.

definition: ἅδην, Ep. and Ion. ἄδην, Adv.

children.definition: to oneʼs fill, ἔδμεναι ἄ. Il. 5.203, al.; ἐμπιμπλάμενοι σίτων ἅ. Pl. Plt. 272c; πιοῦσʼ ἄ. χορεύω Anacreont. 14.30.

οἵ μιν ἄ. ἐλόωσι . . πολέμοιο will drive him to satiety of war, Il. 13.315; Τρῶας ἄ. ἐλάσαι πολέμοιο 19.423; ἔτι μίν φημι ἄ. ἐλάαν κακότητος Od. 5.290; ἅ. ἔλειξεν αἵματος licked his fill of blood, A. Ag. 828; καὶ τούτων μὲν ἅ. Pl. Euthphr. 11e, cf. R. 341c, etc.; ἅ. ἔχειν τινός to have enough of a thing, be weary of it, Id. Chrm. 153d, cf. E. Ion 975; τοῦ φαγεῖν Arist. Pr. 950a15; ἅ. ἔχουσιν οἱ λόγοι Pl. R. 541b: c. part., ἄ. εἶχον κτείνοντες Hdt. 9.39.

data.quote: ἔτι μίν φημι ἄ. ἐλάαν κακότητος

children.definition: unceasingly, A.R. 2.82, cf. 4.1216.
Call. Fr. 47. [ ᾰ, except in the phrase ἔδμεναι ἄδην; v. sub ἁδέω.] (From sə -δην, cf. Lat. sǎ-tis.)
gland, Hp. Art. 11; later, ὁ, Gal. UP 3.9, al., Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.12, Hdn.Gr. l.c. (ṇguen, cf. Lat. inguen.)

ignorant, inexperienced, Semon. 7.53, cj. for ἁληνής, but expl. as ‘without malice prepense’ by Hsch, EM 17.11: so in Adv. -έως without malice, διὰ τῆς πόλεως ἀ. γεγωνέοντες GDI 5653 ( Chios):—hence ἀδήν-εια, ἡ, ignorance, Hsch ( -είη).
without strife, AP 7.440 Leon.), Epigr. in Rev.Phil 19.178 ( Egypt).
without strife or battle, Il. 17.42.
uncontested, undisputed, Plb. 1.2.3, Orph. A. 846. Adv. ἀδηρί-τως Plb. 3.93.1, D.S. 4.14, Plu. Caes. 3.

children.label: II
children.definition: not to be striven against, unconquerable, ἀνάγκης σθένος A. Pr. 105.

definition: ᾍδης or ᾅδης, ου, ὁ, Att.; Ep. Ἀΐδης, αο and εω; Dor. Ἀΐδας, α, used by Trag., in lyr.and anap.: gen. Ἄϊδος, dat. Ἄϊδι, Hom., Trag., v. infr.: (perh. ἀ- priv., ἰδεῖν):—

children.definition: Hom. only as pr.n. Hades, Ζεὺς καὶ ἐγώ, τρίτατος δʼ Ἀΐδης Il. 15.188, cf. Hes. Th. 455:— εἰν Ἀΐδαο δόμοισι in the nether world, Od. 4.834; freq. εἰν, εἰς Ἀΐδαο (sc. δόμοις, δόμους), as Il. 22.389, 21.48; εἰν Ἄϊδος Il. 24.593; Trag. and Att. ἐν Ἅιδου, εἰς Ἅιδου (sc. οἴκῳ, οἶκον), S. Aj. 865, Ar. Ra. 69, etc.; Ἄϊδόσδε, Adv. to the nether world, Il. 7.330, etc.; παρʼ Ἅιδῃ, παρʼ Ἅιδην, OT 972, OC 1552:—hence,

data.quote: Ζεὺς καὶ ἐγώ, τρίτατος δʼ Ἀΐδης

children.definition: place of departed spirits, first in Il. 23.244 εἰσόκεν αὐτὸς . . Ἄϊδι κεύθωμαι; ἐπὶ τὸν ᾅδην Luc. Cat. 14; εἰς ἀΐδην AP 11.23; ἐν τῷ ᾅδῃ Ev.Luc. 16.23.

data.quote: εἰσόκεν αὐτὸς . . Ἄϊδι κεύθωμαι; ἐπὶ τὸν ᾅδην

children.label: II
children.definition: Hom., the grave, death, ἀΐδαν λαγχάνειν, δέξασθαι, Pi. P. 5.96, I. 6(5).15; ᾅδης πόντιος death by sea, A. Ag. 667, cf. E. Alc. 13, Hipp. 1047; ᾅδου πύλη, Astrol., region below the Horoscope, Vett.Val. 179.13.

ᾅδου with nouns in adjectival sense, devilish, θύουσαν ᾅ. μητέρʼ A. Ag. 1235; ᾅ. μάγειρος E. Cyc. 397; fatal, deadly, δίκτυον, ξίφη ᾅ., A. Ag. 1115, E. Or. 1399. [ ᾰ Hom. in all forms exc. ᾱῐδος before vowels; ᾱῐδης Semon. 7.117, prob. in S. OC 1689.]
to be greedy, Hermipp. 84; of horses, S. Fr. 976, Isoc. 6.55.
gluttony, Call. Dian. 160: pl., Arist. Fr. 144, Opp. H. 2.218:—personified, Ἀδηφαγίας ἱερόν Polem.Hist. 39.
gluttonous, greedy, ἀνήρ Theoc. 22.115; τὴν ἀ. νόσον S. Ph. 313; ἀ. λύχνος, of a lamp that burns much oil, Alc.Com. 21.
devouring much money, costly, τριήρεις Lys. Fr. 39, cf. Philist. 58; of racehorses, Pherecr. 197, Ar. Fr. 736.
not ravaged, X. HG 3.1.5.
not to be passed, ποταμός, νάπη, X. An. 2.1.11, HG 5.4.44; ὄρη Them. Or. 16.206d.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not striding, closed, σκέλη AB 343.
unconfirmed, Ptol. Geog. 2.1.
intransitive, A.D. Synt. 286.6.
not listening to calumny, ἡ τῶν ἀγαθῶν φιλία ἀ. ἐστι Arist. EN 1157a21; ἀνύποπτος καὶ ἀ. Plu. Brut. 8.

data.quote: ἡ τῶν ἀγαθῶν φιλία ἀ. ἐστι

children.label: II
children.definition: unexceptionable, φιλοπονία ἕξις ἀ. πρὸς πόνον Pl. Def. 412c; τοῖς βίοις ἀ. Plu. Lib.educ. 2.4b; τὰ πρὸς τοὺς ἄλλους ἀ. App. Sam. 4.4. Adv. -τως Just. Nov. 137.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., unexceptionable, Mon.Ant. 23.60 (Seleucia in Cilicia).
not to be cut through, AB 344.
not hollowed out, ὦτα Adam. 2.29.
indistinguishable, D.S. 1.30; ἀ. τῷ χρώματι τοῦ ἐδάφους Antig. Mir. 25(29); hard to distinguish or understand, ὀνόματα Aristid. Quint. 1.5.
impossible to live with, Ph. 2.268; συνουσία 1.118.
without successor, perpetual, βουλή Sch. Aeschin. 3.2.
inevitable, Zeno Stoic. 1.27, Ael. Fr. 219.
not disjoined, inseparable, Corn. ND 14, Iamb. in Nic. pp. 15, 107P.; ἕνωσις Procl. in Prm. p.521 S.; indistinguishable, Phld. D. 1.19.
not disposed or set in order, Sch. Ar. Nu. 1370, etc.; στίχοι ἀ. Sch. Il. 22.487.
having made no will, intestate, Plu. Cat.Ma. 9, D.Chr. 54.4, POxy. 105.6 (ii A.D.), al.

children.label: b
children.definition: not disposed of by will, PGrenf. 1.17 (ii B. C.), Sammelb. 4638.5.
undivided, Arist. Pol. 1265b4; χώρα SIG 141.10 (Corc. Nigr.), cf. BGU 1119.9 (i. B.C.), etc.
indivisible, like ἀμερής, Arist. Ph. 231b3, al.; Comp., less divisible, Metaph. 1052a21. Adv. -τως Phryn. 146 (interp.).

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not having divided joint property, ἀδελφοί Sor. 2.1.

definition: ἀδιαίτητος ἀλλότριος, ἀήθης, Phot., Suid., AB 341.

children.definition: unmoved, Phld. Rh. 1.366S.
not shut off, τοῦ οὐρανοῦ τὸ -τον J. BJ 5.5.4.
not executed, ἐκλιπεῖν ἀ. τὴν ἐπιστολήν J. AJ 19.1.1.
which no dart can pierce, δέρμα prob. in Ael. VH 13.15 (interpol., codd. -κόνιστος, which Hsch. explains ἀναίσθητος, ἄτρωτος).
unbroken, uninterrupted, χάρακες Aristeas 139; συνέχεια Herod. ap. Orib. 7.8.4; λόγος Ph. 1.81, cf. Porph. Plot. 8. Adv. -πως Hero Def. 37, Ulp.ad D. 18.308, Steph. in Hp. 1.149 D.
undeflowered, virginal, Sor. 1.10.
not set in order, D.H. 3.10; οὐσία Stoic. 2.189, cf. Ph. 2.505; of lands, not disposed of, unassigned, J. AJ 5.1.23.
want of discernment, Suid. s.v. ἀκρισία.

undistinguishable, mixed, Hp. Coac. 570; αἷμα Arist. Somn.Vig. 458a21 ( Comp.); not discriminated, Dam. Pr. 35. Adv. -τως without distinction, in common, Ph. Fr. 105 H., Hierocl. in CA 12p.446M., Iamb. Myst. 4.1, Just. Nov. 89.7.

children.label: b
children.definition: promiscuous, ἐπιμιξίαι D.H. 19.1.
unintelligible, Plb. 15.12.9.
undecided, Luc. JTr. 25, OGI 509.8 ( Aphrodisias).
Act., not making due distinctions, τὸ -τον Ph. 2.664.
Adv. -τως without examination, POxy. 715.36 (ii A.D.).
without hindrance, Herm. ap. Stob. 1.49.68, BGU 1048.19 (i A.D.).

unintermitting, incessant, Ti.Locr. 98e, Ep.Rom. 9.2, Hierocl. p.19.55A., Plu. Cons.Apoll. 2.121e, M.Ant. 6.15. Adv. -τως Metrod. Herc. 831.8, Polem.Hist. 30, Plb. 9.3.8, Posidon. 25, LXX 1 Ma. 12.11, Ep.Rom. 1.9, PLond. 3.1166.6 (i A.D.).
without conversation, βίος solitary life, Phryn.Com. 18.
to be lacking in comprehension, confused in mind, Phld. Rh. 2.184S.

indistinct, confused, λόγος Metrod. Herc. 831.11, cf. 13; ἄδηλα καὶ ἀ. Phld. Rh. 2.44S.: —also of persons, confused in mind, ib. 47 S., Id. Po. 1676.3. Adv. -τως, opp. διειλημμένως, Id. Mus. p.32 K., al.
confusion, obscurity, διανοημάτων Phld. Rh. 2.190 S.: pl., ib. 1.7S.:—of persons, failure to distinguish, τινός ib. 1.43 S.: abs., ib. 1.204 S.
irreconcilable, τὰ πρὸς ὑμᾶς ἀ. ὑπάρχει my relation to you admits no reconciliation, D. Ep. 2.21, cf. 24.8, D.Chr. 38.17, etc. Adv. -τως, ἔχειν πρός τινα D.H. 6.56, cf. Plu. Brut. 45.
unreasoning: c. gen., τοῦ συμφέροντος Phld. Lib. p.60 O.
undissolved: indissoluble, Pl. Phd. 80b; ἕνωσις Ph. 2.635; σύμβασις Hierocl. p.17.23 A.:— indestructible, Epicur. Fr. 356 (nisi Hermarcho tribuendum); στερεὰ καὶ ἀ. Id. Nat. 14.2.

children.label: II
children.definition: irreconcilable. Adv. -τως, πολεμεῖν πρός τινα Plb. 18.37.4.

children.label: III
children.definition: -τον, τό, = ἡλιοτρόπιον, Ps.- Dsc. 4.190.
infallible, Gem. 17.24, cf. Gal. 19.595.
not fully formed, Sor. 1.101; σάρξ Sch. Orib. 22.5.3.
not to be divided, Longin. 22.3.
undivided, Timae. 77.
inconceivability, Phld. Sign. 38.
speak unintelligibly, Sch. Ar. Av. 1377.
unintelligible, -ητα σκώπτειν Did. ap. Sch. Ar. V. 1309. Adv. -τως D.H. Rh. 9.16.
inconceivable, Pl. Sph. 238c, Epicur. Fr. 606, cf. Ep. 2p.43U., Phld. Sign. 12, al., Arr. Epict. 2.20.18, S.E. M. 8.389.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not understanding, silly, Arist. Fr. 90; unreflecting, Phld. Ir. p.23 W.; τὸ ἀ. τοῦ πλήθους Id. Rh. 2.40 S. Adv. -τως Pl. Hp.Ma. 301c.
unwetted, ἀδιάντοισι παρειαῖς Simon. 37.3; ἀ. ἐξ ἁλός B. 16.122; not bathed in sweat, σθένος Pi. N. 7.72.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., ἀδίαντος, ὁ, maidenhair, Adiantum Capillus-Veneris, Orph. A. 915: ἀδίαντον, τό, Theoc. 13.41; ἀ. [τὸ μέλαν] Thphr. HP 7.10.5: pl., Plu. QConv. 2.614b.
ἀ. τὸ λευκόν, = τριχομανές, Thphr. HP 7.14.1, Dsc. 4.135.
unpolished, Gal. UP 11.13.
untrodden, πυρός POxy. 1259.15 (iii A.D.).
not to be stilled, incessant, violent, Plb. 4.39.10, Phalar. Ep. 67.3. Adv. -τως Plb. 1.57.1, Antyll. ap. Orib. 4.11.14.
undigested, Sch. Nic. Al. 66.
as yet unformed, Pl. Ti. 91d, cf. Suid. s.v. φρῦνος.
not to evaporate, [ Gal.]10.528.
want of perspiration or suppressed perspiration, Gal. 10.763, Alex.Trall. Febr. 1.
not ventilated, Gal. 10.745; air-tight, Asclep. ap. eund. 13.159.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., without drawing breath, Iamb. VP 31.188.
undigested, κρέα Ath. 9.402d.
that cannot be traversed, Simp. in Cat. 470.2.
Iamb. Protr. 21.κδ, cf. Hierocl. Prov. p.463B.
infallibility, Hp. Ep. 17, Iamb. Protr. 21.κ.
infallible, Hp. Decent. 12, S.E. M. 7.110; ἀρχὴ ἀ. τῇ πόλει PRyl. 77.46 (ii A.D.). Adv. -τως Plb. 6.26.4, cf. Stoic. 3.69; unerringly, of archers, Hld. 9.18.
faultless, of writers, Longin. 33.5; τὸ ἀ. perfection of style, Id. 36.4; φράσις Diog.Bab.Stoic. 3.214; προφορά D.T. 629.12.
not using cases at random, A.D. Pron. 109.23.

children.label: b
children.definition: uninflected, EM 643.47.

definition: ἀδίαρθρος, ον, faulty form for sq., Thphr. HP 3.10.5 ( Comp.).

children.definition: not jointed or articulated, Arist. HA 579a24, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: confused, λόγος Arr. Epict. 1.17.1, Plu. Isid. 2.378c.
not distinctly conceived, unanalysed, Phld. D. 1.24 ( Comp.); δόξα Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 26.22.
disjointed, ἀ. ἐν σχήμασι Hermog. Id. 2.11.

children.label: III
children.definition: unorganized, Arr. Epict. 4.8.10.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Adv. -τως without distinction, Gal. 16.240, cf. Alex.Aphr. in Metaph. 61.4, Plot. 3.8.9.
not scattered by the winds, Hsch. s.v. ἄκροτον.
non-deliquescent, φάρμακον Gal. 12.840.
not torn in pieces, gloss on ἄρρηκτος, EM 149.12.
constipation, Hp. ap. Erot. 48.
not shaken about, Gal. 19.81; gloss on ἀτίνακτος, Sch. Opp. H. 4.415.
not scattered, Sch. Ar. Th. 1027.
inconsiderately, Aen.Tact. 29.12 (prob.l.).
unequipt, ἵππος Anon. ap. Suid.
not perspicuous, Sch. A. Ch. 816.
not torn asunder, uninterrupted, unbroken, X. Ages. 1.4, Plb. 1.34.5; inseparable, Dam. Pr. 418, cf. Olymp.Alch. p.77B. Adv. -τως Steph. in Hp. 1.65 D., Hsch.
not clearly unfolded, Sch. Od. 19.560.
continuity, Iamb. in Nic. p.57 P.
continuous, Antipho Soph. 24; ἀγάπησις Andronic.Rhod. p.513M. Adv. -τως without intermission, Ph. 1.342, 501, etc.

children.label: b
children.definition: without distinctions or intervals, Plot. 3.7.2, Dam. Pr. 105, 370.
ι in diphthongs, inseparable, not forming a distinct syllable, A.D. Pron. 86.21. Adv. -τως, σύλληψις συμφώνων μετὰ φωνηέντος . . ἀ. λεγομένη Sch.D.T. p.48H.

children.label: II
children.definition: without extension or dimension, Plu. Exil. 2.601c, Plot. 1.5.7, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 31.18. Adv. -τως Procl. in Prm. p.543 S., Inst. 176.
undistinguished, unvarying, Ph. 2.297. Adv., Gloss.
not distinguished, A.D. Pron. 11.26. Adv. -λως, λ[έγο]ντας Phld. Rh. 1.53S., cf. Phoeb. Fig. 1.3, Porph. Abst. 2.37.
not currently named, PPar. 5.15 (ii B. C.), al.
without turning, continuously, Hp. Fract. 19.
incapable of turning: metaph., rigid, inexorable, νόμος Orph. H. 64.9; incontrovertible, προλήψεις Procl. Hyp. 5.20; of remedies, infallible, Aët. 3.91,109; Gramm., strictly accurate, S.E. M. 1.187.

children.label: II
children.definition: not distorted, Arist. Pr. 958a12; κανών Plu. Ad. princ. ind. 2.780b; θώρηξ Aret. SD 1.12. Adv. -φως Gal. 18(2).334.

not perverted, of persons, Ph. Fr. 14 H., LXX 3 Ma. 3.3; ζῷα S.E. P. 3.194. Adv. -φως in the absence of perversion, i.e. by natural instinct, Demetr.Lac. Herc. 1012.70; straightforwardly, ἀ. καὶ ἀπανούργως S.E. M. 2.77.

children.label: b
children.definition: unperverted, κρίσεις D.H. Th. 55; λόγοι, ἔννοιαι, Procl. in Alc. p.4C., Theol.Plat. 1.17.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -φως without molestation, ἀ. καὶ ἀταράχως μεῖναι ἐν τοῖς ἰδίοις PLond 5.1674 (vi A.D.); ἀφίεσθαι ἀζημίως καὶ ἀ. Cod.Just. 9.47.26.7.

data.quote: ἀ. καὶ ἀταράχως μεῖναι ἐν τοῖς ἰδίοις

children.definition: free from error, μέθοδοι Hero *Geop. 164. Adv. -τως Ps.- Dioph. p.xxi H.
not cloven, Arist. HA 532b13.
not preserved, βιβλίον Ptol. Tetr. 47.
disorganized, ὄχλοι, πόλις, Artapan. ap. Alex.Polyh. 14, D.H. 3.10. Adv. -τως Simp. in Cat. 379.26.
unclassified, πρόσοδοι BCH 6.14 ( Delos, ii B. C.).
not cut in pieces, Aen. Tact. 32.1.
not to be turned aside, c. gen., γνώμης Sch. Luc. Herm. 53.

children.label: II
children.definition: headstrong, LXX Si. 26.10. Adv. -τως LXX v.l. ibid., Jul. Or. 6.197b.
shamelessness, Caligula ap. Suet. Cal. 29.
unshapen, D.S. 1.10, Ocell. 2.3, Ph. 2.317, al.; ψυχή 1.50.
with no way back, without return, of the nether world, E. Fr. 868; Φερσεφόνας ἀδίαυλον ὑπὸ . . δόμον Epigr.Gr. 244.9 ( Cyzicus).

children.label: II
children.definition: = sq. II, Epicur. Fr. 267, Gal. 2.27.

not affected by decay, Antyll. ap. Orib. 46.22.3; uncorrupted, chaste, Pl. Phdr. 252d; απʼ ὀρθῆς. . καὶ ἀδιαφθόρου τῆς ψυχῆς D. 18.298, cf. Men. 984, D.S. 1.59, Plu. Lib.educ. 2.5e. Adv. -ρως, ἐρᾶσθαι Aeschin. 1.137.

data.quote: απʼ ὀρθῆς. . καὶ ἀδιαφθόρου τῆς ψυχῆς

children.definition: incorruptible, Pl. Lg. 768b; of witnesses, Arist. Rh. 1376a17; of magistrates, Id. Pol. 1286a39 ( Comp.), cf. IG 2.240b13. Sup. Adv. -ώτατα Pl. l.c.

children.label: II
children.definition: imperishable, Pl. Phd. 106e.
to be indifferent, κατά τι S.E. P. 1.191; πρός τι M.Ant. 11.16; ἀδιαφορεῖ impers., ἐάν . . ἐάν . . Ph. 2.243: c. inf., A.D. Pron. 45.22.
not to agree, in case, gender, etc., ib. 68.15, al.

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀ. τινός not to differ from, Ph. 1.414.

children.label: III
children.definition: bring about no change, Gal. 1.194.

children.label: IV
children.definition: to be negligible, Procl. Hyp. 3.31; ἀ. πρὸς ἄσθησιν not to differ appreciably, ib. 3.15.

children.label: V
children.definition: to be neglected, uncared for, PLond. 2.144 (i A.D.).
like indifference: τὸ ἀ. = ἀδιαφορία, Arr. Epict. 2.1.14.
not evaporating or perspiring, Alex.Trall. 2.

children.label: II
children.definition: showing no difference, Iamb. in Nic. p.76 P.
indifference, Stoic, of the moral agent, Aristo Stoic. 1.83, Chrysipp. ib. 3.9, cf. Cic. Acad.Pr. 2.42.130, S.E. P. 1.152; absence of difference, Syr. in Metaph. 122.1, cf. sq. [ἀδιάφορος]

children.label: II
children.definition: neglect, Hierocl. in CA 7p.430M.

children.label: III
children.definition: equivalence of signification, Eust. 150.25.
not different, Arist. Rh. 1373a33; τοῖς ὁμοίοις καὶ ἀ. Id. Cael. 310b5; indistinguishable, ὅμοιον καὶ ἀ. Epicur. Nat. 15 G.
ἀδιάφορα, τά, individual objects, as having no logical differentia, ἀ. ὧν ἀδιαίρετον τὸ εἶδος Arist. Metaph. 1016a18; ἀ. εἴδει Top. 121b15; κατὰ τὸ εἶδος ib. 103a11.
undiscriminating, ὀνομασία Epicur. Nat. 14.10.

children.label: II
children.definition: indifferent; in Stoic philosophy, τὰ ἀ. things neither good nor bad, Zeno Stoic. 1.47,48, cf. Cic. Fin. 3.16.53, Epict. Ench. 32, etc., cf. S.E. P. 3.177 sq.: Sup., Phld. Rh. 1.129 S. Adv. -ρως, ἔχειν to be indifferent, of the moral agent, Aristo Stoic. 1.79.

children.label: III
children.definition: common, Heph. 4, cf. Sch.Pi. p.15 Böckh.

children.label: IV
children.definition: making no distinction, πρὸς πάντα ξένον καὶ δημότην Dicaearch. 1.14.
steadfast, unwearying, Ant.Lib. 41.2.

children.label: V
children.definition: negligible, πρός τι Procl. Hyp. 4.61; ἀ. πρὸς αἴσθησιν not differing sensibly, Aristarch.Sam. 4. Adv., Hipparch. 3.5.7.

children.label: VI
children.definition: Adv. -ρως without discrimination, D.H. Dem. 56, S.E. P. 3.225.
with no divisions or joints, Thphr. HP 1.5.3, 8.5.2. Adv. -τως ib. 6.5.3.
not softened by cooking, Thphr. CP 4.12.2; not dissolved, Dsc. 5.79.

children.label: II
children.definition: not diffuse or extravagant, of persons, Hp. Decent. 3:—of style, Longin. 34.3.
without evacuation, κοιλίη Hp. Acut. (Sp.) 38; not passing through the bowels, Sor. 1.125.
unseparated, undistinguished, EM 538.34, Suid. Adv. -τως Hsch. s.v. ἀδιασπάστως.
not deceitful, D.S. 5.37; of καταληπτικὴ φαντασία, Sphaer.Stoic. 1.141, cf. M.Ant. 4.49, Iamb. Protr. 21. Adv. -τως S.E. M. 7.191, Ruf. Fr. 68.10.
untaught, ignorant, Ps.-Phoc. 89: c. gen., ἀ. ἐρώτων AP 5.121 ( Diod.), cf. Hp. Alim. 39.
unpractised, untrained, of a chorus, D. 21.17.

children.label: II
children.definition: untaught, τοῖς ἀφʼ αὑτοῦ καὶ ἀ. πάθεσι Plu. Sollert. 2.968c, cf. Luc. Hist.Conscr. 34; that cannot be taught, Philostr. VA 5.36.

data.quote: τοῖς ἀφʼ αὑτοῦ καὶ ἀ. πάθεσι

children.definition: ἀ. δρᾶμα not yet acted (v. διδάσκω III) Ath. 6.270a.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -τως without teaching, Phld. Rh. 2.93 S, Juba 32, Plu. QConv. 2.673f; οὐκ ἀ. οὐδὲ αὐτοφυῶς Ph. Fr. 70 H.
not covered by security, μέρος τῆς ὠνῆς PRev.Laws 17.3 (iii B. C.).

definition: ἀδιέκβατος, ον, = sq., ἕρκος Sch. Opp. H. 4.117.

children.definition: not to be escaped, Apollon. Lex. s.v. νήδυμος.
not carried through, undone, μηδὲν ἀ. ἀπολείποντες OGI 335.34 (Perg.).
not wrought out, τόπος Isoc. 5.109.
that will not stand examination, λόγοι LXX Si. 21.18.
indescribable, πλῆθος Ph. 1.407, prob. in IG 5(1).1359 ( Messenia, i B. C.):— inexhaustible, ταῖς ἡμετέραις ἐπιβολαῖς Dam. Pr. 178.
that cannot be exhausted, infinite in extent or duration, Arist. Ph. 207b29, cf. Alex.Aphr. in Top. 86.27, Plot. 2.4.7, al.; αἰών Ph. 1.554.
with no outlet, ἄγυια Orib. 9.20.3.
having no outlet, λαβύρινθος Eust. 1688.37, cf. Sch. E. Or. 25.
that cannot be gone through, τὸ ἄπειρον Arist. Ph. 204a14.
having no outlet, of places, App. Mith. 100, Plu. Aq. 2.957d.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., unable to get out, AP 11.395 ( Nicarch.), cf. Plu. QConv. 2.679b, Ocell. 1.15.
not wrought out, unfinished, Isoc. 12.268, Poll. 6.143. Adv. -τως ib. 144.
inscrutable, Pl. Ti. 25d.
uninvestigated, Ph. 1.470, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: not searched, Plu. Dio 19.
obscure, lacking in order, of style, Hermog. Id. 2.11; ὕλη Heraclit. All. 48.
indescribable, X. Cyr. 8.7.22, D. 17.29, Cic. Att. 13.9.1. Adv. -τως PMag.Lond. 125.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: not related, Hld. 5.16.
not filtered or strained, πτισάνη ἀ. gruel with the meal in it, Hp. Acut. 7.
Cic. Att. 2.12 (with play on the name of the historian Dicaearchus).

data.ref: Cic. Att. 2.12 (with play on the name of the historian Dicaearchus).

children.definition: where no justice can be got, Σικελία D.S. 39.20.
without judgement given, Pl. Ti. 51c; δίκη IG 12(2).530 ( Eresos); undecided, Luc. Bis Acc. 23. Adv. -τως without judgement, Aesop. 223.
wrongdoing, = ἐνέργεια κατʼ ἀδικίαν, Stoic. 3.25.

definition: ἀδικέω, Aeol. ἀδικήω Sapph. 1.20, Dor. ἀδικίω Tab.Heracl. 1.138: Ion. impf. ἠδίκεον or ἠδίκευν Hdt. 1.121:— Pass., fut. in med. form ἀδικήσομαι E. IA 1436, Th. 5.56, etc.; also ἀδικηθήσομαι Apollod. 1.9.23, etc.: —

children.definition: to be ἄδικος, do wrong (defined by Arist. Rh. 1368b6 τὸ βλάπτειν ἑκόντα παρὰ τὸν νόμον, cf. ἀδίκημα) , τῶν ἀδικησάντων τίσις ἔσσεται those who have sinned, h.Cer. 367; freq. in Hdt. and Att.; τἀδικεῖν wrong-doing, S. Ant. 1059; τὸ μὴ ἀδικεῖν righteous dealing, A. Eu. 85, 749:— in legal phrase, do wrong in the eye of the law, the particular case being added in part., as Σωκράτης ἀ. . . ποιῶν . . καὶ διδάσκων Pl. Ap. 19b, cf. X. Mem. 1.1.1: c. acc. cogn., ἀδικίαν, ἀδικήματα, etc., Pl. R. 344c, 409a, cf. Arist. Rh. 1389b7; also ἀ. οὐδὲν ἄξιον δεσμοῦ Hdt. 3.145; ἀ. πολλά, μεγάλα, etc., Pl. Smp. 188a, al.; οὐδέν, μηδὲν ἀ. ib., al.:— ἀ. περὶ τὰ μυστήρια D. 21.175, cf. IG 2.811c154; ἀ. εἰς πόλιν, κτῆμα, Lib. Or. 15.39, 31.7:—in games or contests, play foul, Ar. Nu. 25, Arist. EN 1123b32.

children.label: b
children.definition: pres., to be in the wrong, εἰ μὴ ἀδικῶ γε if I am not mistaken, Pl. Chrm. 156a.

children.label: II
children.definition: wrong, injure, Archil. Supp. 2.13, Sapph. 1.20, Epich. 286, Hdt. 1.112, etc.:— ruin, of a girl, Men. Georg. 30: c. dupl. acc., wrong one in a thing, Ar. Pl. 460; ἃ πολλοὺς ὑμῶν ἠδίκηκεν D. 21.129; μείζονʼ ἢ ἐλάττονα ἀ. τινά 20.124; ἀ. ἀδικίαν περί τινας Pl. Lg. 854e:— Pass., to be wronged, injured, μὴ δῆτʼ ἀδικηθῶ S. OC 174; ἀ. εἴς τι E. Med. 265; μέγιστα ἀ. Aeschin. 3.84; οὔτʼ ἀδικεῖ οὔτʼ ἀδικεῖται Pl. Smp. 196b, etc.; pres. ἀδικεῖται, -ούμενος used for the pf. ἠδίκηται, -ημένος (v. supr. I), Antipho 4.4.9, Pl. R. 359a: c. acc., to be defrauded of, μισθὸν ἀδικίας v.l. in 2 Ep.Pet. 2.13.

harm, injure, ἀ. γῆν Th. 2.71, etc.; ἵππον X. Eq. 6.3; esp. in Medical sense, ἄνθρωπον Hp. Nat.Hom. 9; νεφρούς Diph.Siph. ap. Ath. 2.62f; τέμνειν καὶ θλᾶν καὶ ὁπωσοῦν ἄλλως ἀ. Gal. UP 13.8, cf. Archig. ap. Philum. Ven. 14.

data.quote: τέμνειν καὶ θλᾶν καὶ ὁπωσοῦν ἄλλως ἀ.

children.definition: wrong done, Hdt. 1.2, 100, etc.: properly, intentional wrong, opp. ἁμάρτημα and ἀτύχημα, Arist. EN 1135b20 sq., Rh. 1374b8; ἀ. ὥρισται τῷ ἑκουσίῳ Id. EN 1135a19: c. gen., wrong done to . . , ἀ. τῶν νόμων D. 21.225: also ἀ. πρός τινα Arist. Rh. 1373b21; ἀ. εἴς τι D. 37.58; περί τι Plu. Symp. 2.159c:— ἐν ἀδικήματι θέσθαι to consider as a wrong, Th. 1.35; ἀ. θεῖναί τι D. 14.37; ψηφίζεσθαί τι ἐν ἀ. εἶναι Hyp. Eux. 20.
error of judgement, dub. in Plb. 9.20a. 7.

children.label: II
children.definition: that which is got by wrong, ill gotten goods, Pl. R. 365e, Lg. 906d.
one ought to do wrong, Pl. R. 365e; φαμὲν ἑκόντας ἀ. εἶναι Id. Cri. 49a.
wronger, injurer, Eust. 756.58.
disposed to do wrong, Plu. Vind. 2.562d. Adv. -κῶς Stoic. ap. Stob. 2.7.11m.
wrongdoing, injustice, ἀδικίης ἄρχειν Hdt. 1.130, cf. 4.1, E. Or. 28, Pl. Grg. 477c, al.; τύχἡ μᾶλλον ἢ ἀδικίᾳ Antipho 6.1; ‘foul’ in racing, Anon. in SE 30.15.

children.label: II
children.definition: wrongful act, offence, Hdt. 6.136; καταγνόντες αὑτῶν ἀδικίαν And. 1.3:—in pl., Pl. Phd. 82a, etc.
Hdt. 5.89, cf. IG 7.235 (pl.) (Orop.); esp. -ίου γραφή suit for malversation, Arist. Ath. 54.2, cf. Plu. Per. 32; also, damage, PTaur. 4.15 (iii B. C.), cf. PPar. 14.44 (iii B. C.).
seek fame by unworthy means, D.S. 31.6.
evil design, Plb. 22.17.7, Fr. 95.
unjust judgement, Heph.Astr. 3.34.
fight unfairly, esp. in the law-courts, Alciphr. 3.29; dub. in Poll. 3.154.
unfair fighting, Arist. SE 171b23, cf. Ascl. in Metaph. 243.9.
obstinate, X. ap. AB 344 (perh. fr. Cyr. 2.2.26).
plotting injustice, Ar. Fr. 697.
unjustly harming, AB 343.
act wrongly, Plu. Affect. 2.501a, Ph. 2.329.
wrong action, Stoic. ap. Stob. 2.7.11e, Phld. Piet. 19G.
acting wrongly, Perict. ap. Stob. 4.28.19.

wrongdoing, unrighteous, unjust: ἄνθρωποι Hes. Op. 260: Comp. -ώτερος ib. 272; δίκαν ἐξ ἀδίκων ἀπαιτῶ A. Ch. 398 (lyr.): Sup. -ώτατος S. Tr. 1011 (lyr.): ἄ. εἴς τι unjust in a thing, ἔς τινα towards a person, Hdt. 2.119; εἰς χρήματα X. Cyr. 8.8.6; περί τινα ib. 27; ἄ. [ἐν τῷ ἀστραγαλίζειν] one who plays unfairly, Pl. Alc. 1.110b: c. inf., so unjust as to . . , Ep.Hebr. 6.10.
ἄ. ἵπποι obstinate, unmanageable, X. Cyr. 2.2.26; ἄ. γνάθος the hard mouth of a horse, Id. Eq. 3.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: unjust, unrighteous, ἔργα Hes. Op. 334, Hdt. 1.5; ἕργματα Thgn. 380, Sol. 13.12; ἄδικα φρονέειν Thgn. 395; ἄ. λόγος freq. in Ar. Nu.; ἄρχειν χειρῶν ἀ. begin an assault, Antipho 4.2.1, Lys. 4.11, cf. X. Cyr. 1.5.13, D. 47.39; τὸ δίκαιον καὶ τὸ ἄ., τὰ δίκαια καὶ τὰ ἄ. right and wrong, Pl. Grg. 460a, etc.; πλοῦτος ἄ. ill-gotten, unrighteous, Isoc. 1.38; ζυγὸν ἄ. LXX Am. 8.5; νομὴ ἄ. οὐδὲν ἰσχύει PTeb. 286.7 (ii A.D.); ἡ ἄ. . . συναγωγὴ ἀνδρὸς καὶ γυναικός the unrighteous union, Pl. Tht. 150a; ἄ. δίκη vexatious suit, Cratin. 19D.
Ζεὺς νέμων ἄδικα κακοῖς A. Supp. 404 (lyr.), cf. E. Or. 647.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἄ. ἡμέρα, i.e. ἄνευ δικῶν, a day on which the courts were shut, Luc. Lex. 9: δίκαιος ἄ. who has not appeared in court, Archipp. 46.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Adv. -κως Sol. 13.7, A. Ag. 1546; τοὺς ἀ. θνῄσκοντας S. El. 113 (anap.); εἴτε ὦν δὴ δικαίως εἴτε ἀ. jure an injuria, Hdt. 6.137; δικαίως καὶ ἀ. Pl. Lg. 743b; οὐκ ἀ. not without reason, h.Merc. 316, Simon. 89.3, Pl. Phd. 72a.
of unjust disposition, Crates Com. Fr.inc. 7 M.
with unrighteous hand, S. Fr. 977.
with ill-gotten wealth, Crates Com. 42.
close, thick: hence in Hom.,
crowded, thronging, ἁ. κῆρ, like πυκιναὶ φρένες, in physical sense, Il. 16.481, Od. 19.516; of bees, flies, sheep, Il. 2.87, 469, Od. 1.92.

vehement, loud, of sounds, ἁ. γόος Il. 18.316; Σειρῆνες ἁ. the loud-voiced Sirens, Od. 23.326. Adv. -νῶς frequently, or loudly, vehemently, ἁ. ἀνενείκατο Il. 19.314: neut. as Adv., ἁδινὸν γοόωσα Od. 4.721; ἁ. μυκώμεναι 10.413: pl., ἁδινὰ στεναχίζων Il. 23.225; κλαῖʼ ἁ. 24.510: Comp. ἁδινώτερον Od. 16.216:—rare in Lyr. and Trag., ἁ. δάκος a deep bite, Pi. P. 2.53; ἁ. δάκρυα thick-falling tears, S. Tr. 848 (lyr.); βίοτος ἁ. abundant, Tim. Pers. 29; and freq. in A.R., ἁ. ὕπνος, κῶμα abundant, deep sleep, 3.616, 748; ἁ. εὐνή frequent wedded joys, 3.1206. ( Aristarch. wrote ἁδ-, cf. ἁδρός.)
agreement ( Tarent.), Hsch. ( ϝαδ-, cf. Hsch. s.v. γάδιξις.)
not to be travelled through, δυσχωρίαι Them. Or. 16.206d, cf. Charito 7.3.
want of management, Vett.Val. 240.15.
unarranged, D. 24.28, cf. IG 5(2).433 ( Megalopolis, ii B. C.); undigested, Gal. 19.217, Hippiatr. 31:—of property, = ἐκτὸς μισθώσεως, PPetr. 3p.198 (iii B. C.).
without commander, of a ship, A. Fr. 269.
not to be seen through, Poll. 5.150.
unorganized, Iamb. VP 17.73.
not corrected, not set right, D. 4.36:—of books, unrevised, Cic. Att. 13.21a. 1.

children.label: II
children.definition: irremediable, ὁρμή D.S. 37.3; δουλεία App. BC 3.90, cf. D.L. 5.66; ἀδιόρθωτα ἀδικεῖν D.H. 6.20. Adv. -τως D.S. 29.25.
indefiniteness, Nicom. ap. Phot. Bibl. p.143 B.

indesignate, Arist. APr. 26b23; undefined, ἀ. ἀπολέλοιπε τὴν ἀρετὴν τοῦ ποιητοῦ Phld. Po. 1425.1, al.; indefinite, ἄδηλον καὶ ἀ. Arist. PA 639a22, cf. Dam. Pr. 37, al. Adv. -τως Arist. Ph. 184b11, al.; vaguely, loosely, Anon. in SE 62.31.

data.quote: ἀ. ἀπολέλοιπε τὴν ἀρετὴν τοῦ ποιητοῦ

definition: ἀδιούνιος ταῦρος· ὁ Ἀπόλλων ὑπὸ τῶν Κρητῶν, AB 344, Phot.

children.definition: not doubled, of letters, Eust. 781.15. Adv. -τως Id. 870.63.

definition: ἄδις ὡς Ἀπίων, ἀθρόοι· καὶ ἐσχάρα, Hsch. ἄδισκον· κυκεῶνα (Maced.), Id.

children.definition: undoubted, undisputed, PTeb. 124.26 ( ii B. C., written -αστος), Phld. Mus. p.80 K. Adv. -τως AP 12.151, Sch. A.R. 2.62, Ptol. Geog. 1.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., undoubting: hence, instinctive, v.l. for ἀδίδακτος I (q.v.), Pall. in Hp. 2.127 D. Adv. -τως unhesitatingly, Phld. Rh. 1.133 S., Syr. in Metaph. 73.18, Procl. in Prm. p.756S.
not strained or filtered, Gal. 13.285.
not to be cut in two, Nicom. Ar. 1.9.
to be free from thirst, Hp. Coac. 599.
not thirsty, not suffering from thirst, Hp. Epid. 3.17.ιϚʹ, E. Cyc. 574, Arist. PA 669a34, Clearch. 74. Adv. -ψως Hp. Epid. 3.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., quenching thirst, Hp. Acut. 15 ( Sup.), 59, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath. 2.69f.
not causing thirst, Xenocr. 34.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἄδιψον, τό, = γλυκυρρίζα, Dsc. 3.5; adipsos, a kind of date, gathered unripe, Plin. HN 12.103.
not to be eliminated, irremovable, Syn.Alch. p.63 B.
not feeling bound by an oath, Procop. Arc. 5.

definition: ἀδμαίνειν ὑγιαίνειν, ζῆν, Hsch. ἀδμενίδες, αἱ,

children.definition: EM 18.32. ἀδμεύειν, = ἀδμαίνειν, EM 18.31, Suid. ἀδμηλοῖ· ἀφανίζει, Hsch.

definition: ἀδμής, ῆτος, ὁ, ἡ, poet. for ἀδάματος, ( Hom. only in Od.), of maidens,

children.definition: unwedded, παρθένος ἀδμής 6.109, 228; ἀδμῆτας ἀδελφάς S. OC 1056 (lyr.).
unbroken, ἡμίονοι . . ἀδμῆτες Od. 4.637.
ἀδμᾶτες νούσων unsubdued by . . , B. Fr. 19.
Il. 23.655:— virgin, Benndorf Niemann Reise in Lykien p.77.

definition: ἄδμητος, η, ον, poet. for ἀδάματος, in Hom. only in fem. and of cattle,

children.definition: unbroken, βοῦν ἦνιν . . ἀδμήτην, ἣν οὔ πω ὑπὸ ζυγὸν ἤγαγεν ἀνήρ Il. 10.293, Od. 3.383; ἵππον . . ἑξέτεʼ ἀδμήτην Il. 23.266; ἡμίονον ib. 655.

data.quote: βοῦν ἦνιν . . ἀδμήτην, ἣν οὔ πω ὑπὸ ζυγὸν ἤγαγεν ἀνήρ

children.definition: unwedded, of maidens, παρθένῳ ἀδμήτῃ h.Ven. 82, cf. 133, A. Supp. 149; of Artemis, τὰν αἰὲν ἀδμήταν S. El. 1239 (lyr.); of Atalanta, τῆς πρόσθεν ἀ. Id. OC 1321.

uncertainty, Call. Fr. 338 ( -μωλ- Suid.). ἀδμωλεί· χωρὶς δόλου ἢ δουλείας, Suid. ἀδμωλή, ἡ, = ἄγνοια, Hdn.Gr. 1.324, cf. Hsch. ἀδμωλῶ· ἀκηδιῶ, Suid.:—also ἀδμωλεῖν· ἀγνοεῖν ἤ ἀγνωμονεῖν ἢ ἀκηδιᾶν, EM 18.33.
sea-fish, Opp. H. 3.371, 380.
one who has gone to the nether world, prob.l. for ἀγδαβάται, A. Pers. 924 (lyr.).
from the nether world, Hermesian. 7.3.
without doubt, Anacr. 95. [ οῐ l.c.]

unexpected, Hes. (v. infr.); τὰν ἀ. χάριν S. OC 249 (lyr.); τὰ δοκηθέντʼ οὐκ ἐτελέσθη, τῶν δʼ ἀ. πόρον ηὗρε θεός E. Med. 1418 (also in Alc., Ba., Andr., Hel., ad fin.); ξυμφορὰ ἀ. Th. 7.29, etc.; τὸ ἀ. surprise, Id. 4.36, al.

data.quote: τὰ δοκηθέντʼ οὐκ ἐτελέσθη, τῶν δʼ ἀ. πόρον ηὗρε θεός

children.label: II
children.definition: ἀδόκητον καὶ δοκέοντα either inglorious and glorious, or unexpecting and expectant, Pi. N. 7.31, cf. Trag.Adesp. 482 (lyr.):— unexpecting, Memn. 28.2, cf. Nonn. D. 31.209.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -τως Th. 4.17, Phld. Ir. p.49 W.; ἀδόκητα, as Adv., Hes. Fr. 79, E. Ph. 311; ἀπὸ τοῦ ἀδοκήτου Th. 6.47; ἐκ τοῦ ἀ. D.H. 3.64.
not approved, Lys. 14.8, 15.11, Aeschin. 3.15, etc.; πρᾶγμα D.H. 11.57; τὸ ἀ. Onos. Praef. 7.
not legal tender, not current, of coin, Pl. Lg. 742a; not approved, of horses, Arist. Ath. 49.1.
unsatisfactory, unconvincing, of a statement, Ph. Bel. 76.47, Alex.Aphr. in Top. 576.14.
disreputable, λακίσματʼ ἀδόκιμʼ ὀλβίοις ἔχειν E. Tr. 497; μοῦσα Pl. Lg. 829d, cf. D. 25.36, Ep.Rom. 1.28. Adv. -μως Poll. 5.160.
Pl. R. 618b; discredited, reprobate, X. Lac. 3.3, 2 Ep.Tim. 3.8, etc.
talk idly, prate, Eup. 353, Pl. Phd. 70c, X. Oec. 11.3, etc.; ἱκανῶς ἡμῖν ἠδολεσχήσθω ἐπὶ τοῦ πάροντος Epicur. Nat. 28.13.

data.quote: ἱκανῶς ἡμῖν ἠδολεσχήσθω ἐπὶ τοῦ πάροντος

children.definition: prater, idle talker, esp. of reputed sophists: Σωκράτην, τὸν πτωχὸν ἀ. Eup. 352, cf. Ar. Nu. 1485; ἢ Πρόδικος ἢ τῶν ἀ. εἷς γέ τις Id. Fr. 490; ἀ. τις σοφιστής Pl. Plt. 299b, cf. Tht. 195b, R. 488e: generally, talker, babbler, Thphr. Char. 3.2, Arist. EN 1117b35, etc.

data.quote: ἢ Πρόδικος ἢ τῶν ἀ. εἷς γέ τις

children.label: II
children.definition: subtle reasoner, Pl. Cra. 401b. [ ᾱ- in Eup. and Ar. ll.c.; cf. ἁδέω, λέσχη.]
prating, garrulity, Ar. Nu. 1480, Isoc. 13.8, Pl. Tht. 195c, Arist. Rh. 1390a9, Thphr. Char. 3: pl., Simp. in Ph. 1141.8.

children.label: II
children.definition: keenness, subtlety, Pl. Phdr. 269e.

children.label: III
children.definition: conversation, talk, LXX 4 Ki. 9.11, Ps. 54(55).2.
prating, τὸ -κόν garrulity, Pl. Sph. 225d, Procl. in Prm. p.501S.

Cic. Att. 16.11.2, IG 14.1746 ( ἀδελ- lapis); ἀ. καὶ λάλος Alciphr. 3.66; τὸ ἀ. S.E. M. 1.141: Comp. -ότερος Gal. 5.315: Sup. -ότατος Plu. Garr. 2.509a. Adv. -χως Phld. Ir. p.17 W., Rh. 1.212 S. ( Comp.).

definition: ἀδολίευτος, ον, = sq., ἤθη Sch. Ar. Pl. 1158.

children.label: II
children.definition: not concealed, ἄγκιστρον Sch. Opp. H. 3.532.

guileless, honest, σοφία Pi. O. 7.53; in Att. esp. of treaties, ἄ. εἰράνα Ar. Lys. 169; σπονδαὶ ἄ. καὶ ἀβλαβεῖς Th. 5.18. Adv., freq. in the phrase ἀδόλως καὶ δικαίως without fraud or covin, Th. 5.23, cf. IG 1.42e; ἁπλόως καὶ ἀ. GDI 5024 (Gort.): generally, πλουτεῖν ἀδόλως Scol. 8; ἀδολώτερον λέγεσθαι, opp. πιστότερον, Antipho 3.3.4:— also, genuinely, truly, τεθνάκην ἀ. θέλω Sapph. 94.1 L.-P., cf. Theoc. 29.32.

children.label: II
children.definition: unadulterated, genuine, χρίματος ἀδόλοισι παρηγορίαις A. Ag. 95; στύραξ Dsc. 1.66; χρυσός Eupolem. ap. Alex.Polyh. 18; ἀργύριον Poll. 3.86; σῖτος, πυρός, PHib. 1.85, PGrenf. 1.18; ἀ. ἀπὸ παντός ib. 2.29.14: metaph., αὔραις ἀδόλοις pure, E. Supp. 1029 (lyr.); τὸ λογικὸν ἄ. γάλα 1 Ep.Pet. 2.2.
unpretentious, Plu. Pel. 3.

definition: ἅδον, Ep. for ἕαδον, aor. 2 of ἁνδάνω.

children.definition: unshaken, AP 5.267 ( Paul.Sil.).

definition: ἀδονίς, ἡ, poet. for ἀηδονίς, Mosch. 3.46.

children.definition: Anon. in Rh. 105.15 ( Pass.).
unexpected, S. Fr. 223.
not matter of opinion, i.e. certain, Pl. Phd. 84a.

children.label: II
children.definition: free from δόξα, not opining, Aristo Stoic. 1.78, Pers. ib. 102; refusing to form opinions, Timo ap. Aristocl. ap. Eus. PE 14.18. Adv. -τως, opp. δογματικῶς, S.E. P. 1.15, etc.
to be held in no esteem, be in ill repute, ἀδοξοῦντες, opp. οἱ δοκοῦντες, E. Hec. 294, cf. D. 19.103; opp. εὐδοκιμεῖν, Arist. Rh. 1372b22.

children.label: II
children.definition: hold in no esteem, in contempt, τινά J. BJ 1.26.2, al., cf. Plu. Luc. 14:—hence in Pass., αἱ βαναυσικαὶ [τέχναι] . . ἀδοξοῦνται πρὸς τῶν πόλεων X. Oec. 4.2.

data.quote: αἱ βαναυσικαὶ [τέχναι] . . ἀδοξοῦνται πρὸς τῶν πόλεων

children.definition: disgrace, Plu. Sollert. 2.977e.
ill repute, Hp. Lex 1, Th. 1.76, Pl. Phd. 82c, D. 1.11, Phld. Lib. p.4 O., etc.; obscurity, Plu. Agis 2.

children.label: II
children.definition: contempt, App. Syr. 41.
not forming notions, unreasoning, Plb. 6.5.8.
without δόξα, inglorious, πόλεμος D. 5.5; disreputable, τέχνη X. Smp. 4.56.
obscure, ignoble, πόλεις Isoc. 12.253; ἀνώνυμοι καὶ ἄ. D. 8.66, cf. Arist. Rh. 1384b31; of eunuchs, despised, X. Cyr. 7.5.61. Adv. -ξως Plu. Thes. 35.

children.label: II
children.definition: unexpected, S. Fr. 71; improbable, opp. ἔνδοξος, Arist. Top. 159a39, etc.; τὰ -ότατα λέγειν ib. 159a19.
Suid.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst., ἄδορος, ὁ, = κώρυκος, skin, Antim. 64.
without food, fasting, Pi. Pae. 6.128, Lyc. 638.
without body-guard, Arist. Pol. 1315b28.
satiety, loathing, τάμνων δένδρεα μακρά, ἅδος τέ μιν ἵκετο θυμόν Il. 11.88. (Cf. ἅδην.)

data.quote: τάμνων δένδρεα μακρά, ἅδος τέ μιν ἵκετο θυμόν

children.definition: decree, SIG 45 (Halic.), IG 12(8).263.8 ( Thasos); cf. Hsch. s.v. ἅδημα. (Cf. ἅδεῖν, ἁνδάνω.)

definition: ἇδος, ἁδοσύνη, Dor. for ἧδος, ἡδοσύνη.

children.definition: without gifts, h.Merc. 573.
not enslaved, ψυχή Vett.Val. 220.20.
one who has never been a slave, Is. Fr. 138, Arr. Epict. 2.10.1.
have no slaves, Str. 15.1.59.
being without slaves, Arist. Pol. 1323a6.
unattended by slaves, ἄδουλα δώμαθʼ ἑστίας E. Andr. 593: c. gen., τῶν τοιούτων ἄδουλος unattended by . . , Ael. N A 6.10.
having no slaves, too poor to keep a slave, Phryn.Com. 18, Plu. Vit. aer. al. 2.831b.

children.label: II
children.definition: impatient of slavery, ἀδουλότερος τῶν λεόντων Ph. 2.451.
unenslaved, unsubdued, Pers.Stoic. 1.99, D.S. 1.53; ὑπό τινων Procl. in Alc. p.95 C.; ἀδούλωτοι ἡδονῇ Crates Theb. 5.
noiseless, AP 5.293.8 ( Agath.).

definition: ἀδουσιασάμενοι ὁμολογησάμενοι, and ἀδούσιον· ἀρεστόν, σύμφωνον, Hsch.
ἀδραία, Maced. for αἰθρία, Hsch. ἀδρᾰκής, ές,

children.definition: listlessness, weakness, Hdn. 2.10.8, Just. Nov. 102.3: Ep. ἀδρανίη, A.R. 2.200, Call. Fr. 520, AP 6.296 ( Leon.), etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: non-efficiency, τοῦ μὴ ὄντος Simp. in Cael. 136.30. [ δρᾰ.]
to be weak, of starlight, Arat. 471, cf. Opp. H. 1.296, Nonn. D. 32.280.

impotent, feeble, AP 9.359 ( Posidipp.), Plu. Isid. 2.373d, etc.; τὸ -έστατον ταῖς χερσίν LXX Wi. 13.19; τὴν χεῖρα ἀ. Philostr. VA 3.39; -έστατοι ζῴων Babr. 25.3; non-efficient, i.e. unreal, Simp. in Ph. 533.19, 815.24; of nations, Arr. Epict. 3.7.13: Comp., less efficacious, Dsc. 3.110.
deprived of its strength, useless, of iron, Plu. Lyc. 9, Lys. 17.
Arat. 471, Gloss.

definition: Ἀδράστεια, Ion. Ἀδρήστεια, ἡ, ( ἀ- priv., διδράσκω) title of Nemesis, A. Pr. 936, cf. Pl. R. 451a, etc.

children.definition: Ps.-Plu. Fluv. 18.13.
not running away, not inclined to do so, of slaves, Hdt. 4.142, PLond. 2.251.14 (iv A. D.): metaph., χαλκός D.Chr. 37.10.—In Il. only as pr. n.
not done, Hermipp. 3 D. ( ἄδραστα, Hsch., Phot.).

definition: ἀδράφαξυς or ἁδράφαξυς, ἡ, v. ἀτράφαξυς.

children.definition: untouched by sickle, S. Fr. 978.
τὸ περὶ τὰς νοήσεις ἁ. the power of forming great conceptions, Longin. 8.1:—in bad sense, ambitious, Vett.Val. 43.2.
unplucked, A. Supp. 663 (lyr.).
to be full-grown, matured, πυροὶ ἡδρηκότες Dsc. 2.85:— Pass. forms ἁδρεῖτο, ἁδρώμενον ( -ούμενον), Hsch.

definition: Ἀδρίας, ου, Ion. Ἀδρίης, εω, ὁ,

children.definition: the Adriatic, Hdt. 5.9, etc.:— Adj. Ἀδρι-ᾱνός, ή, όν, A. Fr. 71, also Ἀδριηνός, κῦμα τᾶς Ἀδριηνᾶς ἀκτᾶς E. Hipp. 736 (lyr.): later, Ἀδριακός, νέκταρ, of Italian wine, called Adriatic because imported through Corcyra, AP 6.257 ( Antiphil.): Ἀδριᾱνικός, ἀλεκτορίδες Arist. GA 749b29: Ἀδριᾱτικός, ὄρνιθες Chrysipp.Tyan. ap. Ath. 7.285d:—
Ἀδρι-άς, άδος, ἅλμη D.P. 92.
not tart or pungent, Luc. Trag. 323.
in large pieces or masses, of bdellium, Dsc. 1.67.
forcible writing, Phld. Rh. 1.165 S. (dub.).
with large head, Sor. 2.63, Paul.Aeg. 6.74; sens. obsc., Hierocl. Facet. 251.
of coarse, large grains, opp. λεπτομερής, D.S. 5.26, Gal. 8.336 ( Sup.); coarse, of wine, Dsc. 5.6: Comp. -έστεροι, ὄγκοι Ph. 1.493. Adv. -ῶς Heras ap. Gal. 13.1045.

definition: Ἀδρόμιος, sc. μήν, month at Halos, IG 9(2).109a6.

children.definition: with large prizes, ἀγῶνες Scymn. 353.
that will not gallop, ἵπποι Hippiatr. 105.
grow stout, Myro Hist. 1.
with large pores, Cass. Pr. 48.
thick, stout, bulky:

children.label: I
children.definition: χιόνα ἁ. πίπτουσαν ἰδεῖν falling thick, Hdt. 4.31; τῶν ἀνθράκων οἱ ἁδρότατοι the most solid, Hp. Mul. 2.133; κίονες ἁ. large, D.S. 3.47; τοὺς ἁδροτάτους τῶνλέμβων Id. 20.85:— strong, violent, πόλεμος Ar. Ra. 1099; τὰ ἁδρότατατῶν . . συμβάντων Hell.Oxy. 4.1; ῥεύματα full, swollen, Arist. Pr. 949b5; of raindrops, Id. Mu. 394a31 ( Comp.); δῆγμα D.S. 1.35; δωρεάστε καὶ τιμὰς ἁ. δοῦναι in abundance, Id. 19.86; κοιλότης severe deficiency, Phld. Oec. p.71 J.:—of style, powerful, Longin. 40.4 ( Comp.), cf. Phld. Rh. 1.182 S.; ἁ. νοήματα dub. in D.H. Comp. 4; ἀπειλή Phld. Hom. p.35 O.; τὸ ἁ. the grand style, opp. τὸ ἰσχνόν, Ps.-Plu. Vit.Hom. 72. Adv., Comp. ἁδροτέρως, διαιτᾶν live more freely, Hp. Aph. 1.7; ἁ. φαρμακεύειν ib. 4.9; neut. as Adv., ἁδρὸν γελάσαι laugh loud, Antiph. 144; ἁδρότερον πιεῖν drink more deeply, Diph. 5.

children.label: II
children.definition: fine, well-grown, ἐπεὰν τὸ παιδίον ἁ. γένηται Hdt. 4.180; τῷ παιδί, ἐπὴν ἁ. ἔῃ Hp. Genit. 2; τῶν παίδων ὅσοι ἁ. Pl. R. 466e; οἱ -ότεροι the best-grown, the stronger, Isoc. 12.110; οἱ ἁ. chiefs, princes, LXX 4 Ki. 10.6; also ἁ. τὴν ψυχήν Democh. 3; ἡ κατὰ ψυχὴν ἁ. ὑπεροχή Procl. in Alc. p.94 C.
fine, fat, χοῖρος X. Oec. 17.10; λύκος Babr. 101; freq. in Com. of flesh, fish, etc., Antiph. 20.5, 26.21, Alex. 170, etc.
full-grown, ripe, ὅκως εἴη καρπὸς ἁ. Hdt. 1.17, cf. Arist. Metaph. 1017b8.

children.label: b
children.definition: ἁ. ῥίζα, = ἀριστολοχεία στρογγύλη, Ps.- Dsc. 3.4.

children.label: c
children.definition: ready to be laid, Arist. HA 559b11 ( Comp.).—First in Hdt., never in Trag., rare in Att.; but the derivs. ἁδροτής, ἁδροσύνη occur in Ep. and ἁδρύνω in Trag.
want of dew, J. AJ 2.5.5, Vett.Val. 145.13: poet. ἀδροσίη POxy. 1796.18 (sg. and pl.).
Hes. Op. 473.
in large balls, μαλάβαθρον Peripl.M.Rubr. 65.
vigour, strength, Epicur. Ep. 1p.31U.; of plants, Thphr. HP 7.4.11: metaph. of sound, loudness, Amarant. ap. Ath. 10.415a; of style or expression, force, Aristid. Quint. 2.9.

children.label: II
children.definition: abundance, 2 Ep.Cor. 8.20. (In Hom. v.l. for ἀνδροτής, q.v.)

definition: ἁδρόχωροι οἱ ἁδρὰς ἔχοντες χώρας, Hsch.

children.definition: full, χῶρον, a wine-measure, Ostr. 1600.
Ath. 3.83a; Sicilian word, Hsch.

children.label: II
children.definition: upright pieces of a plough, Id.

children.label: III
children.definition: ἀ- copul.) canoes made of hollowed tree-trunks, dug-outs ( Cypr.), Id.

definition: ἀδρυάς, άδος, ἡ, ( ἀ- copul., δρῦς)

children.definition: Nonn. D. 2.92, 22.14, al., Adryasin Prop. 1.20.12, AP 9.664 ( Paul.Sil.).
coming to maturity, Arist. Metaph. 1065b20, Ph. 201a19, Thphr. CP 2.12.1:—written -υσις, Simp. in Epict. p.32 D.

ripen, mature, S. Fr. 979, X. Mem. 4.3.8; ἁδρῦναι καὶ πέψαι τὸν καρπόν Thphr. HP 3.1.3:— Pass., grow ripe, ripen, come to maturity, of fruit or corn, Hdt. 1.193, Arist. Ph. 230b2; of embrya, Hp. Septim. 1, Oct. 12, cf. Arist. HA 565b13; of nestlings, 619b30.
not scratching or tearing, Nonn. D. 11.137.
unfenced, ἀτείχιστος, ἀφύλακτος, ἄνευ δικαστηρίου, Hsch.: metaph., ἄπονος καὶ ἀταλαίπωρος, AB 345.
to want power, be incapable, LXX Si. Prol. 20, Simp. in Cael. 139.24: c. inf., PLond. 2.361r8 (i A. D.).
want of strength, debility, Hp. VM 10: pl., ib. 19, Plu. An seni 2.791d; of medicine, want of strength, Thphr. HP 9.18.4.

inability, incapacity, Hdt. 8.111, Arist. Metaph. 1019b15, etc.; ἡ τοῦ λέγειν ἀ. Antipho 5.2, cf. Pl. Lg. 646b, etc.: pl., LXX 3 Ma. 2.13: c. gen., ἀ. τοῦ ἀδικεῖν for wrongdoing, Pl. R. 359b; τῶν πραγμάτων for political action, Arist. Pol. 1314a23; [ ψυχῆς] Stoic. 3.23: c. inf., Pl. R. 532b.
poverty, lack of resources, X. Oec. 20.22, D. 19.186.
weak, of wine, Dsc. 5.6: — without potency, Procl. Inst. 80, 149: -μον, τό, absence of potency, Olymp. in Phd. p.40N.:—Astrol., of planets, Ptol. Tetr. 53.

data.ref: Olymp. in Phd. p.40N.:—Astrol., of planets,

children.definition: Hdt. 3.79, 7.172, Th. 8.8: c. gen., ἀ. τοῦ λέγειν Id. 7.8:—also ἀδυναστία, v.l. for -ασία in D.H. Dem. 26, cf. Gloss. ( ἀδύναστος, ib.), and ἀδυνατία, Dinol. 9.
impotently, Suid.
to be ἀδύνατος, lack strength, Epich. 266, Arist. Somn.Vig. 454a27: c. inf., to be unable to do, Hp. de Arte 7, Pl. R. 366d, X. Mem. 1.2.23, Arist. EN 1165b22, Pol. 1287b17, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: to be impossible, LXX Jb. 10.13, Phld. Ir. p.98 W., Ev.Matt. 17.20, Ev.Luc. 1.37, Ps.-Callisth. 3.26.

children.label: I
children.definition: unable to do a thing, c. inf., Hdt. 3.138, Epich. 272, E. HF 56, etc.; ἀ. εἰπεῖν Arist. Rh. 1379a2; ἀ. ὥστε . . Onos. 1.13: Comp., τὸν δυνατώτερον τοῦ -ωτέρου [πλέον ἔχειν] Pl. Grg. 483d: Sup. -ώτατος, λέγειν Eup. 95.

without strength, powerless, weakly, Hdt. 5.9, E. Ion 596, Andr. 746; οἱ ἀ. men disabled for service, whether as invalids or paupers, Lys. 24 tit., Arist. Ath. 49.4; ἐν τοῖς ἀ. μισθοφορεῖν Aeschin. 1.103; ἀ. σώματι Lys. 2.73; ἀ. χρήμασι poor, Th. 7.28; εἴς τι Pl. Hp.Mi. 366b; οἱ -ώτατοι persons of no importance, Phld. Herc. 1457.8; of ships, disabled, Hdt. 6.16; τὸ ἀ. want of strength, Pl. Hp.Ma. 296a; τὰ ἀ. disabilities, D. 18.108.

children.label: II
children.definition: impossible, E. Or. 665, Hel. 1043; ἐλπίδες unrealizable, Democr. 58; τὸ ἀ. Arist. Cael. 280b12; ἡ εἰς τὸ ἀ. ἀπαγωγή reductio ad impossibile, APr. 29b5; ὁ διὰ τοῦ ἀ. συλλογισμός, ἡ διὰ τοῦ ἀ. δεῖξις, ib. 34b30, 45a35; ἀδύνατα βούλομαι Lync. 1.12:— ἀδύνατόν [ἐστι] c. inf., Hdt. 1.32, al.; ἀδύνατά [ἐστι] Pi. P. 2.81, Hdt. 1.91, 6.106, Th. 1.59; ἀ. ὑμῖν ὥστε . . Pl. Prt. 338c; ὑμέας καταλελάβηκε ἀ. τι βοηθέειν Hdt. 9.60; τὰ ἀ. καρτερεῖν E. IA 1370; τολμᾶν ἀδύνατα Id. Hel. 811; ἀδυνάτων ἐρᾶν Id. HF 318, cf. Luc. DDeor. 13.1[8], etc.; prov., ἀδύνατα θηρᾷς Macar. 1.26: Comp. -ώτερον, ἔτι . . εἰ οἷόν τε . . Pl. Tht. 192b, cf. Prm. 138d: Sup., ὃ δὴ πάντων -ώτατον Id. Phlb. 15b.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -τως without power or skill, feebly, ἀμύνεσθαι Antipho 4.3.3, cf. 3.3.4 ( Comp.), Lys. 12.3:— ἀ. ἔχειν to be unwell, Pl. Ax. 364b; to be unable, c. inf., Arist. Rh.Al. 1435a16; ἀ. ἔχει it is impossible, Epicur. Ep. 2p.49U.; ἀ. λέγεται it is an impossible story, Phld. Rh. 2.122 S.—Rare in poetry: Trag. only in E.
debilitate, in Pass., Erot. s.v. κατηπορήθη.
without complaint, prob. in Vit.Philonid. p.13 C.
not to be put out of countenance, inexorable, Μοῖραι JHS 32.274 (Pamphyl.), cf. Ph. 2.543, Plu. Adul. 2.64f. Adv. -τως, ἐνοχλεῖν Vit.pud. 534b.
not to be entered, θησαυρός Pi. P. 11.4; ἄ. ἐστιν ὁ τόπος Str. 14.1.44.
never setting, of stars, Sch. Arat. 632.

children.label: II
children.definition: Subst. (masc. in h.Merc. 247, neut. in Hdt. 5.72, E. Ion 938), innermost sanctuary or shrine, Il. 5.448, 512, h.Ap. 443; εὐώδεος ἐξ ἀ. Pi. O. 7.32: metaph., ἐκ τοῦ ἀ. τῆς βίβλου Pl. Tht. 162a; ἄ. θαλάσσης Opp. H. 1.49, cf. Hymn.Is. 152.

definition: ᾄδω, Att. contr. for ἀείδω, q.v. ἀδῶ· ἀρέσκω, Hsch.

children.definition: unbuilt, Nonn. D. 17.40.

definition: ἀδών [ ᾱ], όνος, ἡ, Dor. for ἀηδών, Mosch. 3.9; cf. ἀδονίς.

children.definition: AP 6.275 ( Nossis), Theoc. 15.149.
shoes (prob. with play on ἀ- priv., Lat. donarium, worthless gifts), Procop.Gaz. Ep. 146 [140].
of Adonis, κῆποι Suid.

μέτρον) a kind of verse, consisting of a dactyl and spondee, Sacerd. p. 516 K.

definition: ἀεθλοφόρος, ον, Ep. and Lyr. for ἀθλοφόρος.

children.definition: ever, always, Hom., etc.; with other specifications of time, ἐμμενὲς αἰεί Od. 21.69; συνεχὲς αἰ. 9.74; ἀ. καθʼ ἡμέραν, καθʼ ἡμέραν ἀ., ἀ. καὶ καθʼ ἡμέραν, ἀ. κατʼ ἐνιαυτόν, ἀ. διὰ βίου, etc., Pl. Phd. 75d, etc.; ἀ. πανταχοῦ D. 21.197, cf. Ar. Eq. 568; διὰ παντὸς ἀ. Pax 397; ἐνδελεχῶς ἀ. Men. 521; δεῦρʼ ἀεί until now, E. Or. 1663, Pl. Lg. 811c; αἰεί κοτε, ποτε from of old, Hdt. 1.58, Th. 6.82; αἰ. δήποτε 1.13; cf. εἰσαεί:—with the Art., ὁ ἀ. χρόνος eternity, Hdt. 1.54, Pl. Phd. 103e, etc.; οἱ ἀ. ὄντες the immortals, X. Cyr. 1.6.46, etc.:—but ὁ αἰ. βασιλεύων the king for the time being, Hdt. 2.98; οἱ ἀ. δικάζοντες D. 21.223; ὁ αἰ. ἐντὸς γιγνόμενος every one as he got inside, Th. 4.68; τὸν ἀ. προστυχόντα D. 21.131; τοῖσι τούτων αἰ. ἐκγόνοισι to their descendants for ever, Hdt. 1.105, cf. 3.83, etc.; in A. Pr. 937, θῶπτε τὸν κρατοῦντʼ ἀ., ἀεί is postponed metri gr.—Dialectic forms (cf. Hdn.Gr. 1.497, Et.Gud.z):
αἰεί, Ep., Ion., Poet., and Early Att. (cf. Marcellin. Vit.Thuc. 52); found (beside ἀεί) in Att. Inscrr. to 361 B.C.
ἀεί [ ᾰ three times in Hom., ᾱ/ᾰ Att.] normal in Att. Inscrr. from 361 B.C.
αἰέν, Il. 1.290, al. ( ἆεν is v.l. in Il. 11.827), Pi. N. 6.3, Sophr. 90, A. Pr. 428, Ag. 891, S. Aj. 682.
Dor. αἰές, Ar. Lys. 1266, Bion Fr. 1.1; also ἀές, Tab.Heracl. 1.134.
Aeol. αἶι( ν), ἄιν, Hdn.Gr. l.c.; cf. IG 9(2).461 ( ἄϊν, Thess.), SIG 58 ( Milet.), and v. ἀϊπάρθενος, ἀείδασμος.
αἰέ, Hdn.Gr. l.c.
ἀέ, Pi. P. 9.88, Pisand. 11 ( ᾰἐ); cf. ἀέ-ναος.
Boeot. ἠί, Hdn. Gr. l.c.
Tarent. αἰή, ibid.

children.label: II
children.definition: τὸ ἀ. eternity, τὸ ἀ. τοῦτο οὐκ αἰώνιόν ἐστιν ἀλλὰ χρονικόν Procl. Inst. 198. The statement of Harp. that ἀεί = ἕως in Att. is based on misinterpretation of such phrases as ἐς τόνδε αἰ. τὸν πόλεμον Th. 1.18. ( αἰϝεί Epigr.Gr. 742, GDI 60.31 ( Cypr.), IG 9(1).334.4 ( Locr.), cf. Lat. aevum.)

definition: ἀειγενέτης, only in Ep. form αἰειγενέτης, ου, ὁ,

everlasting, opp. ἀΐδιος, Plu. Isid. 2.374d.
eternally generated, ψυχή Dam. Pr. 410.

children.definition: Procl. in Ti. 3.311D.
perpetual producer, epith. of Apollo ( τῷ τὸν αὐτὸν ἀεὶ γίγνεσθαι καὶ ἀεὶ γεννᾶν), Macr. Sat. 1.17.35.
unfermented wine, Plin. HN 14.83.
Orph. A. 15.
ever-lamented, μνήμη IG 2.3552b.
subject to a perpetual charge, γῆ GDI 5661 (Chios, written ἀιδ-) ; δασμὸς ἀ., Ἀθηνᾶ 20.169 ( Chios).
unseen, dark, Hes. Fr. 112; obscure, Opp. H. 1.86, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: not to be looked on, dazzling, Nic. Th. 20.
formless, Arist. Cael. 306b17; indistinct, ὀσμαί Thphr. Od. 1; f.l. for ἀϊδής. Pl. Phd. 79a.
unsightly, χροιά a bad complexion, Hp. Nat.Mul. 41.
deformity, J. BJ 7.5.5.
ever-revolving, ἄτρακτος, σφαῖρα, AP 6.289 ( Leon.), Nonn. D. 6.87.
everlasting, Hsch.
perpetual slavery, Poll. 3.80, Hdn. Epim. 221.

definition: ἀειδράστεια, ἡ, etym. of Ἀδράστεια, Corn. ND 13.

ἀείδω, Ion. and poet. form used by Hom., Pi., and sometimes in Trag. and Com. (even in trim., A. Ag. 16, E. Fr. 188; in tetram., Cratin. 305), also in Ion. Prose; contr. ᾄδω (also Anacr. 45, Theoc.), Trag., Pl., etc.: impf. ἤειδον Od., Ep. ἄειδον Il., etc.; Trag. and Att. ᾖδον E. Alc. 761, Th. 2.21: fut. ἀείσομαι Od. 22.352, Thgn. 943, but ᾄσομαι h.Hom. 6.2, 32.19, Thgn. 243, and always in Att. ( ᾄσεις, σουσιν in Ar. Pax 1297, Pl. Lg. 666d are corrupt); rarely in act. form ἀείσω, Sapph. 11, Thgn. 4, Ar. Lys. 1243 ( Lacon.), and late Poets, as Nonn. D. 13.47 (in E. HF 681 ἀείδω is restored by Elmsl.); still more rarely ᾄσω, Babr. 12.13, Men.Rh. p.381S., Him. Or. 1.6; Dor. ᾀσεῦμαι Theoc. 3.38, ᾀσῶ Id. 1.145: aor. ἤεισα Call. Epigr. 23.4, Opp. C. 3.1, Ep. ἄεισα [ᾰ] Od. 21.411; ἄεισον E. Tr. 513 (lyr.); ἀείσατε Ar. Th. 115 (lyr.); ᾖσα Ar. Nu. 1371, Pl. Ti. 21b:— Med., aor. ἀεισάμην (in act. sense) PMag.Lond. 47.43, imper. ἀείσεο h.Hom. 17.1 (nisi leg. ἀείσεο):— Pass., ἀείδομαι Pi., Hdt.: poet. impf. ἀείδετο Pi.: aor. ᾔσθην, v. infr. ΙΙ.1: pf. ᾖσμαι Pl.Com. 69.11. ( ἀϝείδω, cf. αὐδή, ὑδέω.) [ᾰ: but ᾱ metri gr. Od. 17.519, h.Hom. 12.1, 27.1, Il.Parv.1 [28?], Thgn. 4, Theoc. 7.41, etc.]:—

children.definition: sing, Il. 1.604, etc.: hence of all kinds of vocal sounds, crow as cocks, Pl. Smp. 223c; hoot as owls, Arat. 1000; croak as frogs, Arist. Mir. 835b3, Thphr. Sign. 3.5, etc.; οἱ τέττιγες χαμόθεν ᾄσονται Stes. ap. Arist. Rh. 1412a23:—of other sounds, twang, of the bow-string, Od. 21.411; whistle, of the wind through a tree, Mosch. Fr. 1.8; ring, of a stone when struck, Theoc. 7.26:—prov., πρὶν νενικηκέναι ᾄδειν ‘ to crow too soon’, Pl. Tht. 164c.—Constr.:— ἀ. τινί sing to one, Od. 22.346; also, vie with one in singing, Theoc. 8.6; ᾄ. πρὸς αὐλὸν ἢ λύραν sing to . . , Arist. Pr. 918a23; ὑπʼ αὐλοῖς Plu. Aud. 2.41c:— ἀείσας . . χαίρειν Δημοκλέα, poet. for εἰπών, Epigr.Gr. 237.7 ( Smyrna).

data.ref: Il. 1.604, etc.: hence of all kinds of vocal sounds,

children.definition: sing of, chant, μῆνιν ἄειδε Il. 1.1; παιήονα 1.473; κλέα ἀνδρῶν, νόστον, 9.189, Od. 1.326; τὸν Βοιώτιον νόμον S. Fr. 966: c. gen. (sc. μέλος), sing an air of . ., Φρυνίχου Ar. V. 269, cf. 1225: abs., ἀ. ἀμφί τινος to sing in oneʼs praise, Od. 8.266; ἀμφί τινα Terp. 2, cf. E. Tr. 513; εἴς τινα Ar. Lys. 1243: later, simply = καλεῖν, Ael. NA 3.28:— Pass., of songs, to be sung, Hdt. 4.35; τὰ λεχθέντα καὶ ᾀσέντα Pl. Ly. 205e; ᾆσμα καλῶς ᾀσθέν, opp. λόγος καλῶς ῥηθείς, X. Cyr. 3.3.55; ᾄδεται λόγος the story runs, Ph. 1.189.
sing, praise, celebrate, B. 6.6, etc.:— Pass., ἀείδεται θρέψαισʼ ἥρωας is celebrated as the nurse of heroes, Pi. P. 8.25, cf. 5.24.
Pass., to be filled with song, ἀείσετο πᾶν τέμενος . . θαλίαις Pi. O. 10(11).76.
eternal being, Antipho Soph. 22.
everliving, Dam. Pr. 161.
everlasting life, Dam. Pr. 161.

definition: ἀείζωος, ον, Trag. contr. ἀεί-ζως, ων,

children.definition: ever-living, everlasting, πῦρ ἀείζωον Heraclit. 30, Nic. Al. 174; ἀείζως γενεά S. Fr. 740; ἀείζων πένθος ib. 741; ἀείζως θεός CIG 4598 (Palaest.), BGU 1247 (ii A. D.); οἱ ἀείζωοι the immortals, Call. Iamb. 1.265; ἀειζώου ψυχᾶς Melanipp. 6, IG 14.2241 ( Italy): metaph., ἄχθος ἀείζων A. Supp. 988:—dist. fr. ἀίδιος, Corp.Herm. 8.2.

ever-girded, aye ready, EM 22.20, sine expl.

evergreen, AP 7.195 ( Mel.), 12.256 ( Mel.); δένδρα Chor. p.87 B.: metaph., ever-blooming, Χάριτες Orph. H. 60.5; νέος (of Γάμος personified) Men.Rh. p.404S.; τὸ ἀ. τῶν φύλλων Dsc. 4.88.

always warming, Eratosth. 16.8.

ever-warlike, Opp. C. 2.189.

definition: ἀεικέλιος, α, ον, Od. 4.244, also ος, ον 19.341;

children.definition: ἀεικής, 13.402, Il. 14.84; contr. αἰκέλιος Thgn. 1344, E. Andr. 131 (lyr.): —of things, words, and actions; more rarely of persons, Od. 6.242. Adv. -ίως Od. 8.231, 16.109, B. 3.45.

data.ref: E. Andr. 131 (lyr.): —of things, words, and actions; more rarely of persons,

children.definition: unseemly, shameful, ἀεικέα λοιγὸν ἀμύνειν Il. 1.456, al.; ἀεικέα [εἵματα] ἕσσαι Od. 24.250; δεσμός A. Pr. 97, cf. 525; ἀεικεῖ σὺν στολᾷ S. El. 191 (lyr.); -έστερα ἔπεα Hdt. 7.13; οὐδὲν ἀ. παρέχεσθαι cause no inconvenience, Id. 3.24; ἀεικέα μισθόν (v.l. ἀνεικέα, q.v.) meagre, Il. 12.435; so οὐ . . ἀεικέα . . ἄποινα 24.594. Adv. ἀεικῶς Hsch.; Ion. -έως Simon. 13; ἀεικές as Adv., Od. 17.216.
οὐδὲν ἀεικές ἐστι, c. inf., it is nothing strange that . . , Hdt. 3.33, 6.98, A. Pr. 1042.
injurious, deadly, ἰός Opp. H. 2.422.

definition: ἀεικία, Ion. -ίη ( Att. αἰκία, q.v.) [ ῑ, whence in codd. often written -είη], ἡ,

children.definition: outrage, injury, πᾶσαν ἀεικίην ἄπεχε χροΐ (from Hectorʼs body) Il. 24.19: pl., μή τίς μοι ἀεικίας ἐνὶ οἴκῳ φαινέτω Od. 20.308; ἀεικίῃ περιέπειν τινά Hdt. 1.73, 115; ἀπαθὴς τῆς ἀ. Id. 3.160.

definition: ἀεικίζω ( Att. αἰκίζω, q.v.), fut. -ιῶ Il. (v. infr.), later Ep. also ἀεικίσσω Q.S. 10.401: Ep. aor. ἀείκισσα Il. 16.545:— Med., Ep. aor. ἀεικισσάμην ib. 559, 22.404:— Pass., Ep. aor. inf. ἀεικισθήμεναι Od. 18.222 :—

perpetual motion, Inscr. Perg. 333, [ Gal.]19.376, Syr. in Metaph. 37.13, Procl. in Prm. p.874S.

ever-babbling, AP 5.177 ( Mel.).
ever-shining, Stob. 1.22.2.
wheedle, cajole, EM 21.40, Hsch.; cf. ἀελλεῖ.
to be always talking, Hsch.; condemned by Phryn. PS p.35B.

unsunned, πεδία A. Fr. 334.

definition: ἀειναής, ές, = sq., Nic. Fr. 78, in Ep. dat. pl. ἀειναέεσσι.
ἀειναῦται, ῶν, οἱ, board of magistrates at Chalcis, IG 12(9).909 ( ἀε-), 923 (iii B. C.); also at Miletus, Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.298c. (Cf. ναῦος; wrongly expl. by Plu. l.c. as meeting on board ship.)
ἀείνως, ων, Att. contr. for ἀείναος, v. ἀέναος.

definition: ἄειρον ( ἐρῶ) · ἄρρητον, Hsch., EM 21.43: also - ἀθώπευτον, ib.:— but ἄειρος, ον, (εἴρω) = ἄπειρος, Hsch., Suid.
ἀείροος, ον, contr. ἀεί-ρους, ουν, = sq., Aristeas 116, Suid.
