definition: ἀείρω, Ep., Ion., and poet.; αἴρω (once in Hom., v. infr.), Att. and Trag. (exc. A. Th. 759, Pers. 660, both lyr.); Aeol. ἀέρρω, Alc. 78: impf. ἤειρον ( συν-) Il. 10.499, Hdt. 2.125, Ep. ἄειρον Il. 19.386, Att. and Trag. ᾖρον: fut. ἀρῶ [ᾱ], contr. for ἀερῶ (which is not found), A. Pers. 795, E. Heracl. 322, Tr. 1148, prob. in Luc. Hist.Conscr. 14: aor. 1 ἤειρα ( συν-) Il. 24.590, ( παρ-) Archil. 94, Herod. 9.13, Ep. ἄειρα Il. 23.730; Aeol. imper. ἀέρρατε Sapph. 91; subj. ἀέρσῃ Panyas. 13.13; part. ἀείρας S. Ant. 418; also ἄηρα IG 12(3).449 ( Thera); ἦρα Hdt. 9.59, A. Ag. 47, Th. 6.18, etc., 3 pl. ἤροσαν LXX Jo. 3.14, opt. ἄραις Herod. 5.71, inf. ἆραι Call. Cer. 35, part. ἄρας Th. 2.12, etc., Cret. ἤραντας GDI 5015 (Gort.) [ ᾱ- in all moods]: pf. ἦρκα D. 25.52, ( ἀπ-) Th. 8.100, plpf. ἤρκεσαν ( ἀπ-) D. 19.150:— Med. ἀείρομαι ( ἀπ-) Il. 21.563, S. Tr. 216 (lyr.); αἴρομαι E. El. 360, Th. 4.60: fut ἀροῦμαι [ᾱ] E. Hel. 1597 : aor. 1 imper. ἀείραο A.R. 4.746, inf. ἀείρασθαι ( ἀντ-) Hdt. 7.212, part. -άμενος Il. 23.856, IG 4.952.112 (Epid.); also ἠράμην [ᾱ- in all moods] Il. 14.510, Od. 4.107, E. Heracl. 986, Ar. Ra. 525, Pl. R. 374e, etc., Dor. ἄρατο B. 2.5 : pf. ἦρμαι S. El. 54:— Pass., E. Alc. 450 (lyr.), Hp. Mul. 2.174: fut. ἀρθήσομαι Ar. Ach. 565: aor. ἠέρθην A.R. 4.1651, ( παρ-) Il. 16.341, Ep. ἀέρθην Od. 19.540, 3 pl. ἄερθεν Il. 8.74, subj. ἀερθῶ E. Andr. 848 (lyr.), part. ἀερθείς Od. 8.375, Pi. N. 7.75, A. Ag. 1525 (lyr.), Hp. Mul. 1.1, etc.; also ἤρθην Simon. 111, A. Th. 214 (lyr.), Th. 4.42, etc., part. ἀρθείς Il. 13.63, ( ἐπ-) Hdt. 1.90, etc.: pf. ἤερμαι A.R. 2.171: Ep. plpf. 3 sg. ἄωρτο (for ἤορτο) Il. 3.272, Theoc. 24.43, ἔωρτο Hsch. [ ἀείρω has ᾰ, exc. in late poetry, as Opp. C. 1.347.] ( ἀείρω = ἀ-ϝερ-yω, cf. αὐειρομέναι Alcm. 23.63; αἴρω (once in Hom., Il. 17.724 in part. αἴροντας) may = ϝαρ-yω for ϝṛ-yω from the reduced form of the root, but is more probably an analogical formation arising from the contracted forms. Fut. ἀροῦμαι [ᾰ] and aor. ἀρόμην, ἤρετο, etc., inf. ἀρέσθαι [ᾰ], belong to ἄρνυμαι, q.v.; ἤρᾰτο may have displaced ἤρετο in Hom, cf. Eust. ad Il. 3.373. The sense attach found in compds. συν-, παρ-αείρω is prob. derived from the use V.1.)

children.label: I
children.definition: Act., lift, raise up, νέκυν Il. 17.724; ὑψόσʼ ἀείρας [κυνέην] 10.465; πίνακας παρέθηκεν ἀείρας Od. 1.141; Εὐμάστας με ἄηρεν ἀπὸ χθονός IG 12(3).449, inscr. on a stone ( Thera); ἀπὸ γῆς αἴ. Pl. Ti. 90a; ἱστία στεῖλαν ἀείραντες furled by brailing them up, Od. 3.11; but ἀ. ἱστία hoist sail, A.R. 2.1229; αἴ. κεραίας D.S. 13.12; εὔμαριν ἀ. A. Pers. 660; κοῦφον αἴ. βῆμα walk lightly, trip, E. Tr. 342; αἴ. σκέλη, of a horse, X. Eq. 10.15, cf. Arist. IA 710b20; ὀρθὸν αἴ. τὸ κάρα A. Ch. 496; ὀφθαλμὸν ἄρας S. Tr. 795; ἄρασα μύξας, of a deer, Id. Fr. 89; ὀφρῦς αἴροντα Diph. 85; αἴ. σημεῖον make a signal, X. Cyr. 7.1.23; αἴ. μηχανήν, in the theatre, Antiph. 191.15; so ἐπὶ τὰς μηχανὰς καταφεύγουσι θεοὺς αἴροντες Pl. Cra. 425d; τεῖχος ἱκανὸν αἴ. Th. 1.90, cf. 2.75:—freq. in part., ἄρας ἔπαισε he raised [them] and struck, S. OT 1270; ἡ βουλὴ ἄρασα τὴν ἀφʼ ἱερᾶς ἀφῆκεν Plu. Cor. 32, cf. 1 Ep.Cor. 6.15 :— Pass., ἐς αἰθέρα δῖαν ἀέρθη Od. 19.540, cf. Il. 8.74; ὑψόσʼ ἀερθείς Od. 12.432; ἔμπνους ἀρθείς Antipho 2.1.9; φρυκτοὶ ᾔροντο Th. 2.94, cf. Aen. Tact. 26.14; mount up, X. HG 5.2.5; ἄνω ἀρθῆναι, of the sun, to be high in heaven, Hp. Aër. 6; to be seized, snatched up, Ar. Ach. 565.

data.quote: ἐπὶ τὰς μηχανὰς καταφεύγουσι θεοὺς αἴροντες
ἡ βουλὴ ἄρασα τὴν ἀφʼ ἱερᾶς ἀφῆκεν

children.definition: take up, in various uses: draw water, Ar. Ra. 1339; gather food, S. Ph. 707; pluck herbs, PMag.Par. 1.287, al.

take up and carry or bring, ἐκ βελέων Σαρπηδόνα δῖον ἀείρας Il. 16.678; νόσφιν ἀειράσας 24.583; ἄχθος ἀ. convey, of ships, Od. 3.312; μῆλα ἐξ Ἰθάκης ἄειραν νηυσί carried them off, 21.18; μή μοι οἶνον ἄειρε bring me not wine, Il. 6.264.
take up and bear, as a burden, μόρον A. Pers. 547; ἆθλον S. Tr. 80; ἄλγος A.R. 4.65.

children.label: b
children.definition: wear clothes, LXX 1 Ki. 2.28, al.

τὰς ναῦς αἴ. get the ships under sail, Th. 1.52; esp. intr., get under way, set out, ἆραι τῷ στρατῷ Id. 2.12: abs., ib. 23:— Pass., ἀερθῆναι Hdt. 9.52; ἀερθέντες ἐκ . . 1.165; ἀ. εἰς . . 1.170; ἐφʼ ἡμετέρᾳ γᾷ ἀρθείς S. Ant. 111 (lyr.); but ἀερθείς carried too far, Pi. N. 7.75.
raise, levy, λεκτὸν ἀροῦμεν στόλον A. Pers. 795.
rear a child, τοῖς τοκεῦσί σʼ ἤειρα Herod. 9.13.

children.label: II
children.definition: raise up, exalt, ἀπὸ σμικροῦ δʼ ἂν ἄρειας μέγαν A. Ch. 262, cf. 791; ὄλβον ὅν Δαρεῖος ἦρεν Id. Pers. 164:—esp. of pride and passion, exalt, excite, ὑψοῦ αἴ. θυμόν grow excited, S. OT 914; αἴ. θάρσος pluck up courage, E. IA 1598:— Pass., to be raised, increased, ἡ δύναμις ᾔρετο Th. 1.118; ᾔρετο τὸ ὕψος τοῦ τείχους μέγα Id. 2.75; ἤρθη μέγας rose to greatness, D. 2.8; οὐκ ἤρθη νοῦν ἐς ἀτασθαλίην Simon. 111; ἀρθῆναι φόβῳ, δείμασι, A. Th. 214, E. Hec. 69: abs., ἀείρομαι S. Tr. 216 (lyr.), cf. Ar. Ec. 1180.

data.quote: ἀπὸ σμικροῦ δʼ ἂν ἄρειας μέγαν

data.ref: Id. Pers. 164:—esp. of pride and passion,

data.quote: ᾔρετο τὸ ὕψος τοῦ τείχους μέγα

children.definition: raise by words, hence, praise, extol, E. Heracl. 322, etc.; αἴ. λόγῳ to exaggerate, D. 21.71.

children.label: III
children.definition: lift and take away, remove, ἀπό με τιμᾶν ἦραν A. Eu. 847; τινὰ ἐκ τῆς πόλεως Pl. R. 578e; generally, take away, put an end to, κακά E. El. 942; τραπέζας αἴ. clear away dinner, Men. 273; ἀρθέντος τοῦ αἰτίου Arist. Pr. 920b11; deny (opp. τίθημι posit), S.E. P. 1.10; Delph. and Locr. pf. Pass. part. ἀρμένος cancelled, null and void, ὠνὰ ἀ. καὶ ἄκυρος GDI 1746 (Delph.); ἀτελὴς καὶ ἀ. IG 9(1).374 ( Naupactus).
make away with, destroy, Ev.Matt. 24.39; ἆρον, ἆρον away with him! Ev.Jo. 19.15; ἐκ τῶν ζώντων αἴ. Tab.Defix.Aud. 1.18.

children.label: IV
children.definition: Med., lift, take up for oneself or what is oneʼs own, [ πέπλων] ἕνʼ ἀειραμένη Il. 6.293; hence, carry off, win, πάντας ἀειράμενος πελέκεας 23.856; ἄρατο νίκαν B. 2.5; ἠρμένοι νίκην Str. 3.2.13.
ὄγκον ἄρασθαι to be puffed up, S. Aj. 129; θαυμαστὸν ὄγκον ἀράμενοι τοῦ μύθου Pl. Plt. 277b.

raise, lift, τύπωμα ἠρμένοι χεροῖν S. El. 54; κανοῦν αἴ. Ar. Av. 850; βοῦς IG 2(2).1028.28, cf. Thphr. Char. 27.5; ῥόθιον raise a surging cheer, Ar. Eq. 546; Σαμόσατα ἀράμενος μετέθηκεν Luc. Hist.Conscr. 24; ἀείρεσθαι τὰ ἱστία hoist sail, Hdt. 8.56, cf. 94.

raise, stir up, νεῖκος ἀειράμενος Thgn. 90, cf. E. Heracl. 986, 991; begin, undertake, πόλεμον A. Supp. 342, Hdt. 7.132, Th. 4.60, D. 5.5 ( Pass., πόλεμος αἴρεται Ar. Av. 1188); κίνδυνον Antipho 5.63; φυγὴν αἴρεσθαι take to flight, A. Pers. 481, E. Rh. 54.
take upon oneself, undergo, πόνον S. Ant. 907; πένθος Id. OT 1225; βάρος E. Cyc. 473.
βαρὺς ἀ. slow to undertake anything, Hdt. 4.150.
take away, remove, E. IT 1201; hence, kill or destroy, D.H. 4.4, J. AJ 19.1.3; πόλιν D.H. 6.23.

children.label: V
children.definition: Pass., to be suspended, hang, [ μάχαιρα] πὰρ ξίφεος μέγα κουλεὸν αἰὲν ἄωρτο Il. 3.272, 19.253.

data.quote: μάχαιρα] πὰρ ξίφεος μέγα κουλεὸν αἰὲν ἄωρτο

children.definition: to be swollen, [ σπλὴν] ἀερθείς Hp. Mul. 1.61; μαζοὶ ἀείρονται ib. 2.174.

definition: ἀείσε, late form for ἀεί, Steph. in Hp. 1.129 D., al.

children.definition: privilege of an ἀείσιτος, Hp. Ep. 27.
always fed: perpetual guest, Epich. 34; at Athens, of those maintained at public cost in the Prytaneum (in form ἀϊσ-), IG 2(2).678.42, 3.1019, al.

data.ref: Epich. 34; at Athens, of those maintained at public cost in the Prytaneum (in form

children.definition: owl (cf. σκώψ), so called (acc. to Arist.) from not being migratory, perh. Ephialtes scops, Arist. HA 617b32. ( Pl. -σκῶπες, but ἀείσκωπες Eust. 1524.6.)

definition: ἄεισμα, τό, poet. and Ion. for ᾆσμα, Hdt. 2.79, Eup. 139, Call. Epigr. 29.1.

children.definition: ever-turning, Tz. H. 10.568.

definition: ἀείτας, α, ὁ, Boeot. for ἀετός, Lyc. 461.

children.label: II
children.definition: v. sub ἀΐτας.
ever-perfect, θεός Alcin. Intr. 10.

definition: ἄειτον ταχύ, Hsch., EM 21.42; cf. ἄελλον.

children.definition: always above the horizon, of stars, Nearch. ap. Arr. Ind. 25.6, cf. Cleom. 1.5.
ever-shining, πῦρ, of the sun, D.P. 583; λύχνος Nonn. D. 27.320.
ever-shining, Corp. Herm. 18.14.
ever-watching, i.e. everlasting, τῷ ἀ. μελιλώτῳ Cratin. 98.7; οἴκησις ἀ., of the grave, S. Ant. 892; πόνοι Opp. H. 4.189.
exile for life, φευγέτω ἀειφυγίαν Pl. Lg. 877c, IG 1.9, SIG 194 ( Amphipolis, iv B. C.); ἀειφυγίᾳ ζημιοῦν τινά D. 21.43, etc.
being non-deciduous, Thphr. CP 2.17.2.
not deciduous, Arist. GA 783b10, Thphr. CP 1.10.7.
always green, Euph. 133; used of κάππαρις, Dsc. 2.173.
everlasting, AP 12.229 ( Strat.).
Od. 13.277, cf. h.Cer. 30, Od. 18.135. ἀέκασσα· ἄκουσα, Hsch. ἀέκαστι, Adv., etym. of ἀέκητι, A.D. Conj. 233.26, EM 19.33.

definition: ἀεκήλιος, ον, for ἀεικέλιος, Il. 18.77. (Derived from ἀ- priv., ἕκηλος by Hdn.Gr. 2.106.)

children.definition: against oneʼs will, c. gen., ἀ. σέθεν Od. 3.213, 16.94; θεῶν ἀ., ἀ. θεῶν, Il. 12.8, Od. 4.504.

definition: ἀεκούσιος, ον (also α, ον Luc. Syr.D. 18), Ion. and Ep. (also in anap., S. Tr. 1263); Att. contr. ἀκούσιος [ ᾱ], ον, also in Democr. 240:—

children.definition: against the will, constrained, of acts or their consequences, καὶ τῷ οὔ κως ἀεκ. ἐγίνετο τὸ ποιεύμενον Hdt. 2.162; τλήσομαι . . ἀεκούσια πολλὰ βίαια Thgn. 1343; ἐς ἀ. ἀνάγκας πίπτειν Th. 3.82; πόνοι Democr. l.c.; often in Att. of involuntary offences, ἀ. φόνος Antipho 3.2.6; πράκτορες τῶν ἀκουσίων ib., cf. Pl. Lg. 733d, 864a, Arist. EN 1109b35, al.; τὰ μὲν ἀ. ἁπλῇ, τὰ δὲ ἑκούσια διπλῇ IG 1.1. Adv. -ίως D. 21.43, Sever. ap. Eus. PE 13.17.

data.quote: καὶ τῷ οὔ κως ἀεκ. ἐγίνετο τὸ ποιεύμενον
τὰ μὲν ἀ. ἁπλῇ, τὰ δὲ ἑκούσια διπλῇ

children.label: II
children.definition: Adv. ἀκουσίως involuntarily, Th. 2.8, Pl. Ti. 62c; ἀ. ἀποθανεῖν, opp. ἑκουσίως ἀποκτείνειν, Antipho 1.5; ἀ. τινὶ ἀφῖχθαι to have come as an unwelcome guest, Th. 3.31.

definition: ἀέκων, Ep. and Ion.; Att. and Trag. contr. ἄκων [ᾱ], ουσα, ον (un contr. form also in IG 1.61 (law of Draco), A. Supp. 39 (anap.), sts. found in codd. of Hdt., as 4.120, 164):—

children.definition: involuntary, constrained, of persons, ἀέκοντος ἐμεῖο Il. 1.310; ἑκὼν ἀέκοντί γε θυμῷ 4.43; πόλλʼ ἀέκων 11.557; opp. βουλόμενος, Hp. VC 11; τὼ δʼ οὐκ ἀέκοντε πετέσθην (v.l. ἄκοντε) Il. 5.366, Od. 3.484; κάρτα ἀ. Hdt. 9.111; ἀέκουσι (v.l. ἀεκούσια) δάκρυα παραρρεῖ Hp. Epid. 1.[3.]19: contr. first in h.Cer. 413; ἄκοντος Διός invito Jove, A. Pr. 771; repeated, ἄκοντά σʼ ἄκων προσπασσαλεύσω ib. 19, cf. 671; ἄ. ἀκούειν οὓς ἑκὼν εἶπεν λόγους S. Fr. 929, cf. Ant. 276; μηδένα τῶνδʼ ἀέκοντα μένειν κατέρυκε Thgn. 467. Adv. ἀκόντως unwillingly, ὁμολογεῖν Pl. Prt. 333b, cf. Hp.Mi. 374d; οὐκ ἀ. ἀλλὰ προθύμως ἐπείσθησαν X. HG 4.8.5.

data.quote: ἄ. ἀκούειν οὓς ἑκὼν εἶπεν λόγους

children.label: II
children.definition: involuntary, κακὰ ἑκόντα κοὐκ ἄ. S. OT 1230; ἔργων ἀ. Id. OC 240 (lyr.), cf. 977.
brothers-in-law, whose wives are sisters, Hsch. ( αἴλιοι), Eust. 648.45, EM 31.24; cf. εἰλίονες.

definition: ἀέλιος, ὁ, Dor. for ἠέλιος, ἥλιος. [ᾱ, but ᾰ S. Tr. 835.]
ἄελλα, Ep. ἀέλλη, ης, Aeol. αὔελλα Alc. 125 ( αὐεοῦλλαι cod. Hsch.), ἡ,

children.definition: stormy wind, whirlwind, ἀργαλέων ἀνέμων ἀτάλαντοι ἀέλλῃ Il. 13.795; ἄελλαι παντοίων ἀνέμων Od. 5.292, 304; of dust, ὕψι δʼ ἀέλλη σκίδνατο Il. 16.374, cf. 13.334; in late Prose, Olymp. in Mete. 13.18.
whirling motion, ὠκυδρόμοις ἀ., of an animal, E. Ba. 873; ἄστρων ὑπʼ ἀέλλαισι Id. Hel. 1498.—Cf. ἀείλη.
storm-swift, πελειάς S. OC 1081 (lyr.).
= ἀελλαῖος, storm-swift, ἵπποι S. OT 466 (lyr.); φωναί Id. Fr. 688.

definition: ἀελλεῖ φιλεῖ, κολακεύει, Hsch.; but ἀελλῶν· στρέφων, ὀπτῶν, ποικίλ<λ>ων, Id. ἀέλλεται· πνεῖ, EM 20.1.

children.definition: Nonn. D. 5.322, al.
eddying dust, Il. 3.13. (Perh. rather ἀελλῆς, contr. for -ήεις.)

definition: ἀελλησιθύμοις (prob. -μυθοις) · ἀνυποστάτοις μετὰ παρρησίας, Hsch., AB 348.

children.definition: storm-swift, πῶλος B. 5.39.
with hair floating in the wind, S. Fr. 292.
struggling with the storm, AP 7.586 ( Jul. Aeg.).

definition: ἀελλόπος, ποδος, ὁ, ἡ, for ἀελλόπους (like ἀρτίπος, Οἰδίπος, etc.):—

children.definition: storm-footed, storm-swift, Il. 8.409, etc. (never in Od.); Ἅρπυια Euph. 113; dat. pl. ἀελλοπόδεσσιν h.Ven. 217: pl. ἀελλόποδες, -πόδων, Simon. 7, Pi. N. 1.6, etc.: once in Trag., E. Hel. 1314.—Later ἀελλοπόδης, ου, of the hare, Opp. C. 1.413.

data.ref: Pi. N. 1.6, etc.: once in Trag.,

definition: Ἀελλώ, όος, contr. οῦς, ἡ, ( ἄελλα)

children.definition: Storm-swift, name of a Harpy, Hes. Th. 267.
storm-like, stormy, Sch. Il. 3.13, cf. Hsch.

definition: ἀέλον ἕωλον (Cret.), Hsch. ἀελπάρεα· δεινά, Id.

children.definition: unhoped for, γαῖαν ἀελπέα δῶκεν ἰδέσθαι Od. 5.408.
have no hope, despair, only in part., ἀελπτέοντες σόον εἶναι Il. 7.310; ἀ. τοὺς Ἕλληνας ὑπερβαλέεσθαι Hdt. 7.168.
an unlooked for event, ἐξ ἀελπτίης unexpectedly, Archil. 54; unexpected stroke, Pi. P. 12.31 [where ῑ].

unhoped for, unexpected, h.Cer. 219, Hes. Fr. 96.57, B. 3.29; ἐξ ἀέλπτου beyond hope, unexpectedly, in good sense, Hdt. 1.111; ἐξ ἀέλπτων S. Aj. 715 (lyr.); in bad sense, A. Supp. 357, 987 (prob. l.); πῆμʼ ἄ., ἄ. κακόν, Id. Pers. 265, 1006; εἴπερ ὄψομαι τὰν ἄ. ἁμέραν E. Supp. 784; ἄελπτα γὰρ λέγεις Id. Hel. 585.
beyond hope, despaired of, Archil. 74, Hp. Art. 42.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., hopeless, desperate, h.Ap. 91, A. Supp. 907.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -τως beyond all hope, in good sense, A. Pers. 261, S. El. 1263: neut. pl. as Adv., ἀ. φανείς E. Ph. 311. [ ᾱ Hes. l.c.]
bow-string or bow, Call. Dian. 10, Ap. 33.
= sq., κελάδημα IPE 12.519. ( Chersonesus, ii A. D.).

definition: ἀέναος [ ᾱ-], ον, ( νάω Α) ἀένναος Hdt., αἰέναος IG 5(1).1119 ( Geronthrae, iv B. C.); contr. ἀείνως Ar. Ra. 146, gen. pl. ἀείνων Cratin. 20 D.: Trag. only in lyr.:—

children.definition: ever-flowing, κρήνης τʼ ἀενάου καὶ ἀπορρύτου Hes. Op. 595; ἀ. λίμνη, ποταμός, Hdt. 1.93, 145, cf. Simon. 120; ποταμοί A. Supp. 553, E. Ion 1083, cf. 118; Ἀχέρων Theoc. 15.102; ἀενάου πυρός Pi. P. 1.6, cf. Call. Ap. 83; βόρβορον καὶ σκῶρ ἀείνων Ar. l.c.; ἀέναοι νεφέλαι Id. Nu. 275;—generally, everlasting, ἀρετᾶς . . κόσμον ἀέναόν τε κλέος Simon. 4.9; ἀ. τιμά, of Zeus, Pi. O. 14.12; ἀ. κράτος E. Or. 1299 (lyr.); ἀενάοις ἐν τραπέζαις, of public hospitality, Pi. N. 11.8; γλῶτταν καλῶν λόγων ἀείνων Cratin. l.c.:—also in Prose, κλέος Heraclit. 29; τροφή X. Ages. 1.20; ἀεναώτερον . . τὸν ὄλβον παρέχειν Id. Cyr. 4.2.44; ἀέναον οὐσίαν πορίσαι Pl. Lg. 966e; ἀ. ποταμῶν ἀμήχανα μεγέθη Id. Phd. 111d, cf. Arist. Mete. 349b9; θῖνες LXX Ba. 5.7; ἀένναοι τῶν θεῶν πρόσοδοι Procl. Inst. 152. Adv. ἀενάως Arist. Oec. 1346b15.

definition: ἀενάων, ουσα, ον, = foreg., Od. 13.109, Hes. Op. 550, Antim. 59.3.

children.definition: increasing while one lives (?), πένθος IG 14.2123.
strengthening the limbs, ἄεθλα Pi. N. 4.73.
growing horns, κριός IG 14.1301.
strengthening the mind, Procl. H. 3.16, Nonn. D. 14.119.
nourishing the fruit of the womb, Nonn. D. 5.614, al.
fostering growth, Orph. H. 51.18.
nourishing leaves, leafy, ἀκταί A. Ag. 697.
nourishing plants, Ἠώς AP 9.363.5 ( Mel.), cf. Nonn. D. 7.304, al.

definition: ἀέξω, poet. form of αὔξω ( αὐξάνω), once in Hdt., twice in Trag. (lyr.); in early writers only in pres. and unaugm. impf.: in later Poets fut. ἀεξήσω Nonn. D. 12.24, aor. ἠέξησα ib. 8.104, IG 4.787 ( Troezen, iv A. D.): fut. Med. ἀεξήσομαι A.R. 3.837: aor. Pass. ἀεξήθην AP 9.631 ( Agath.): plpf. ηέξητο ( ἀν-) Nonn. D. 4.427: ( ἀϝέξω, cf. Lat. augeo, Skt. vakṣáyati, etc.):—

children.definition: increase, foster, ἀνδρὶ δὲ κεκμηῶτι μένος μέγα οἶνος ἀέξει Il. 6.261; θυμὸν ἀ. Il. 17.226; πένθος ἀ. cherish woe, Od. 17.489; υἱὸν ἀ. rear him to manʼs estate, 13.360; ἔργον ἀέξουσι . . θεοί they bless the work, 15.372.

data.quote: ἀνδρὶ δὲ κεκμηῶτι μένος μέγα οἶνος ἀέξει

children.definition: exalt, glorify, αὐτούς τʼ ἀέξοι καὶ πόλιν Pi. O. 8.88; τὸ πλῆθος ἀ. Hdt. 3.80; spread, diffuse, [ἀγγελίαν] μῦθος ἀέξει S. Aj. 226.
ἀ. βούταν φόνον E. Hipp. 537.

children.label: II
children.definition: Pass., increase, grow, Τηλέμαχος δὲ νέον μὲν ἀέξετο was waxing tall, Od. 22.426; καλὰ μὲν ἠέξευ Call. Jov. 55; οὐ . . ποτʼ ἀέξετο κῦμά γʼ ἐν αὐτῷ no wave rose high thereon, Od. 10.93; χόλος . . ἀνδρῶν ἐν στήθεσσιν ἠΰτε καπνός ἀ. rises high, Il. 18.110; τόδε ἔργον ἀ. it prospers, Od. 14.66; ἀέξετο ἱερὸν ἦμαρ was getting on to noon, Il. 8.66; μηνὸς -ομένοιο Hes. Op. 773; μῆτις ἀ. Emp. 106; κέρδος ἀ. A. Ch. 825 (cod. M), cf. Supp. 856 (prob.).
A. Ag. 141 (Sch. Med. τοῖς ἕπεσθαι τοῖς γονεῦσι μὴ δυναμένοις).

children.label: II
children.definition: ἔπος), = ἄρρητος, v.l. for ἄαπτος, q.v.
A.R. 4.1186; ὕπνος Lyr.Adesp. 92:—also ἀεργ-ής, ές, Nic. Fr. 72.4.
a not-working, idleness, Od. 24.251, Hes. Op. 311, Bion Fr. 14.6 (ubi vulg. ἀεργείᾳ).
a lying fallow or waste, Orac. ap. Aeschin. 3.108; of the bowels, sluggishness, Aret. SD 1.15.

unpleasant, οὐδέν οἱ ἀηδέστερον ἔσεσθαι Hdt. 7.101, cf. Pl. Lg. 893a, al.: freq. in Pl. of narration, ἀηδές or οὐκ ἀηδές ἐστι, Ap. 33c, 41b, Phd. 84d: Comp., Hdt. l.c.: Sup. -έστατος Pl. Lg. 663c, Phdr. 240b.

data.ref: Pl. Lg. 893a, al.: freq. in Pl. of narration,

children.label: II
children.definition: disagreeable, odious, ἀπογηράσκων ἀ. γίγνεται Alex. 278, cf. D. 47.28, Arist. EN 1108a30, Thphr. Char. 20.1; τινί to one, Pl. Phd. 91b, Phld. Ir. p.51 W.

children.label: III
children.definition: Adv. -δῶς unpleasantly, ζῆν Pl. Prt. 351b; ἀ. ἔχειν τινί to be on bad terms with one, D. 20.142, cf. 37.11; ἀ. διακεῖσθαι, διατεθῆναι, πρός τινα, Lys. 16.2, Isoc. 12.19.
without pleasure to oneself, unwillingly, πίνειν, ἀκούειν, X. Cyr. 1.2.11, Isoc. 12.62; οὐκ ἀ. Pl. Prt. 335c.
nauseousness, of drugs, Hp. Acut. 23.
unpleasantness, opp. ἡδονή, Phld. Rh. 1.163 S.: pl., Id. Oec. p.64J.

children.label: II
children.definition: unpleasantness, odiousness, D. 21.153, Aeschin. 3.72, Thphr. Char. 20.1; τὴν σὴν ἀ. your odious presence, Aeschin. 3.164.
disgust, dislike, Pl. Phdr. 240d, Lg. 802d, etc.: pl., ἀ. καὶ βαρύτητες τῶν ἄλλων Isoc. 12.31.
disgust, τὴν γεῦσιν S.E. P. 1.92: — Pass., to be disgusted, Anon. in Rh. 194.32; τινι Alex.Aphr. Pr. 2.15; ἐπί τινι PLond. 1.42 (ii B. C.).
disgust, opp. ἡδονή, S.E. P. 1.87.
absence of pleasure, D.L. 2.89, 90.
young nightingale pl. -ῆες Theoc. 15.121 (prob.).

definition: ἀηδόνιον, τό, Dim. of ἀηδών, prob.l. in D.Chr. 66.11.

children.definition: of a nightingale, γόος, νόμος ἀ., A. Fr. 291, Ar. Ra. 684.
light, Nicoch. 4 D., cf. Nonn. D. 5.411.
nightingale, E. Rh. 550 (lyr.), Call. Lav.Pall. 94, Theoc. 8.38; Μουσάων ἀηδονίς, of a poet, AP 7.414 ( Noss.); of a girl, IG 14.1942.
E. Hec. 685, cf. Gloss.
quarrelsome, Gloss.
= sq., gen. ἀηδοῦς S. Aj. 628 (lyr.), voc. ἀηδοῖ Ar. Av. 679 (lyr.): nom. pl. ἄηδοι Sapph. Oxy. 1787.6.7. (Mytil. acc. to Sch. S. l.c.)

definition: ἀηδών, όνος, ἡ ( ὁ, v. infr.), ( ἀείδω)

children.definition: songstress, i.e. the nightingale, Hes. Op. 203, etc.; Πανδαρέου κούρη, χλωρηὶς ἀ., i.e. living in the greenwood, Od. 19.518; χλωραύχην ἀ. Simon. 73:—metaph., of a poet, B. 3.98, cf. E. Fr. 588 (lyr.), AP 7.44 ( Ion), Hermesian. 7.49; also of the poetʼs song, τεαὶ ἀηδόνες thy strains, Call. Epigr. 2.5; ζωούσας ἔλιπες γὰρ ἀηδόνας IG 14.2012.

data.ref: Hermesian. 7.49; also of the poetʼs song,

children.definition: cicada, AP 7.190 ( Anyte).

children.label: II
children.definition: mouthpiece of a flute, E. Fr. 556; the flute itself, ib. 931.
shuttle, AP 6.174 ( Antip. Sid.).—Masc., only Ion l.c.; Ἀττικὸς ἀνὴρ τὸν αἴγα λέγει ὥσπερ καὶ τὸν ἀηδόνα Eust. 376.24.

data.quote: Ἀττικὸς ἀνὴρ τὸν αἴγα λέγει ὥσπερ καὶ τὸν ἀηδόνα

definition: ἀήθεια, Ion. -ίη [ ι- metri gr.], ἡ, ( ἀήθης)

children.definition: unaccustomedness, novelty of a situation, Batr. 72, Pl. Ti. 18c; ἀ. τινος inexperience of a thing, Th. 4.55; ὑπὸ ἀηθείας from inexperience, Pl. Tht. 175d; διʼ ἀήθειαν (cod. ἀλήθ-) Aen.Tact. 38.3.
to be unaccustomed, c. gen., once in Hom., ἀήθεσσον γὰρ ἔτʼ αὐτῶν Il. 10.493; ἀηθέσσουσα δύης A.R. 4.38; λυγμοὶ ἀηθέσσοντες Nic. Al. 378:—for A.R. 1.1171 v. sq.
to be unaccustomed, Hsch.: impf. ἀήθεον prob.l. A.R. 1.1171 (codd. ἀήθεσον).
unwonted, strange, ὄψις A. Supp. 567; δώματα v.l. in S. Fr. 583.10. Adv. -θως unexpectedly, Th. 4.17.

children.label: II
children.definition: unused to a thing, c. gen., μάχης Th. 4.34, cf. Pl. Tht. 146b, al.; ἀ. τοῦ κατακούειν, τοῦ προπηλακίζεσθαι, D. 1.23, 21.72.

children.label: b
children.definition: strange in manner, unlike oneself, prob. f.l. for ἀγηθής in S. Tr. 869.
without character, τραγῳδία Arist. Po. 1450a25, cf. 1460a11.
E. Hel. 418.
to be unaccustomed to a thing, Posidon. 26.
blast, wind, A. Ag. 1418, Eu. 905, S. Aj. 674, Call. Aet. 3.1.36 [Fr. 75.36 Pf.].

definition: ἄημι, 3 sg. ἄησι Hes. Op. 516, A. Fr. 178 A., 3 dual ἄητον Il. 9.5, 3 pl. ἄεισι Hes. Th. 875; imper. 3 sg. ἀήτω A.R. 4.768; inf. ἀῆναι Od. 3.183, Ep. ἀήμεναι ib. 176; part. ἀείς, ἀέντος, etc., Emp. 84.4, Il. 5.526, al.: impf. 3 sg. ἄη Od. 12.325, 14.458:— Pass., 3 sg. ἄηται, impf. ἄητο, part. ἀήμενος, v. infr. ( ἄϝημι, cf. Skt. vá̄ti ‘blows’, Lith. vējas ‘windʼ):—

children.definition: Ep. Verb, prop. breathe hard; hence, blow, of winds, τώ τε Θρῄκηθεν ἄητον Il. 9.5, cf. Od. 3.176, 183, etc.; οἵ τε νέφεα . . διασκιδνᾶσιν ἀέντες Il. 5.526; ἀνέμων . . μένος ὑγρὸν ἀέντων Od. 19.440, cf. Hes. Th. 869, 875:— Pass., to be beaten by the wind, ὑόμενος καὶ ἀήμενος Od. 6.131; of sound, of be carried by the wind, A.R. 2.81: more freq. metaph., toss, wave to and fro, of the mind in doubt or fear, δίχα θυμὸς ἄητο Il. 21.386; περὶ παίδων θυμὸς ἄηται A.R. 3.688:— also μαρτύρια ἄηται ἐπʼ ἀνθρώπους are wafted to and fro, Pi. I. 4(3).9; περί τʼ ἀμφί τε κάλλος ἄητο beauty breathed all about her, h.Cer. 276; ἀπὸ κρῆθεν τοῖον ἄητο Hes. Sc. 8, cf. Fr. 245.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., breathe, διὰ πνευμόνων ὕπνον A. Fr. 178A.

definition: ἀήρ, ἀέρος, Hom. ἀήρ, ἠέρος; Ion. nom. ἠήρ Hp. Aër. 6, al., Aret. CA 2.3; Aeol. αὐήρ Sch. Pi. P. 2.52; Dor. ἀβήρ (i.e. ἀϝήρ) Hsch.:— fem. in Hom. and Hes. (exc. Op. 549), Anaxag. ap. Thphr. Sens. 30; from Hdt. downwds. masc. ( Il. 5.776, 8.50, h.Cer. 383 cannot be quoted for the masc. usage, since there πουλύς and βαθύς need not be masc.):—

children.definition: Hom. and Hes. always mist, haze, not (as Aristarch.) lower air (opp. αἰθήρ, q.v.); [ἐλάτη] μακροτάτη πεφυυῖα διʼ ἠέρος αἰθέρʼ ἵκανεν Il. 14.288, cf. Anaxag. 1, Ar. Nu. 264 sq.; περὶ δʼ ἠέρα πουλὺν ἔχευεν Il. 5.776, cf. 3.381, 8.50; ἠέρα μὲν σκέδασεν καὶ ἀπῶσεν ὀμίχλην 17.649; τρὶς δʼ ἠέρα τύψε βαθεῖαν 20.446; rare in Prose, Hp. l.c.

data.quote: [ἐλάτη] μακροτάτη πεφυυῖα διʼ ἠέρος αἰθέρʼ ἵκανεν
ἠέρα μὲν σκέδασεν καὶ ἀπῶσεν ὀμίχλην

children.definition: air, Anaxim. 1, Emp. 17.18, S. El. 87, Ar. Av. 187, 694, etc.; πρὸς τὸν ἀέρα διατρίβειν in the open air, Ar. Nu. 198, cf. Teles p. 11.3 H., Luc. Anach. 24; τὸν ἀέρʼ ἕλκειν καθαρόν Philyll. 20, cf. Philem. 119; ἔσπασας τὸν ἀ. τὸν κοινόν Men. 531.7; ἀέρα δέρειν 1 Ep.Cor. 9.26; εἰς ἀέρα λαλεῖν ib. 14.9:—in pl., Pl. Phd. 98c, 98d; climates, Hp. Aër. tit., cf. Men.Rh.p.383 S.; of mephitic exhalations, Str. 5.4.5.
ὦ δέσποτʼ ἄναξ ἀμέτρητʼ Ἀ. Ar. Nu. 264; Ἀ. ὃν ἄν τις ὀνομάσειε καὶ Δία Philem. 91.4, cf. Diph. 126.6.

data.quote: Ἀ. ὃν ἄν τις ὀνομάσειε καὶ Δία

children.label: II
children.definition: hot-air room in baths, Gal. 11.14.
volume, Hero Stereom. 57, al.

children.label: III
children.definition: sky-blue or grey, Id. Aut. 28.3. [ ᾱ, except in Arist. Fr. 642, Ps.-Phoc. [108].]
blowing, E. Rh. 417, cf. Fr. 781.46.
unconquered, not beaten, Th. 6.70, Lys. 33.7, D. 18.247, AP 7.741 ( Crin.), etc.; esp. of the Stoic sage, Zeno Stoic. 1.53, etc.
unconquerable, Pl. R. 375b, Phld. D. 3 Fr. 88b.
wicked, ἔργα Il. 5.876.
light as air, μύρμηκες A. Pr. 452; ἀ. γόνυ κάμψει Call. Hec. Fr. 311 Pf. [updated ref.]; γυῖα Orph. Fr. 18; springing lightly, πόρτις Tryph. 360; blowing softly, Βορέας A.R. 2.1101.
fly, Arat. 523 (with play on αἰητός)
blast, gale, ἀνέμοιο, Ζεφύροιο, ἀνέμων ἀῆται, Il. 15.626, Od. 4.567, Hes. Op. 621: abs., wind, Tim. Pers. 117, Theoc. 2.38.—Poet. word, οἱ ποιηταὶ τὰ πνεύματα ἀήτας καλοῦσι Pl. Cra. 410b.

Aquila, Arat. 315.

θάρσος ἄητον Il. 21.395 (= θάρσος ἄᾱτον Q.S. 1.217); also ἄητοι; ἀκόρεστοι, ἄπληστοι, and ἀήτους· μεγάλας ( A. Fr. 3), Hsch. ἄητος (C) · ὁ ἀκατάπαυστος, Hdn.Gr. 1.220; perh. insatiate ( ἄω); cf. αἴητος.
without sound, φωνή Aret. SD 1.11, Sch. E. Ph. 960.
unwedded, ἡλικίη Epigr.Gr. 372.32 ( Cotiaeum).
ignorance of the sea, v.l. for sq. in Secund. Sent. 16.
without sea, far from it, inland, Men. 462.9.
Max.Tyr. 1.3; ἔμπορος Secund. Sent. 16.

unused to the sea, a land-lubber, Ar. Ra. 204, Agath. 1 Praef.

definition: ἄθαλδον ἐτύγχανον, τινὲς δὲ ἀθάδανον, Hsch.
ἀθαλής or ἀθαλλής, ές, of the laurel,

children.definition: not verdant, withered, Plu. Pomp. 31, Orac. ap. Ath. 12.524b.
without warmth, Nonn. D. 37.151, 40.286, etc. Adv. -πέως Hp. Acut. 29.
fearless, unabashed, ἔρος, ὕβρις, σῶμα, Ibyc. 1.9, B. 14.58, Phryn.Trag. 2; σκότου Plu. Lyc. 16.
free from alarms, PMag.Par. 1.1064.
imperturbability, Democr. 215.
imperturbable, Democr. 216.

definition: Ἀθάνα, Ἀθᾶναι, Ἀθᾱναία, Dor. for Ἀθην-, v. Ἀθήνη.

children.definition: immortality, Pl. Phdr. 246a, Arist. EN 1111b22, Epicur. Ep. 3p.60U., etc.; ὁ δὲ λιμός ἐστιν ἀθανασίας φάρμακον Antiph. 86.6.

data.quote: ὁ δὲ λιμός ἐστιν ἀθανασίας φάρμακον

children.label: II
children.definition: elixir or antidote, ἀ. Μιθριδάτου Gal. 14.148, cf. 13.203.
Luc. DDeor. 10[4].5.
make immortal, τὴν φύσιν Arist. Fr. 645, cf. Ph. 2.255, al.:— Pass., to become or be immortal, Plb. 6.54.2, Ph. 1.32, 37, al.
regard as immortal, ψυχάς J. AJ 18.1.5.

children.label: II
children.definition: hold oneself immortal, Γέται οἱ ἀθανατίζοντες Hdt. 4.93sq., cf. 94; ἐφʼ ὅσον ἐνδέχεται ἀ. put off the mortal, Arist. EN 1177b33, cf. Philostr. VA 8.7.
gift of immortality, ὁ διὰ τῆς δόξης ἀ. D.S. 1.1.

definition: ἀθάνατος, ον, also η, ον (so regularly in sense Ι.1, poet. and Isoc. 9.16):—

children.definition: undying, immortal, Hom., etc.; ἀ. πρόσωπον, of Aphrodite, Sapph. 1.14:— hence ἀθάνατοι, οἱ, the Immortals, Hom., Pi. Pae. 6.50, etc.; ἀθάναται ἅλιαι, i.e. the sea goddesses, Od. 24.47: Comp. -ώτερος Pl. Phd. 99c.
of immortal fame, Tyrt. 12.322.

children.label: II
children.definition: everlasting, perpetual, ἀ. κακόν Od. 12.118; χάρις Hdt. 7.178; ἀρετή, ἀρχά, S. Ph. 1420, OT 905 (lyr.); κλέος, μνήμη, B. 12.65, Lys. 2.81; συκοφάντης Hyp. Lyc. 2; ἀ. ὁ θάνατος ‘death that cannot die’, Amph. 8; of Nisus’ purple locks, ἀ. θρίξ on which life depended, A. Ch. 619.

children.label: III
children.definition: οἱ ἀ. the immortals, a body of Persian troops in which vacancies were filled up by successors already appointed, Hdt. 7.83, 211; so ἀ. ἀνήρ one whose successor in case of death is appointed (as we say, the king never dies), ib. 31; of a standing army, D.C. 52.27.

maintained at a constant figure, πρόβατα PSI 4.377.5 (iii B. C.), PThead. 30.6 (iii A. D.); αἶγες PStrassb. 30.6 (iii A. D.); διὰ τὸ ἀθάνατον (sc. τὸ παιδίον) αὐτὴν ἐπιδεδέχθαι τροφεύειν BGU 1106.25 (Aug.).

children.label: V
children.definition: Adv. ἀθανάτως, εὕδειν AP 9.570 (Philod.). [ ᾱθ- always in the Adj. and all derivs., v. sub ἀ- 1 fin.]
make immortal, Tz. H. 6.740.
undying, ψυχή Max.Tyr. 16.2.
unburied, Il. 22.386, MoschioTrag. 6.32, etc.; ἄθαπτον ὠθεῖν, βάλλειν, ἐᾶν τινά, S. Aj. 1307, 1333, Ant. 205.

children.label: II
children.definition: unworthy of burial, AP 9.498.

definition: ἀθάρη (not ἀθάρα, Moer. 184, cf. Hdn.Gr. 1.340), ἡ,

children.definition: gruel or porridge, Ar. Pl. 673, Pherecr. 108.3, Crates 9, Nicoph. 15, Anaxandr. 41.42. [ ᾰθᾰρη ll.cc.: cf. ἀθήρα.]

definition: ἀθαρής ἄφθορος, of women, Hsch. ἀθάριοι· αἱ μὴ διαπεπαρθενευμέναι, τινὲς δέ, μὴ δεδεμέναι ἄρθρῳ, Id.

children.definition: to be discouraged, Procop. Vand. 2.11 (s.v.l.).
discouraged, downhearted, Plu. Cic. 35, Max.Tyr. 25.4, Doroth. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 2.195: τὸ ἀ. want of courage, Plu. Nic. 4. Adv. -σῶς Id. Pomp. 60, Symp.2.150c ( Comp.).
like ἀθάρη, of the brain, Ruf. Anat. 3.
absence of wonder, Str. 1.3.21: c. gen., 1.3.16.
not wondering at anything, πρός τι Zeno Stoic. 1.57, M.Ant. 1.15. Adv. -τως S. Fr. 982; also ἀθαυμαστί Suid.

children.label: II
children.definition: not wondered at or admired, Luc. Am. 13.
not beholding, καλλέων τοσούτων Men. Rh. p.383 S. Adv. -όνως, i.q. ἀνεπιστημόνως, ἀπείρως, Poll. 4.10:— also Subst. ἀθεαμ-οσύνη, ἡ, ib. 9.
unseen, invisible, Luc. Nav. 44, Plu. Gen.Socr. 2.575b, Ael. NA 8.7.
that may not be seen, secret, Ps.-Phoc. 100, Plu. Num. 9, Luc. DMar. 14.2; τὰ ἀ. J. AJ 14.16.3, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not seeing, blind to, τινός X. Mem. 2.1.31, Arist. Mu. 391a25, Plu. Lib.educ. 2.7c, Max.Tyr. 3.10. Adv. -τως Poll. 4.10.
want of sight, blindness, Aret. CD 1.4.
without the aid of God, mostly with neg., οὐκ ἀθεεί Od. 18.353, Philostr. VS 1.21.2, D.C. 59.12, Plot. 4.3.16, Nonn. D. 7.178, etc.
Ael. Fr. 39, Sm. Ho. 4.15, Sallust. 18 (pl.), Hierocl. in CA 1p.418M.; v.l. for ἀθεσία, LXX 1 Ma. 16.17.

children.definition: uninspired, οὐκ ἀ. Plu. Cor. 33.

definition: ἀθειρής, ές, Ep. for ἀθερής, prob. in Thgn. 733; also,

children.definition: EM 24.58. Adv. ἀθειρέως ibid.
filter, Hsch., who also has ἀθελβεῖ· ἕλκει.
unappeased, Nonn. D. 33.200.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., having no power to soothe, 12.261, al.
implacability, BGU 1024 (iv/v A. D.).
Hsch.:— Pass., ἀθέλγεται is drawn off or pressed out, Hp. Hum. 1 (expl. by Gal. ad loc. διηθεῖται, διεκλύεται).—For ἄθελξις v. ἄλθεξις.
filter, in Pass., Diocl.Com. 7.

definition: ἀθέλεος, ον, ( θέλω) = sq., dub. l. A. Supp. 862 (lyr.).

children.definition: unwilling, Hsch. Adv. -τως Aspas. ap. Ath. 5.219d.
implacable, A. Supp. 1055, Lyc. 1335.
not beguiling or seductive, Μοῦσαι Auson. Ep. 12.26.
without foundation, Ep. word implied by Hsch. ἀθέμηλος· οὐδὸν οὐκ ἔχουσα οὐδὲ θεμέλιον, and ἀθεμίλιος· ἀκροσφαλής, ψεύστης.

definition: ἀθεμελίωτος, ον, = foreg., Hsch.; ἀ. οἰκία, of a ship, Secund. Sent. 17.

children.definition: lawless, Pi. P. 3.32, 4.109, E. Ion 1093 (lyr.): Comp. -ίστερος Opp. H. 1.756.

lawlessness, App. BC 2.77 (pl.).
lawless, godless, ἀνήρ Od. 18.141; freq. in phrase ἀθεμίστια εἰδώς versed in wickedness, 9.428, etc.; ἀ. ἔργα Xenoph. 12, Man. 2.301.

definition: ἀθέμιστος or ἀθέμιτος, ον, (the former in Poetry, the latter more correct in Prose)

children.definition: unlawful, freq. in neut., ἀθέμιτα ἔρδειν Hdt. 7.33; ποιεῖν X. Mem. 1.1.9; εὔχεσθαι Id. Cyr. 1.6.6; -ιστα δρᾶν S. Fr. 742 (dub.), Din. Fr. 89.4S.; κείνοις δʼ οὐκ ἀθέμιστον IG 14.1389ii29:— ἀ. εἰδωλολατρεῖαι 1 Ep.Pet. 4.3: c. dat., αἷς [θεαῖς] ἀ. νεκρὰ σώματα PTaur. 1 ii 22 (ii B. C.).
unlawful marriage, Just. Nov. 154.1:— Adj. ἀθεμιτό-γαμος, ον, Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(4).196 ( Rhetor.).

without God, denying the gods, esp. those recognized by the state, Pl. Ap. 26c, etc.: applied to Diagoras, Cic. ND 1.23.63; παράδειγμα ἄ., opp. θεῖον, Pl. Tht. 176e.

reckless, impious, Hsch., EM 25.1; cf. sq. [ἀθερίζω]

definition: ἀθερίζω, Hom. (only pres. and impf.): aor. 1 ἀθέριξα A.R. 2.477, 488:— Med., aor. 1 ἀθερίσσατο D.P. 997:—

children.definition: make light of, c. acc. pers., οὔποτέ μʼ οἵγʼ ἀθέριζον Il. 1.261; οὔ . . τινʼ ἀναίνομαι οὐδʼ ἀ. Od. 8.212, cf. Man. 6.217: abs., Od. 23.174: also c. gen., A.R. ll.cc.
smelt, Atherina hepsetus, Arist. HA 570b15, Call. Fr. 38, Dorio ap. Ath. 7.285a, etc.:—also ἀθερῖνος, ὁ, Arist. HA 610b6.
Zonar.
Act., χαλκὸς ἀ., i.e. ὁ ἀθερίζων καὶ οὐδενὸς ἔχων λόγον, A. Fr. 128 (cod. -ιτον).

children.label: II
children.definition: θερίζω) not reaped, Thphr. HP 8.11.4, PTeb. 72.372 (ii B. C.), PFay. 112.13 (i A. D.).
not heated; ἑστία A. Ch. 629, either a cold hearth, or (as Sch.) a household not heated by strife or passion.
without warmth; τὸ ἄ. Pl. Phd. 106a.
surgical instrument for extracting splinters, Heliod. (?) ap. Orib. 46.11.30; cf. ἐθειρολόγος.
bearded like ears of corn, Thphr. HP 7.11.2.
faithlessness, fickleness, Plb. 2.32.8, LXX Je. 20.8, al., IPE 12.352.16 ( Chersonesus, i B. C.), D.S. 18.32: pl., ἀ. εἰς αὑτούς Plb. 4.29.4.
lawlessness, EM 25.7.
unlawful, Suid.
living a lawless life, lawless, -βια φρονεῦντες Hp. Ep. 17.
joined in lawless love, Lyc. 1143.
LXX 3 Ma. 5.12, Ph. 2.165, J. BJ 7.8.1, Plu. Caes. 10. Adv. -μως LXX 3 Ma. 6.26 (v.l.), Hsch.
eating unlawful meats, Man. 4.564.
not to be entreated, inexorable, of the Erinyes, Hsch.

beyond even a godʼs power to express, unutterable: or not according to a godʼs utterance, unblest, portentous, awful, ὄμβρος, θάλασσα, νύξ, Il. 3.4, Od. 7.273, 11.373; vast, ἀ. οἶνος, σῖτος, Od. 11.61, 13.244; βόες 20.211; of great beauty, ὕμνος Hes. Op. 662; φρὴν ἱερὴ καὶ ἀ. Emp. 134.4.—Once in Trag., ἀ. θέα E. IA 232 (lyr.).

set at naught a treaty, promise, etc., πίστιν Plb. 8.36.5; θυσίαν LXX 1 Ki. 2.17; διαθήκην Ep.Gal. 3.15; θεόν 1 Ep.Thess. 4.8; σύμφωνον OGI 444.18 ( Ilium); deny, disprove, τἀληθές Phld. Rh. 1.5 S., cf. Sign. 37 ( Pass.):— Pass., to be struck off a register, PTeb. 74.29 (ii B. C.); to be rejected, of a petition, POxy. 1120.8 (iii A.D.):—Astrol., cancel, render ineffectual, Vett.Val. 115.3, cf. 105.8 ( Pass.).
refuse oneʼs assent, τοῖς ὑπὸ Τιμαίου εἰρημένοις Plb. 12.14.6.
deal treacherously with, break faith with, τινά Plb. 9.36.10, LXX Is. 1.2, Ev.Marc. 6.26; εἴς τινα LXX 3 Ki. 12.19; ἐν Ἰσραήλ 4 Ki. 1.1: abs., IG 12(5).129 ( Paros).

children.label: II
children.definition: reject as spurious, D.H. Din. 9, D.L. 7.34, etc.

children.label: III
children.definition: to be unsuitable, unfit, Diph. 1 D.
a breach of faith, transgression, D.H. 4.27 (v. l.), LXX 3 Ki. 8.50 (pl.); cancellation, annulment of grant, PTeb. 124.9.
to be cancelled, BGU 1028.17 (ii A. D.).
a setting aside, abolition, ἁμαρτίας Ep.Hebr. 9.26, cf. S.E. M. 8.142; ‘annulling’ of a deed, PLond. 2.142.24 (i A. D.).

children.label: II
children.definition: rejection (of a spurious passage), A.D. Synt. 5.8, D.L. 3.66; generally, rejection, opp. ἐποχή, Cic. Att. 6.9.3.

children.label: III
children.definition: breach of faith, Vett.Val. 191.24 (pl.).
one must set aside, Plb. 3.29.2.
cancelled, ἡμισφαίριον Heph.Astr. 2.11.
without position or place, μονὰς οὐσία ἄ., στιγμὴ δὲ οὐσία θετός Arist. APo. 87a36, cf. Metaph. 1016b25, 1084b27, Dam. Pr. 22.

data.quote: μονὰς οὐσία ἄ., στιγμὴ δὲ οὐσία θετός

children.definition: not in its place, i.e. lying about, πλίνθος, λίθος, IG 1.322i10,22.
not adopted, Posidipp. 39, Anon.Rhythm. Oxy. 9iv16.

children.label: II
children.definition: wasted, useless, χρόνος Plb. 18.9.10; unfit, to be rejected, πρός τι D.S. 11.15: c. dat., ῥευματισμοῖς, σπληνικοῖς, Dsc. 1.128, 2.70.6; of persons, incompetent, PAmh. 2.64.12 (ii A. D.). Adv. -τως, = ἀθέσμως, lawlessly, despotically, A. Pr. 150 (lyr.); unsuitably, ἔχειν πρός τι Plu. QConv. 2.715b, Philum. Ven. 2.3.
want of observation, D.S. 1.37.
without examination, Hdn.Gr. 2.934, Suid.
not seen, not to be seen, Antipho Soph. 67, D.S. 2.35, Arist. Mu. 399b22; ἄγνωστος καὶ ἀ. Procl. in Prm. p.799S.
not scientifically considered, διαφοραί Aristox. Harm. p.35 M.; τὸ ἀ. M.Ant. 1.9 (prob.); οὐκ ἀ. not without considered meaning, J. BJ 5.5.4.

children.label: II
children.definition: Act., not having observed, not conversant with, τῶν ὑπαρχόντων Arist. GC 316a8; πολιτικῶν πραγμάτων Phld. Rh. 2.107 S.; unable to perceive, τῶν ἐναργειῶν Diogenian. Epicur. 3.25: abs., ἀ. ἐν λόγοις Plu. Pyth. 2.405a, cf. Gell. 1.9. Adv. -τως Plu. Num. 18.
non-intellectual, ἀρετή Hecato ap. D.L. 7.90.
that may not be beheld, Nonn. D. 5.305, al.; unseen, ib. 2.6.
not having suckled, EM 739.44.
= foreg., μαζοί Nonn. D. 48.365, cf. Tryph. 34.
unsuckled, Ar. Lys. 881; just weaned, Semon. 5.
not womanish, Ptol. Tetr. 69; Pythag., of odd numbers, Theol.Ar. 53.20.

definition: ἄθηλυς, υ, = foreg., Plu. Aet.Gr. 2.285c, Comp.Lyc.Num. 3.

children.definition: the city of Athens (for the pl. cf. Θῆβαι, Μυκῆναι), Hom., etc.; (sg. Ἀθήνη Od. 7.80, IG 1.373107):— Ἀθῆναι generally, = Ἀττική, of the whole country, Hdt. 9.17.

children.label: II
children.definition: Ἀθήναζε, to Athens, IG 1.27a, Th. 4.46, X. Ath. 1.16:

children.label: b
children.definition: Ἀθήνηθεν, from Athens, Lys. 13.25, etc.; poet. Ἀθηνόθεν, AP 7.369 ( Antip.):

children.label: c
children.definition: Ἀθήνησι(ν), Βοeot. Ἀθάνασι Ar. Ach. 900, adv. at Athens, IG 1.59, D. 17.28, 18.66, etc.

definition: Ἀθήναια, τά, older name of the Παναθήναια, Paus. 8.2.1: ephebic festival, IG 3.1147.

children.definition: to be wise as Athena, Eust. 1742.2.
pertaining to Athena, Dam. Pr. 90, Procl. in Alc. p.43 C. Adv. -κῶς Id. Theol.Plat. 5.33.
the temple of Athena, Hdt. 5.95, etc.
Athenian, Il. 2.551, etc.

children.label: II
children.definition: Dor. Ἀθαναῖος, sc. μήν, month in Locris, IG 9(1).385.
quality of being Athenian, Gal. 19.431.
